The space
This is a 3 bed apt. This is a small simple room for one (maybe two persons). Wi-fi is fiber optic internet, new 42-inch plasma TV, dishwasher, and access via lift.

The bathroom is shared.

This area Mercat de Sant Anton is now probably the best area in BCN, now that the old market has been totally renovated.

The street has been pedestrianised as has the area around the market so it is really wonderful and almost car-free.

A g
neighborhood_overview: Great central location that does not suffer from being too touristy, lately a lot of new trendy places have opened in the area that offer a greater choice of local places to visit.
host_about:
I have travelled quite a lot and lived in several different countries, I spent nearly 5 years in Argentina and most of that time lived in the apt listed in Buenos Aires, when I first moved there it was a fairly quiet barrio but I knew it would become something much more popular, Palermo Viejo was back then very popular with foreigners so it was obvious the place to be was across the tracks.

I now live in Barcelona and think the area I live in is perfect, as it is very central without the negative aspects of the overly tourist areas around La Rambla etc. 

The area has everything you need in terms of travel and amenities and you can stroll to the centre in 10 mins, or, in 15 mins you can walk in the other direction and find yourself close to Monjuic and the peace and greenery that it offers. I love going there to sit on the grass and read a book in the shade when it's very hot as not only is there plenty of grass and trees but you usually benefit from cool breezes as well.

name: Apartment in villa with garden&pool
description:
In "Mas Blanc", a mediterranean villa with garden, vegetable garden and swimming-pool, we offer you an apartment in the basement of the house, with private access from the garden, and a private terrace for outside meals. Parking for the car.

The space
"Mas Blanc" is a large Mediterranean house complete with garden and swimming pool, wih luscious forest surroundings in the heart of the Collserola Natural Park (Barcelona's lungs as locals say), just a stone's throw away from famous Barcelona and Catalonia's popular beaches.
Ideally situated and very tranquil, it is especially suited to couples or small families travelling by car, who want to appreciate Barcelona and its surroundings but want to avoid staying in the city centre (easily accessible by public transport in 15 min.). Relax in the peaceful setting of an expansive house with garden, pool and organic vegetable garden. Definitely for those seeking the simple things in life.

Guest access</
neighborhood_overview:
Residential area, we live in the middle of a natural forest, but we are very near from the city centre (accessible by public transport)..
You can walk to Can Cortes Restaurant or El Mirador de Can Casas, or you can drive to the small grocery store of the neighbourhood if you need some ingredients to cook in the apartment. Main courses should be done in Barcelona or either Sant Cugat del Vallès.
host_about: I enjoy the simple things in life: potting flowers, working in our vegetable garden, making jams, rocking in the hammock, napping, just listening to the birds or to the water fountain sound, swimming in the pool, snorkeling in the sea, enjoying the sun and fresh air, walking our dog in the woods, hiking, step on fallen leaves, snowshoeing in the mountains, a hot drink by the fireplace and... just start again!

neighborhood_overview:
Gracia used to be a separate town on the edge of Barcelona until it was absorbed by its larger neighbour. It is renowned for the fact that it has always managed to maintain an independent character from the rest of the city.
The narrow streets, little squares and small buildings are reminiscent of the town it used to be, but the spectrum of restaurants, bars, shops and cinemas betray its status as a part of Barcelona, Catalunya’s capital city. Gracia offers the choice of quiet sleepy side streets alongside the life and bustle of its squares.

HUTB-007447

neighborhood_overview:
Gracia used to be a separate town on the edge of Barcelona until it was absorbed by its larger neighbour. It is renowned for the fact that it has always managed to maintain an independent character from the rest of the city.

The neighbourhood is richly cultural, from the diversity of people walking its streets to street parties, human towers, live music and fireworks, a wide variety of restaurants, and cinemas, theatres and galleries. The unique architecture also adds a charm of its own.

The narrow streets, little squares and small buildings are reminiscent of the town it used to be, but the spectrum of restaurants, bars, shops and cinemas betray its status as a part of Barcelona, Catalunya’s capital city. Gracia offers the choice of quiet sleepy side streets alongside the life and bustle of its squares.

name: Lovely large room, Bethnal Green
description:
Lovely characterful room in a house belonging to an artist and a musician.

The space
A lovely large room in a late Georgian house belonging to an artist and a musician.

Our house was built between 1820 and 1830. It is characterful, and is furnished simply and comfortably, with many original features and stripped floorboards throughout. We overlook Museum Gardens, The Museum of Childhood and St John's, a John Soanes' church. It is a two minute walk from Bethnal Green Tube, which is on the Central Line and 15 minutes from Oxford Circus. Brick Lane and Shoreditch are both about a 15 minute walk away, as are Broadway Market and Columbia Road.

The room available has two sofas, one of which is a very comfortable double sofa bed. There is a shared bathroom and second loo. You are welcome to help yourself to breakfast, tea and coffee at any time, and to use the kitchen and the washing machine and dryer.

All bedding and towels are provi

neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! You won't find better than this!

Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz.

Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and every
host_about:
We are Liz and Jack.  We manage a number of holiday let properties in Fitzrovia, central London and Lymington, as well as many long let properties. We look forward to welcoming you one of our super  home from homes.

We know Fitzrovia well and can thoroughly recommend it for its central London location, great transport links (although you'll probably be mostly on foot as tourist London is very walkable!) and wide choice of bars and restaurants. It's a highly desirable neighbourhood with beautiful architecture and interesting streets. People come from all over London to enjoy some Fitzrovia life. We're lucky enough to be based here and hope to see you here too! 

When we want to head out of the city, Lymington is our favourite getaway location. You'll love this quaint seaside town on the edge of the beautiful New Forest. 

We have been letting our properties for over 15 years. We hope we've perfected a warm and professional welcome. Really importantly, you can book with us worry-free. As you'll see from our vast number of reviews, we offer a friendly, guest-focused, helpful and absolutely reliable service.  

We're very happy to help with questions (before or during your stay) or to tailor any trip to suit your needs so just let us know if there's anything we can do. We look forward to seeing you in London or Lymington!

host_about:
Hi, I'm Simon. Welcome to a collection of self contained studio suites located in one of the most fashionable and well located parts of Central London. I have lived in the area for over seven years now and I can honestly say it's one of the best places that I've lived in the Capital [and there's been quite a few!]. I'm also a seasoned traveller and like to think I have a good feel for what guests are looking for in a travel accommodation experience.
Your independent en-suite bedroom is like a small apartment and occupies a whole single floor of my house. It has its own lockable door and is directly accessible from the staircase. You also get the front door key. So you are completely independent. I live in one of the apartments, so if you want privacy and security here you have it or if you fancy a beer i can show you some local bars, restaurants and tourist sites.
In short you get a high quality en-suite double bedroom apartment, a bit like a hotel suite [linen, towels and toiletries are included and the bedroom is cleaned and prepared by a professional cleaner]. All at exceptionally competitive rates.

name: JESSIE the narrowboat in Little Venice
description:
JESSIE the narrowboat is moored in the heart of Little Venice on the north bank of the Pool of Little Venice and just opposite Brownings Island. It’s a stones throw from Paddington Station. Convenient, pretty and very relaxing.

The space
Stay on this lovely individual, comfortable boat in the heart of London and experience the capital from a different point of view.

Jessie is a 57 foot canal boat (or narrowboat) completed in 2011. She is 6 foot 10 inches wide. She can sleep 4 people in comfort, for 2 she is very comfortable. The boat has a warm inviting interior and space on deck to sit and watch the world go by. The appropriately named Little Venice (a name coined by the poet Robert Browning) is a very pretty corner of London, famous as home to hundreds of beautiful canal boats and convenient base from which to explore the capital. Two underground stations and good bus routes to all parts of the city are a short walk away. There is something very spe
host_about:
I've loved boats and water all my life. I spent long periods living on the south coast gazing at the sea and wishing I could get afloat. It was only when I looked inland to the rivers and fantastic canal system of Britain did it become possible. I have swapped a normal house for two narrowboats. I live aboard one and offer the other JESSIE (named after my late mother) for interested people to stay on while visiting London. I've made the boat as comfortable as possible and love to stay on her myself whenever I can. She has a great central position on the canal at Little Venice and I am never too far away on my other boat if needed. I enjoy sharing the fun of boats. 
You'll get a warm welcome on JESSIE.

host_about:
Hello! Thank you for visiting my place! 

My dream would be to work one day in the hospitality industry and I thank Airbnb for giving me an opportunity to start with my own place. 

I was born in France from Spanish mother and Italian father and I love travelling. This is one of the reasons why I am often out of town. I have studied finance in France and in Spain and have worked in the finance industry until last September. 

I love travelling in South America, especially in Uruguay. Most of my family lives there. The beaches are incredible, and the food is out of the world.  

I cannot live without eating that is the least to say and I cook a lot but London has the best places to eat... ask me if you need advise!  we are lucky in London for that  ... And I cannot live without going to pineapple dance studio in London, they have some great classes too - you can learn anything  ... Bollywood dances and Flamenco for instance. 

I got this place last year, and I am sad I cannot live in it as much as I want to- this is why I want others to get the chance! 

Best,

Tania

Artist house, bright high ceiling rooms for both the bedroom and office, a communal garden in a conservation area near Battersea Park. Bedroom with double bed (160x200) and a separate dressing room/exercise area. The other double height room is used as a studio/office with a desk, chair and large table. Only the communal garden is shared with residents of the converted Victorian school complex, own small intimate area for sitting and dining outside.

The space
- End of terrace two bedroom house close to Southwest corner of Battersea Park, SW11.
- Bedroom One has a large European queenside (160cm wide) bed, dressing area and walk in closet.
- Bedroom Two is used as a studio, work space.
- One bathroom with shower/bath and toilet on upper floor. Another toilet and small sink on ground floor next to kitchen.
- Large and modern kitchen/dining room with a small WC

Guest access
- there is a communal garden in our complex

neighborhood_overview:
- Battersea is a quiet family area, easy access to Battersea Park and Clapham Junction/Lavender Hill for restaurants and shops. Walk across the bridge and you will be in Chelsea or Fulham. There are plenty of direct bus routes to central London.
- Ideally located if you are in town for events in the Battersea Park (Affordable Art Fair) or the Chelsea Flower Show
- Clapham Junction is perfect if you are arriving from Gatwick Airport. Direct bus from South Kensington tube station if arriving from Heathrow Airport or 30min journey by car.
host_about:
I've been using Airbnb for a while now, both as a user and as a host. My partner and I find hotels are often boring and soul-less. What a wonderful way to explore a new place by living like a local. 

Paolo is an artist and most of the works in our homes are his. I travel often for work in the field of brand marketing.

When making a booking request, please share with us a little bit more about yourselves and the purpose of your trip/stay. We rent out our private home so I hope you can understand. Thank you.

It is also only 30 mins train away from the city, the nearest station is Bounds Green which is roughly around a 10 minute walk away.

description:
A very large and light one bedroom Victorian apartment with original wooden floors throughout and heaps of style, 60m2.
Comfortably fits a couple, and is a short walk from trendy areas of Portobello and Westfield entertainment and shopping, three tube lines, train and bus.

The space
Ground floor of a Victorian villa, a very large, airy and sunny apartment. It has one double bedroom with a very large double bed, spacious living room and separate kitchen. The place is within walking distance from great shopping, on a quiet residential street in Shepherds Bush, just off Goldhawk Road. There is a lovely neighbourhood with cafes and shops just across the road - Hammersmith Grove.
The flat is also not far from Holland Park shops and cafes (15-20 min walk max) and 20-25 min walk to Portobello Road.

This is zone 2, next to three (3) tube stations, Westfield shopping, outdoor market within 5 min walk, etc. Nearest tube: Goldhawk road Hammersmith &
neighborhood_overview:
For the lovers of long walks or bike rides - 15 min walk (5 min ride) away is Hammersmith bridge and gorgeous greenery the Thames path, which will take you to Kew Gardens and Richmond along the river.

For shorter outdoor activity- You can easily walk to Holland Park (just over the roundabout) and enjoy the tranquil green space or go for a run, go have coffee or lunch around Holland Park area (15-20 min walk max) or even get to Portobello on foot. If you chose to stay very locally - crossing the road to Hammersmith Grove will get you to some nice cafes (in about 5 minutes), like Raoul's deli and cafe, for example, the Grove restaurant and many more. There is a yoga studio as well. Should you wish to shop till you drop - within 10 minutes walk is a Westfield shopping centre, with a mind-blowing array of cafes, bars and restaurants, plus a great number of shops, a cinema and a great deal more. Right next to us is a Shepherds Bush market, an open air affair for fresh veggies a

Always happy to have likeminded guests and help in any way I can.

name: Gorgeous Modern 3 Bed Flat in Willesden Green
description:
Bright and spacious 3 bedroom flat in a lovely residential area in Kensal Green. With modern, minimalist décor and all modern conveniences, and offers an open plan kitchen, dining and living area, as well as a bath. This flat is perfect for a family, or a group of friends looking for a relaxing stay in London. The Overground and Tube station is just a 7 minute walk away with great connections into Central London.

The space
The flat has got 3 good sized double bedrooms an open plan living room/kitchen space with a dining area for 6 people. It has a good sized bathroom with a bath. It is a modern minimal space which has recently been decorated. The apartment provides hotel quality linen and towels for each guest. The neighbourhood is quiet and friendly.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Situated in the middle of Brent, surrounded by Harlesden, Brondesbury Park, Kensal Rise and Kilburn lies Kensal Green. Conveniently situated just 5 miles northwest of Charing Cross, Kensal Green has some fantastic local facilities including the newly redeveloped library, sports centre and the beautiful open spaces of Roundwood Park.

It is a 30min walk to the popular Portobello Road in Notting Hill with it's vibrant weekend market and variety of restaurants and bar and independent shops. It is a popular tourist attraction due to the Notting Hill movie and the individual character of the neighbourhood.
The flat is one tube stop away from Shepherds bush where you can find Westfields, Londons largest shopping centre with anything from high end designer shops to high street brands. There is also a variety of restaurants with flavours from all over the world and a 5 min walk from Holland Park which is one of the most affluent neighbourhoods in London.

This vibrant

name: Restful Room, Friendly House, East London
neighborhood_overview:
Truly multi-ethnic with tolerance and respect between different races and religions. A wealth of sights, smells and tastes every time you leave the house and yet very often the loudest sound is that of birds singing.
It is easy to get into central London, but my favourite round trip is much closer - a canal walk, cake and coffee overlooking the Olympic Stadium, walk along the Greenway, drop down into the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and stroll around the Wetlands, then up into Westfield for some retail therapy or a film.
host_about:

description:

The space
The flat (approx 60.75 sq m / 654 sq ft.) with Private balconies, in the City of London. The flat is near The River Thames, just 150metres from the Tower of London and is surrounded by some of the capital's most famous sights – including the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. Other sites include St Paul's Cathedral, Tate Modern, Globe Theatre, South Bank Arts centre, 'The Gherkin'. It is a fantastic base for exploring the Capital and all the major attractions.
Shakespeare's Globe Theatre is most definitely worth visiting and a trip to the West End, which is a most for the varied productions that are on all year round.

The flat is 150 meters from the Tower of London with Tower Bridge just sl
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located in the former historic core of London and is a short walk to some of the capital's most famous tourist attractions such as the Tower of London, Tower Bridge, St Pauls Cathedral, the Tate Gallery, to name just a few.
There are some very nice restaurants located within few minutes from the flat and Tower Bridge and the South Bank of the Thames.
The Tate and the Thames and Borough Market are short walking distance away from the flat. There are a number of excellent supermarkets, Pubs, and cafes within walking distance and excellent food market such as Borough market for more specialist options.
London theatre district is few tube or bus stops away or easy to get to by taxi. There are plenty of places near the theatres for pre theatre meal.
The location is also an excellent location for working in the City.

name: You are GUARANTEED to love this
description:

Blenheim Lodge is a beautiful house in a quiet upmarket residential area in North London, the perfect place to rest and recover after a busy day out sightseeing. You can take advantage of the big garden in the summer months, when it is full of colourful flowers and wildlife.

Our house is in Zone 3, 20 minutes by underground to London Bridge and Kings Cross and just 10 minutes to Camden Market. The nearest station is East Finchely and is 5 minutes walking distance from our house.


Cinema, shops, pubs and restaurants are minutes away from the house.

If you do not mind changing rooms in order to cover your requested days please contact me as I might be able to book y
host_about:
We are a happy couple who live in a wonderful house in an upmarket part of London. We have hosted students studying English for the last 10 years. We LOVE visitors and we LOVE tourists. 

We know London inside out from the tourists perspective. We have helped countless visitors enjoy their stay in the big beautiful city that is London. 

We are exceptionally welcoming and friendly and easy to get to know. 
At the moment we are looking after our daughters two Siamese cats Coconut and Splodge.  They both love attention. Splodge is very easy going but Coconut is at first a bit nervous with new people. 

WELCOME!

name: Elegant Very Central: Fitzrovia W1. King Bed, Wifi
description:
Clean modern well-equipped apt in very central desirable arty, foodie Fitzrovia, W1. King bed. Free wifi. Walk to tourist London or use the close by tubes. Head in any direction for a great day out. Amazing choice of restaurants, pubs & supermarkets

The space
You'll have a lovely stay in this very central modern, clean and pleasant well-maintained 1-bed located in wonderful Fitzroy Street, in the heart of Fitzrovia (W1T 4BL). Everything is ready to make this a comfortable and convenient stay. There's an incoming phone line and unlimited wifi.

You'll have a great time as the property is in the heart of Fitzrovia, a very desirable part of Central London (W1T 4BL). It's a wonderful and safe neighbourhood with lots going on.

PROPERTY DETAILS

The flat is situated on an upper floor (with lift) of a secure, recently renovated, residential block.

Situated at the rear of the block, the property is quiet for sleeping. The prope
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! You won't find better than this!

Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz.

Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and every
host_about:
We are Liz and Jack.  We manage a number of holiday let properties in Fitzrovia, central London and Lymington, as well as many long let properties. We look forward to welcoming you one of our super  home from homes.

We know Fitzrovia well and can thoroughly recommend it for its central London location, great transport links (although you'll probably be mostly on foot as tourist London is very walkable!) and wide choice of bars and restaurants. It's a highly desirable neighbourhood with beautiful architecture and interesting streets. People come from all over London to enjoy some Fitzrovia life. We're lucky enough to be based here and hope to see you here too! 

When we want to head out of the city, Lymington is our favourite getaway location. You'll love this quaint seaside town on the edge of the beautiful New Forest. 

We have been letting our properties for over 15 years. We hope we've perfected a warm and professional welcome. Really importantly, you can book with us worry-free. As you'll see from our vast number of reviews, we offer a friendly, guest-focused, helpful and absolutely reliable service.  

We're very happy to help with questions (before or during your stay) or to tailor any trip to suit your needs so just let us know if there's anything we can do. We look forward to seeing you in London or Lymington!

name: SUNNY ROOM PRIVATE BATHROOM PLUS BREAKFAST
description:
Our guest room & bathroom overlooks the garden. It is simply furnished with a comfortable double bed. The private bathroom has a bath & shower with towels supplied.
Breakfast is served in the kitchen where guests are welcome to make tea & coffee at other times, but we don't offer guests cooking facilities.
There is pay by phone parking in the street 7 days per week 9am-9pm

The space
The house is located in a quiet street in lively diverse Shepherd's Bush. This is a multicultural area where you will experience a taste of real life in the capital and still be only a short bus or tube ride away from all its famous tourist haunts.

Our guest room is on the second floor and is located at the back of the house overlooking the garden. The room is quiet with no traffic noise and simply furnished, light and airy double bedroom and next to it is a private bathroom for the sole use of our guests.

Ours is a typical Victorian era terraced fam
neighborhood_overview: Shepherds Bush is one of London's truly diverse neighbourhoods. Throughout different time in the day and weekend the demographic in the streets is in a constant state of flux. It is lively and urban but at the same time friendly and neighbourly. In London ethnic diversity is the norm and in the 21 years we have lived none of our family, including our teenage and young adult daughters and son have ever experienced any problems with safety even when returning home late at night. There are always people on the streets 24/7 which adds to this feeling and night buses stop right at the end of our street.
host_about:
We are Elisa and Dominic and we live in West London. For the past 20 years Elisa has been a yoga instructor, teaching private and group classes mainly in Kensington and Notting Hill. Dominic is a professional sailor who also does renovation work when not at sea. Together have 5 children aged between 25 and 33 - who have all now flown the nest.

We enjoy people, sunshine, sailing and family. We run yoga and sailing holidays around the world including regular retreats in Kerala in India, UK, Turkey, Italy, Greece and Spain.
We have been hosting guests in the spare bedroom in our home since 2010 and it has proved to be a really enjoyable experience. 

We have enjoyed meeting so many people from all over the world and getting to know them a little during their stays with us. 

We have ourselves been guests in a number of Airbnb home rentals  in Iceland, Wales, France and Spain. 

There is something rather special about staying in a less touristy location and experiencing a place with the personal touch of staying in a home with local people as their guests rather than a generic hotel room. However we also understand the importance of retaining that sense of privacy we all appreciate.

For many years we used to swap homes with other families in Europe & the US. We enjoyed the mutual respect between ourselves and our exchange partners to be respectful of each other's property.  When in the summer of 2012 London hosted the Olympics, Airbnb encouraged their ‘spare room’ hosts to rent out their whole home to visitors coming to the city.  It wasn’t uncharted territory for us to trust strangers to look after our home so we decided to give it a try.  

Even with the financial exchange involved, we have enjoyed a trusting relationships with our guests. They understand that this is our family home and not an impersonal investment rental property.  It’s been great to hear their feedback as to how much they have enjoyed living in our diverse London neighbourhood and we’ve truly appreciated the pride consecutive guests have taken in looking after our home. 

This positive experience encourages us to continue to rent our home as part of a lifestyle shift that we have embarked upon in recent years.  

We have regularly house/pet sat for friends, neighbours and extended family. Now when our home is rented we take on short, medium and long term housesits in the UK and Europe.

A fully equipped studio apartment where you feel just like in your own house. Everything is right in your studio. You get your own space, your own mini-kitchen, your own bathroom.

-Harry Potter studios by bus 142

description:
A typical Victorian Terraced London house, colourfully decorated, comfortable and homely. This is a friendly, quiet neighbourhood street with plenty of nearby restaurants, takeaways and great transport links right into the centre of London. Westfield one of Europe's largest urban shopping malls is on our doorstep. You get to feel like a local living in London but still with easy access to all the tourist areas. Convenient for airports & Eurostar

The space
Our simply furnished low tech 5 bedroom Victorian terraced family home is located in a quiet street in lively Shepherds Bush. As our own family home it provides guests with the opportunity to live in London as a local. For this listing all five of our double bedrooms are available for the use of up to 10 guests.

Guest access
This is our family home and we know that Airbnb community members are always respectful of that fact. As we are occasionally out of town and most of our grown up chi
neighborhood_overview:
Shepherds Bush itself is a prime real estate location. It is among one of the most diverse neighbourhoods in London with convenience stores and multi ethnic restaurants just around the corner from the house.

Shepherds Bush is one of London best linked transport hubs giving guests easy access to Central London, the major airports, North, West and South- West Britain.

Shepherds Bush Green is a short walk or even shorter bus ride away from our home and is a bustling metropolitan centre with market, theatres, cinemas, music venues, gyms, night clubs, and the massive Westfield Shopping Mall with its comprehensive shopping ranging from Tiffany to Marks and Spencer, Prada to the Disney Store.

The BBC Television Centre is also just around the corner with its new high end restaurants, Soho House and TV studios. The London College of Fashion and the University of The Arts is also based in Shepherds Bush making this area popular with media types and fashion folk

host_about: Hey, I'm 39 years old, I work in publishing in the West End. I'm originally from Manchester (yes, I support Man U!). I love living in Hackney because of the great vibe here and all the amenities, from pubs, bars and clubs to beautiful parks, the canal and the lido. I enjoy running, yoga, travel, festivals reading good books, good TV shows, good food, good wine. I recently visited Rishikesh in India and I am looking forward to a summer of festivals, holidays and adventures! My favourite global locations include the Peruvian Amazon, Columbia's Caribbean Coast, Thailand, New York and India. I'm very relaxed and sociable. Let me know if you have any questions...

neighborhood_overview:
West Green is an area of North London, England in the United Kingdom and part of the London Borough of Haringey. It is an inner-suburban area located 5.7 miles (9.22 km) north of Charing Cross.

The area is mainly residential and includes both Chestnuts and Downhills parks. Its area is roughly defined by Downhills Park in the North and Northeast, by Cornwall Road to the East, a line running between Cranleigh and Stanley Roads to the South, Harringay Road and Stanmore Road to the West and Northwest.

There is a king size bed in the master bedroom, with Siberian goose down duvet and Hungarian goose down pillows, a 40' flatscreen smart TV (with Netflix and Amazon) and ample wardrobe space.

In the second bedroom there is a single bed, but it's a very large room so for those who require extra beds / travelling with kids we have a double air mattress we can inflate and make up for you. (With the single bed and the double air mat
neighborhood_overview:
About the area:

Muswell Hill is a highly sought after area known for its intellectual, artistic, musical and literary associations. The area has retained most of its village atmosphere and charm; it is a lovely area packed with trendy wine bars, great pubs and a good selection of yummy restaurants. There is also a large Marks & Spencer Food hall, Planet Organic, Sainsbury's and Waitrose supermarkets, Bill's restaurant, Bob's cafe (both excellent for families with children), Carluccio's, Pizza Express, the award winning Toffs fish and chip shop, as well as a plethora of boutique fashion outlets and coffee shops and an Everyman arthouse Cinema, all within 10 mins walk.

We live on a quiet, friendly street with free parking. Our neighbours are especially friendly - one of the many reasons why we love our home!

We are also just a 15-20 minute walk from Crouch End and Highgate village, both lovely village-y areas with fabulous restaurants, bars and coffee s

name: Quiet double room, with friendly, experienced host
description:
A double room in a stylish and quiet flat, my place isn't in tourist London, so you can live like a real Londoner for your days here! But it isn't far to the centre with public transport. There's a full description below, but don't take my word for it, check out the 130+ positive reviews!

The space
Hi there!
My place is a two bedroomed architect-designed apartment, in a lovely street of little houses. A double room is available, for a maximum of two people. You will share the apartment with me, Matthew.
Like London, the place is modern on the inside but old on the outside!

Guest access
WHAT IS YOURS: Your room has a double bed (140cm wide), with lots of storage and a desk. The bed is made up with linen, and towels are provided, and there is a hairdryer and a European socket adaptor
WHAT IS SHARED: You share with me the open plan living room with high, roof-lit ceiling, and a piano if you want to play!

Please feel f
neighborhood_overview:
WHERE: The apartment is in Southwark, south of the Thames. To be clear, this location is 16 mins walk from the Underground at Elephant and Castle, is not in tourist London and not right next to nightlife and shops. If you want to roll out of bed right in the middle of town next to an underground station, then this is not the place for you. The area is a residential area just south of the centre of London.

So if you need somewhere comfortable, clean, sunny, and quiet, that is easy to get into town from, in an interesting multicultural area where real people actually live, then this apartment is great!

Central London is pretty big. Yet thanks to the bend in the river Thames, the flat is equidistant to most places of interest - Westminster, Soho, the West End, Covent Garden, and the City of London are a short bus journey away.
The area isn't London's most glamorous, but it is convenient.
Local facilities are great for buying provisions. Not only are good
host_about:
I am an architect and architectural journalist, as well as hosting, I have been lucky enough to have been a guest many times, from one end of the world to the other - I have airbnb'ed literally from Albuquerque, to Zanzibar!

If you are wondering, the picture shows me in a motorway service station in France, showing how far we had got on a trip to Spain (i.e. under half way) before my new car broke down!  Hmmm I am not lucky with cars ... 

(Si necesitas, hablo espanol....! Si vous avez besoin, je me debrouille en francais...!)

The brand new well stocked kitchen houses a dishwasher and microwave plus all kitchen essentials including a pod coffee machine. (Phot
neighborhood_overview:
Crouch End and environs
Crouch end is a great area. Many of its population come from the creative industries; television, music, film, theatre and publishing who are drawn to the area for its laid back atmosphere and cafe society. The nicest thing about the area is that there are mainly independent shops rather than chains. Shopkeepers know the locals by name and it gives the area a more eclectic vibe. It's popular with young people and with families so it has something for everyone.

You will never go hungry in Crouch End! There are so many good cafes and restaurants, all very reasonably priced. Whatever kind of food you like, you will find it within a mile of the flat. But mostly just a five minute walk. I can recommend places based on your tastes so please ask.

There are two great cinemas just five minutes walk from the flat.

There are also four supermarkets and dozens of small food shops open til late, organic shops, butchers, fishmongers and w
host_about:
I'm a pretty sociable Londoner and regular traveller. I'm also a qualified acupuncturist so my life is full on! I've travelled a great deal; Europe, North and South America and much of Asia and have friends all over the world. 

I have just bought a beautiful holiday home near Ficulle, Umbria. It has one bedroom, kitchen /diner/living room /garden /shared pool and sleeps 4. It's in a stunning area rich with art, history, food and nature. Hilltop cobbled stone villages, natural lakes, festivals and glorious scenery make it a fabulous place to visit all year round. 

I love London. It's a great city that offers something for everyone. You'll want to see all the main sights like Buckingham Palace, the houses of parliament, the Tate galleries and Big Ben but if you really want to experience London, then there's nothing better than staying with a local. I'm a big foodie, as are many of my friends, and London's cafes and restaurants are some of the best in the world. I'm a bit of a culture vulture and to me that means everything from local markets to galleries, small music venues and pop up shops. I like the quirky, the revealing as well as the traditional.   I have a sense of humour, enjoy good conversation and plenty of laughs. 

I'm used to having people staying and I visit friends regularly. I like to feel at home wherever i go and my home is the kind of place you can relax.

name: West London,loft ensuite, 5min2tube
description:
Large, light and spacious loft bedroom with a newly decorated ensuite shower room and only 5 minutes to the tube in Hammersmith.

The space
We are providing a large double bedroom and will suit either a couple or small family travelling together.

This is for a bedroom in our 4 bedroom house that we currently live in.

Our aim is to make your stay in London as comfortable and as pleasant as possible and that you take away wonderful memories of your stay and visit with us! We hope to be able to point you to the best foodies places, the unique markets and even the gems in the touristy spots.
If you are not here to sight-see but are looking for a temporary home whilst you set yourselves up in this lovely city we now call home, we hope to be able to point you to all the various neighbourhoods in London (as between us, I think we've lived pretty much all of London!) and provide you with as much guidance and assistance as you wish.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is extremely convenient for someone like me who doesn't drive as I am never more than one hour away from anywhere in London that matters to anyone due to the amazing transport links we have available.
The river is a mere 5 minutes away and that provides for a very relaxing riverside walk especially during the long summer months and there is also a children's playground just across the road.
My favourite green space is Bishop's Palace and Bishop's Park which is a 15/20 minute walk away and that almost does not feel like you are in Central London.

There are also numerous cheap eats and independent cafes not more than 5 minutes walk away - so extremely convenient for grabbing a quick bite. For something very special the River Cafe is just a skip and hop away.
host_about:
Eilinn, Yoon our daughters Surei and Sukyi would like to welcome you to our Victorian house that we have recently lovingly renovated.  We have both lived and worked in London for more than 10 years now (and counting) and are real foodies! So if you are here to explore the food scene, we will be happy to provide suggestions of interesting places to visit!

Please do drop by to say hi but only if you are baby friendly!

name: Room in relaxed family house!
description:
Lovely friendly house, close to central line underground station. Pretty sure you'll enjoy your stay.

The space
Welcome!

I have a five bedroom modern townhouse in East London. It is just 8-11 minute walk to nearby Leyton underground station. It is close to local amenities, and about 15 minute walk from Europe's largest shopping mall, Westfield.

The place is close to public transport connections, and of course, I will be here to give advise on the sights of our beautiful and historic city.

If you are a nature lover, then the house is close to Epping Forest; and if you're sporty, there are places to go cycling, horse riding, ice skating and rowing. And there is a nearby gym and leisure centre. If you're a foodie, you will also have a feast!

The room is a double room, TV, chair, cupboard and chest of drawers. You also have complete access to the shared relaxed lounge and kitchen.

The house is cosy and warm with
neighborhood_overview: People are friendly here and we are all neighbourly and support each other
host_about:
Hi, 

I am a friendly mum of three grown-up teenagers and I have welcomed many guests from around the world, including Colombia, Germany, Yakutia in Russia to name but a few. So I am used to understanding the needs of different cultures. 

I also speak a bit a French and Spanish and live in London a city of life and and energy and traditional features.

I am a bit of a sports fan especially watching football and playing squash and tennis. 

I also love singing although am told I can't sing, so I try to do it when no one is around. I like DIY and have just finished project managing the garden from beginning to end.

Looking forward to meeting you during your trip to London!

name: You Will Save Money Here
description:
Blenheim Lodge was built in 1878 when there were only horses and coaches travelling on the roads. If you are travelling by car we have off road parking in front of our house. East Finchley is a safe friendly area. Our house is about five minutes walk to the tube train station, shops, pubs and restaurants. There are parks nearby and the Phoenix cinema is the oldest continually running cinema in England.

The space
This room is located on the ground floor of the house. It is lovely, a good size with a double bed and has a 'Great Britain' theme!

A lovely, plentiful breakfast is included in the price of the room.

Blenheim Lodge is a beautiful house in a quiet upmarket residential area in North London, the perfect place to rest and recover after a busy day out sightseeing. You can take advantage of the big garden in the summer months, when it is full of colourful flowers and wildlife.

Our house is in Zone 3, 20 minutes by underground to
neighborhood_overview: We have a unique cinema called the Phoenix which is supposed to be the oldest continually running cinema in the country. There are nearby parks including Kenwood where part of the movie " Nottinghill"  was filmed with Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant starred.
host_about:
We are a happy couple who live in a wonderful house in an upmarket part of London. We have hosted students studying English for the last 10 years. We LOVE visitors and we LOVE tourists. 

We know London inside out from the tourists perspective. We have helped countless visitors enjoy their stay in the big beautiful city that is London. 

We are exceptionally welcoming and friendly and easy to get to know. 
At the moment we are looking after our daughters two Siamese cats Coconut and Splodge.  They both love attention. Splodge is very easy going but Coconut is at first a bit nervous with new people. 

WELCOME!

name: A double Room 5mins from King's College Hospital
description:
Calm sunny double room with a queen size bed and a soft mattress in a quiet Zone 2 period flatshare in Loughborough Junction between Denmark Hill and Brixton. A short walk to excellent transport links with easy access to the centre of London, West End & City. A vast range of bars restaurants and local amenities walking distance in nearby Camberwell and Brixton. Modern shared kitchen and bathroom. No idea why Airbnb say it is in Stockwell. Nothing against Stockwell but it's not in Stockwell.

The space
Sunny, furnished room with double bed in a shared apartment on a quiet street in Camberwell. It is a 4 bedroom apartment and there are usually 2 girls and 2 boys staying, sometimes Trevor is at home and sometimes he is away, in which case Elsa the housekeeper or Emi the neighbour may let you in. The shared kitchen is also a communal space where you can prepare and eat your food or work at the table. The most important thing is the calm and peaceful atmosphere of the
neighborhood_overview: We love that in Loughborough Junction we live in a quiet house on a calm street yet we have live music seven nights a week 2 mins from our doorstep and we're 15 mins by foot to Brixton and it's food markets and night life and 15 mins by public transport to the South Bank with all it's bars, restaurants, galleries, theatres, concert halls and views.
host_about:
Whether you need a short term base whilst you find a job or more permanent accommodation or if you're just looking for a convenient point from which to explore London, I'll be delighted to host you. Ideally situated just 5 mins from Loughborough Junction train station, my house is far from luxurious but you can get to it from anywhere in the world.

I'm an Englishman who works in the arts who is happy to welcome anyone from anywhere to my two man, two women apartment. I am often travelling, so sometimes I won't be here during your stay but my archaeologist flatmate Jack, friendly neighbour Emi or housekeeper Fatima, will check you in whenever possible but this is my home and not a hotel so please understand that sometimes it simply isn't possible to acceot your reservation even when the dates are free on my calendar.

This lovely flat is spacious, spotless and funky chic. The glass covered conservatory where breakfast is served opens out to private garden, lovely to look out on a rainy day or to read the morning newspaper on a sunny day.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Holland Park borders Notting Hill and is filled with trees, and a beautiful park (10 minutes walk) that shares its name. Withing a 20 minute walk you can visit the famous Portobello Market for antique shopping or fresh produce and food stands, the chic shops of Westbourne Grove or bookstores and delicatessens along Holland Park Avenue. In the middle of the city, this neighborhood is an oasis of peace.
host_about: I love people, and love having people in my home. I love to cook and do a large dinner party nearly every week. I am an entrepreneur and work in the internet business. I am passionate about vegetable gardening. I'm American but Nomadic in spirit and have lived in the UK for most of the last 22 years except for 5 in France. I speak French and Italian.

name: Large cosy modern London house
description:
The space
We have a friendly cat, Monty, who will be at the house while we are away and will need to be fed everyday. We have adjusted the price to reflect this. This lovely modern house in a quiet no through road, 2mins walk to Ladywell village/ station / shops / buses and great gastro pubs. 3 mins walk to green spaces such as Ladywell fields and hilly fields both of which have received extensive investment. 10 mins to London Bridge / 20 mins to Charing Cross. Historic Greenwich and Dulwich are a short bus ride a way.

The house amenities include:

- 1 double, 1 twin and 1 single room.
- Master bedroom room with King size bed and floor to ceiling sliding wardrobe with ample storage space.
- A luxurious bathroom with large shower bath / power shower / heated towel rail / stone flooring.
- A 27 foot living/dining area with 37 inch flat screen TV.
- Wifi
- Internet TV with netflix/prime
- A 55 ft mature garden for bbq's.
neighborhood_overview:
Ladywell village is a 2 minute stroll away where you will find an excellent range of shops and places to eat. Fancy a sour dough pizza? Then check out the stylish new pizza place. Or maybe you'd prefer something spicy then the Indian food restaurant will serve you up some hot classic dishes. If traditional British is what you are after then the Ladywell Tavern pub serves delicious food and has a great selection of craft beer.

For a hearty breakfast there is a chic coffee shop Oscar's, a French patisserie La Delice and a workman's cafe which serves up a full English breakfast.

Of the many shops in the village some highlights are a local butcher's, a delicatessen and a gift shop.
host_about: I'm a friendly Londoner. I enjoy traveling and experiencing new places.

neighborhood_overview: Start the day at a cosy nearby breakfast bar, or stop off for a takeaway coffee ready for a brisk stroll along the river. Wander into a historic pub for a leisurely lunch, or browse the stalls at the famous Borough Market.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Simon. Welcome to a collection of self contained studio suites located in one of the most fashionable and well located parts of Central London. I have lived in the area for over seven years now and I can honestly say it's one of the best places that I've lived in the Capital [and there's been quite a few!]. I'm also a seasoned traveller and like to think I have a good feel for what guests are looking for in a travel accommodation experience.
Your independent en-suite bedroom is like a small apartment and occupies a whole single floor of my house. It has its own lockable door and is directly accessible from the staircase. You also get the front door key. So you are completely independent. I live in one of the apartments, so if you want privacy and security here you have it or if you fancy a beer i can show you some local bars, restaurants and tourist sites.
In short you get a high quality en-suite double bedroom apartment, a bit like a hotel suite [linen, towels and toiletries are included and the bedroom is cleaned and prepared by a professional cleaner]. All at exceptionally competitive rates.

name: Room with a garden
description:
Nice room in house in the West Hampstead area - Camden. Very well connected to the town centre (the room is in zone 2, tube jubilee, overground and Thames Link) and the airports (Luton and Gatwick by train, Heathrow by tube and Heathrow express, Stansted by bus to Finchley Road). Very nice high road with easy access to local parks and Hampstead Heath. Nice coffe houses and bakeries as well as restaurants.
Kitchen use limited to coffee/tea.

The space

Very close to ESCP business school.
Internet and basic kitchen use.
Very safe area.

Guest access

Other things to note
Safe, friendly and sophisticated.
neighborhood_overview:
West Hampstead is, to all intents and purposes, just one street - West End Lane. It is located in the London Borough of Camden, in zone two of the London Underground. It borders Belsize Park/Finchley Road to the east, and Kilburn/Willesden to the west. In the north are Cricklewood and Golders Green, whilst to the south lie uber-refined St. John's Wood and Maida Vale. The area is home to three train stations (all, confusingly, called West Hampstead!) and is a bona fide yuppie stronghold.
Though West Hampstead is hardly a place that springs to mind when you think nightlife, it has a smattering of good restaurants, pubs and bars. On the whole, the area's watering holes are towards the swankier (and pricier) end of the spectrum, and places tend to feel more mature feel than, say, Camden Town.

In terms of nightclubs, Lately on West End Lane is a charming old-school dancing spot, whilst the Lower Ground Bar (also on West End Lane) flaunts its status as "West Hampstead's Premi
host_about: Love travelling and meet people.  Will leave property as found.

neighborhood_overview:
Walworth is a central district in the London Borough of Southwark. This area is in the process of serious regeneration and gentrification.

The Artworks Elephant near Elephant & Castle station, is a trendy box park made of second-hand shipping containers - there are bars, cafés and restaurants on the ground floor, including tiny French eateries. It additionally functions as a creative hub with two floors of studios and a temporary council library.

Classic and newer release films are currently being shown by Backyard Cinema at Mercato Metropolitano, a huge indoor food venue and Italian supermarket in Newington Causeway.

Bermondsey Street and its trendy bars are 5 mins away. Borough Market and its food stalls is 15 mins away, by walk.

The local council swimming pool and gym is at The Castle Centre in Elephant & Castle.

The East Street Market off Walworth Road, known locally as "The Lane", is a busy general market selling everything

name: Beautiful, Luxurious Art Deco  +private bathroom
description:
Enjoy a wonderful bedroom, beautiful view, and your own ensuite in this luxurious space! This unique space is great for romance, a quick break, work adventures, or a great starting place for coming to live in London. We're in the heart of one of London's trendiest neighbourhoods!

The space
I have a lovely room for non-smoking guests in my flat in an Art Deco 1920s building in trendy Hackney, Zone 2.

The beautiful, unique building really is an oasis of calm within the excitement and bustle of the area, which is nearest to Hackney Central tube station on the orange Overground line, where it's easy to get into town on public transport.

I live at the property with my partner Shane but we are out a lot of the time.

The building is a lovely converted Art Deco former electricity showroom and demonstration hall from the 1920s, so it's nearly 100 years old. My flat is relatively spacious and I like to decorate it in a homely fashion with
neighborhood_overview:
Over the past 10-15 years, Hackney has changed a lot. It used to be very poor, and indeed there still is a lot of poverty in places. But it is a vibrant, interesting neighbourhood, with a multi-cultural vibe, people of many ethnicities, plenty of families living here, and lots going on. It retains its 'urban grit' and cool edge.

We are located in travel Zone 2 which means not right next to the busy, noisy tourist traps, but in a place where it's fairly quick to get to central London and there is the space and beautiful garden instead! The full postcode is E9 6DW so you can see for yourself.

New cafes, bars, pubs and clubs have been springing up on our doorstep for some years or so and there are lots of nice restaurants nearby if you don't always want to travel into town. There are also City Farms, museums, and lovely walks along the canal and River Lea just 15 minutes' walk away.

There still is evidence of social problems which you can't really get aw
host_about: I'm a down-to-earth, friendly person who works on my own little social enterprise about cargo bikes.I love spending time with my family, cafes and coffee, enjoying the outdoors, and reading novels. I have enjoyed making my home comfy, quirky, cute & funky - I hope! I love living in my area of Hackney and very much enjoy welcoming guests to my place to enjoy London as much as I do. I hope I can show you the fun stuff that locals find and help you soak up the atmosphere. I have travelled to a few places in my time such as Iceland, Sri Lanka, Romania, Canada, Denmark and my favourite: South of France, but really I am a home girl at heart!

name: 4 bedroom (+nursery) designer pad Belsize Park
description:
The space
4 bedroom (+ nursery) stylish terraced house in the heart of fashionable Belsize Park

We live in a traditional Victorian terraced house, althought the interior is very contemporary. Our house is filled with light and is very big and spacious. There are four large bedrooms - one with a super-king size bed and an ensuite bathroom, the second with a queen-size bed, the third and fourth with small double beds. We also have a nursery fully equipped with a crib, changing table and all the amenities needed for babies/toddlers. We have a large eat-in kitchen with a working fireplace that you can enjoy in the winter and a lovely terrace overlooking the green gardens which you can enjoy in the summer.

Our house is very welcoming and we have all the amenities to make your stay extra special - we are coffee addicts so you can chose to start you morning either using our Nespresso machine and milk frother to make yourself that lovely cappuccino first thing
host_about:
We have a beautiful home in the heart of Belsize Park, a really fashionable and beautiful part of London. We love having people at our place and sharing our love of London with them.  We have two sweet kids and that means we also are well equipped to host families. We can arrange for babysitting or cleaning services - all to make your stay as smooth and enjoyable as possible. We are also real foodies and will provide a lot of recommendations on excellent eating options in our hood and beyond. 

Yael

I speak out of experience, so if you are a person that leaves a trail of untidiness an
neighborhood_overview:
The nearest tube station to my flat is Great Portland street.
3 lines stop there, the Circle line (yellow), the Hammersmith & city line(pink) and the Metropolitan line(purple).
The flat is only 3 min walk from lovely Regents park. That my neighbourhood is a very quiet, clean and leafy green residential area. At the same time, my flat is in zone 1 of the tube network and you actually can walk to the west end, max. 30 min. if you like walking.
A 5min walk from my place is a very nice independent small Turkish supermarket that is open 7days a week.Also...
There is a traditional English Breakfast Cafe.
There is a male and female hairdresser.
There is a dry cleaners.
There is a news paper agent (shop).
There is a off licence shop(alcohol).
There is a second supermarket a 5min walk that has it's own Deli and Bakery.
host_name: Let'S Dance, Put On Your Red Shoes
host_about:
Welcome :)

Hi, I hope you are all well and safe and looking forward visiting fabulous London once again!

*********************************
“Latest update, Thursday25th of August 2022.”

I have to point this out, because it is just happening to many times this year!

Please it is you the guest's responsibility to keep me ,updated about your arrival times and any delays and any changes in your travels.
It is showing courtesy.

Also...
I am afraid I can not accept bookings from people who have no information on their profile. 

I  also can not accept bookings from people who have not given proper identification to Airbnb.

Phone number or email address does not qualify as proper identification!

If you book a room in a hotel, you have to give your identification for security reasons, well the same here.

Thank you.
*********************************

My quarters are separated by sliding doors from the rest of the flat.
So social distance is no problem  if needed.
As your and my safety is my priority as ever before!
Looking forward to be your host again...

Please have a profile photo of yourself and make sure you are verified with proper ID with airbnb, or sadly I will not be able to accept. 

This is for my own security and peace of mind...
So please do the same...thanks.

My flat is in a residential apartment building, what is a very quiet residence.
My flat is near Regents Park what is only a five  minute walk from my place. There are 3 tube stations near by and 3 bus stops with 6 different routes within a 5-8 minute walk from the flat that will take you to the centre of town within 10-15 min or out of town. My flat is a 20 min walk from the West End. I work part-time from home and part-time at the studio as a 3D model maker and lamp designer. 
I am quiet and respectful to your privacy.
I will interact with you as much or how less you want me too. 
 I love travelling, I am an ECO traveller!  For sure camping into the wild, I adore nature and respect it with all my heart. I love and do mountain biking, hiking, diving, rock-climbing ,love cooking and having a glass of wine with some good cheese with my friends and enjoy a good conversation.

I AM A MEMBER OF :

LGBTQIA+friends 
RIBA...Royal Institute of British Architects.
Amnesty International. 
Unicef. 
Shelter, help the homeless. 
Born Free foundation. 
RSPCA. 
Battersea dogs and cats home. 
Red Cross. 
Kew Gardens. 
National Trust. 
Green Peace. 
Friends of the earth.

About what Jimmy ( James),  forgot to mention in his review.
after AIRBNB warned him that his behaviour was unacceptable!
He brought a prostitute into my home!
Jeopardising security and privacy. 
He also upset neighbours with coming home every morning 4 am and banging doors.
James did not read my profile, then he would have noticed that this is an residential building and if you are planning to stay out untill the early hours then my place is NOT the right place for you to stay.

So to all future guests, if you do something like that, I will ask you to leave ASAP!

Thank you for reading my profile. 

I am looking forward hearing from you:)

The space
Lovely, bright and modern flat in the heart of East London.
One bedroom, spacious living room, balcony & bathroom.
The flat is located in Hackney on the second floor of a new building. Broadway Market is just one block away, with its lovely cafes, bars, restaurants and the organic market on Saturdays.
Shoreditch and its art galleries, cafes, resto, bars and up 'n' bustling nightlife is only 15 min walk. Vyner street and the centre of the contemporary emergent art scene is a few minutes walk. Surrounded by parks, London Fields is 5min walk, Victoria park is just 10 min walk and Haggerston Park is just a block away.
Nearest tube station is Bethnal Green (15 min walk), or Haggerston (10 min walk).
Buses a
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is Broadway Market, the market that takes place every Saturday morning is just across the bridge, the flat is in a perfect location, as you can visit the market and London Fields but still enjoy quiet afternoons indoors.
Shoreditch or Dalston are just 10/15 minutes walk, Columbia Flower Market on Sundays is a few blocks away; Victoria Park is 10 minutes walk by the lovely canal which runs a block away from the flat. Clerkenwell, famous for designers and stylish restaurants, is only 15mins walk.
Broadway Market boasts a wide range of small cafes, restaurants and local markets that are open every day. Read more about it here: http://www.broadwaymarket.co.uk/ and here https://www.facebook.com/Broadway.Market

name: Wow! Trendy Fitzrovia W1 Penthouse: Sunny Terrace
description:
Clean well-equipped apt and terrace in very central desirable arty and foodie Fitzrovia, W1. Free wifi. Walk to tourist London or use the close by tubes. Head in any direction for a great day out. Amazing choice of restaurants, pubs & supermarkets.

The space
Give your stay the wow factor in this stunning central London penthouse located in wonderful Fitzroy Street in the heart of Fitzrovia (W1T 4BL)! If you're looking for something special, this is it.

This gorgeous contemporary, light and bright, clean apartment is tastefully decorated and offers everything you'll need you'll need for an enjoyable, stylish, convenient, comfortable stay.

It is well-maintained and is offered in excellent condition. There is woodstrip flooring throughout. There is free unlimited wifi access and free Netflix (film service) through the TV.

Patio doors open to a stunning large sunny terrace. With views of two landmarks - the London Eye and the BT To
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! You won’t find better than this!

Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz.

Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and ever
host_about:
We are Liz and Jack.  We manage a number of holiday let properties in Fitzrovia, central London and Lymington, as well as many long let properties. We look forward to welcoming you one of our super  home from homes.

We know Fitzrovia well and can thoroughly recommend it for its central London location, great transport links (although you'll probably be mostly on foot as tourist London is very walkable!) and wide choice of bars and restaurants. It's a highly desirable neighbourhood with beautiful architecture and interesting streets. People come from all over London to enjoy some Fitzrovia life. We're lucky enough to be based here and hope to see you here too! 

When we want to head out of the city, Lymington is our favourite getaway location. You'll love this quaint seaside town on the edge of the beautiful New Forest. 

We have been letting our properties for over 15 years. We hope we've perfected a warm and professional welcome. Really importantly, you can book with us worry-free. As you'll see from our vast number of reviews, we offer a friendly, guest-focused, helpful and absolutely reliable service.  

We're very happy to help with questions (before or during your stay) or to tailor any trip to suit your needs so just let us know if there's anything we can do. We look forward to seeing you in London or Lymington!

Spacious and bright converted ground floor 3 bed Victorian home with garden in Homerton/Lower Clapton area in Hackney, East London. Extension comprising of open plan kitchen/lounge which fully opens up to decked/paved garden. Direct access to the garden from the street.
The home is close to green spaces and nature reserves in a very family friendly area.

Our home is in a bright and spacious converted Victorian ground floor flat. There is a very spacious master bedroom and two large double bedrooms (the second double bedroom will not be available to guests as it will be used for storage of personal belongings), and a newly built open plan kitchen/dining/living area large bi-fold doors opening up to a garden.

The garden has got a comfy lounge area with a pallet sofa and chairs and a dining
neighborhood_overview:
Our 3 bed flat is situated in Hackney in East London (Zone 2).

For nature lovers it is a few minutes walk to many parks including Victoria Park, the lovely River Lea and nature reserve areas with Hackney Marshes and Olympic park on the doorstep.

It is within walking distance to a number of weekend food/arts and crafts markets (such as Broadway and Chatsworth Road Markets), London Fields Lido heated outdoor swimming pool), a great variety of really good cafes/pubs/restaurants and the local Castle Cinema and Hackney Picturehouse.

Chatsworth Road is the closest street of note only 5 minutes walk away from the flat with two supermarkets (Co-op and Spar), restaurants/cafes, butcher, green-grocer, second hand shops, pharmacy, hair-dressers and an excellent Sunday market. The area is very safe and friendly and it has a nice village feel to it. It is also very child-friendly. Lots of local shops and restaurants are now open and are now operating with social
host_about:
We are a family with young kids living in Hackney. We love our street and neighbourhood and can't wait to introduce our guests to the area. 

Favourite places are Stockholm, Edinburgh, Hong Kong and Hackney of course!

5 bedroom family home in the heart of Stoke Newington, seconds from Church Street. The area is a quirky, vibrant village in Central London, Zone 2. Our house is a family home filled with all of our treasured possessions.

The space
Our five bedroom house is available as a whole house. The house was completely renovated in 2006 and rejuvenated in September 2016.

We prefer to host families and wedding guests and do not take bookings from stag, hen parties or groups other than families. We have a travel cot available.

We are situated in Stoke Newington, just off busy Church st, which is renowned for its countless bars, restaurants, gastro pubs and boutiques, hence a great nightlife. Our house is on a residential street a few seconds away from all the shops and cafes on Church st. The area is popular with families too because of the nearby Clissold Park, which has an incredible playground, paddling pool, animals and beautiful house and café. Ev
neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington Church st is known for its cafes, restaurants and bars. Our favourites include The Good Egg, Black Pig & White Pearls and Rasa.

We are looking forward to welcoming visitors to our home and helping them enjoy their trip!

Closer to home HMV Apollo is a 5 minute walk. Locally there is a large selection of restaurants & local pubs.

name: Lovely 1 bed Apartment Islington on Tube Stop
description:
Located in Islington Studios this apartment is a 1 minute walk to Holloway Road Tube Station (Piccadilly Line), Arsenal Stadium & London Met Uni. Incredible access to transport. Close to Kings Cross, Angel, Old Street, Dalston. While Soho and Central London are just 15 minutes by tube, you may not find a reason to leave- the flat is surrounded by cafes, restaurants, pubs, and food shops a plenty in case you feel like dining in. There's also a concierge, private communal garden & a balcony.

The space
A beautifully appointment apartment is super light, spacious, comfortable, and even has a balcony. There's a big kitchen, really light lounge with large windows, a new bed, new smart TV and new sofa bed. Bathroom has both a bath and shower. There's a private communal garden, a free gym, plus many amazing foodie places nearby. Great for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and small families.

Guest access
The entire apartment is yours.
neighborhood_overview:
Yes Arsenal Football Stadium is a stones throw away, but there's so much more too! The area is becoming a real foodie haven with the opening of great cafes, dirty burger, the chicken shop, italian pizzeria where there's always a queue, coffee roasters, a fabulous wine and cheese shop, delicious vietnamese, famous chinese, bakeries, plus there's always the long standing a great local pubs.
If it's shopping you're after, you're in luck! If the enormous amount of shops along Upper Street doesn't work for you, jump on the overland train to Westfield, or bus to Camden, or tube to Oxford Street!
There's a classic old cinema 10 minutes walk to Holloway, or walk towards Angel for the more snazzy Screen on the Green cinema (with sofas and a bar in the cinema!)
host_about: Hello! I'm a TV Producer living in this great 1 bed apartment in London, and often on the road for work. I love to both host and be a user/guest on airbnb, and understand the need for cleanliness and being considerate, whilst enjoying the space and exploring the local area. There's some great new cafes, restaurants, pubs, yoga studios, or gyms, popping up in the neighbourhood all the time, so would love to share my top recommendations with you soon! And of course we're a couple of minutes walk from Arsenal Stadium - so close you can hear the roar from the stadium on game days!

description:
In the heart of the trendy east end, this spacious garden flat offers lots of light and space. A 5 minute walk to both Whitechapel ( District/Circle, Hammersmith and City and Overland lines) and Bethnal Green ( Central line) tube stations, the apartment couldn't be better connected for sight seeing in London, both daily and also with easy access to the night tube at weekends.
In addition the local area is a thriving hub of trendy cafes and bars, with the famous Brick Lane only minutes away.

The space
Your room comes with Egyptian cotton sheets, a large wardrobe, desk, chest of drawers and Edison lamp. The apartment is decorated with original photography, film posters and some quirky artefacts, creating an eclectic and interesting space to relax after a day touring London.
The garden affords a relaxed and fragrant addition, rarely found in the heart of London, to sit and relax or smoke.

Guest access

You'd have your own private double bedroom (king size bed) with tv, private bathroom, and a shared Kitchen / diner. Use of garden room for relaxing and watching TV or videos. The house also has internet wi fi connection, washing machine and tumble dryer. We have a very pleasant garden to use on "sunny days" + a BBQ. and on hot days by arrangement a garden hot tub.
Nearby there is a bus stop, with buses that go to Woolwich, for High Street shops (10mins) the O2 ( 20 mins ) and Greenwich Park ( 30 mins ). Greenwich also has a lot more to offer a visitor including Museums, famous Craft and Antique markets, bistros , restaurants and many famous old pubs.
The house overlooks a lake so it is very quiet and tranquil. We are a 10 minute walk to the supermarket or you c

host_about:
Quiet couple. Love travel, been round the world and loved the experiences. Like films, some sports especially tennis and skiing. Like going to decent restaurants and enjoy a good glass of wine. Also like a G&T!! 
Family is very important to us. We are considerate to others needs and understand different cultures.We enjoy having friends round to the house and like small dinner parties. We are very tidy and clean and take a pride in our house and small garden.  We like to leave guests to themselves if that is what they want or they can join in with things we might be doing be it dinner at home or in a local restaurant (we really enjoy Chinese at the local Buffet  with All You Can Eat!), cinema or even shopping!

name: Big peaceful room 5mins walk from King's Hospital
description:
A large room in a very quiet flatshare in Loughborough Junction, between Denmark Hill and Brixton, close to Kings Hospital. Ideal for a quiet single person who wants a desk or a small couple. Excellent transport links to central London.

You are welcome to come home late at night if you do so quietly, mindful of our neighbours and other guests who may have to get up early in the morning for work!

No idea why Airbnb say it is in Stockwell. Nothing against Stockwell but it's not in Stockwell.

The space
Sunny, furnished room with double sofabed but with a real matress on it that is quite soft, in an old shared apartment on a quiet street in Camberwell. It is a small 4 bedroom apartment and there are usually between 1 and 4 people sharing the space here (usually 2 woman and 2 men).

The kitchen is also a communal space where you can prepare and eat your food and spend time.

2 minutes walk to 24 hour buses and Loughborough Ju
neighborhood_overview: In The Junction Bar the neighbourhood has one of the best live Jazz venues in London right at the top of the road. It also has good local beer and a nice bar menu. It is open 7 nights a week.
host_about:
Whether you need a short term base whilst you find a job or more permanent accommodation or if you're just looking for a convenient point from which to explore London, I'll be delighted to host you. Ideally situated just 5 mins from Loughborough Junction train station, my house is far from luxurious but you can get to it from anywhere in the world.

I'm an Englishman who works in the arts who is happy to welcome anyone from anywhere to my two man, two women apartment. I am often travelling, so sometimes I won't be here during your stay but my archaeologist flatmate Jack, friendly neighbour Emi or housekeeper Fatima, will check you in whenever possible but this is my home and not a hotel so please understand that sometimes it simply isn't possible to acceot your reservation even when the dates are free on my calendar.

description:
Spacious and comfortable double room with the luxury of its own bathroom.
I provide good quality linens and towels to create a hotel experience for my guests.
The room also has a dedicated work area with a large desk and office chair, a printer is also available.
There is plenty of storage space in the wardrobe and space under the bed for suitcases or luggage etc.
(I also live in the apartment and have my room with its own bathroom.)

The space
I have a beautiful and spacious spare bedroom with its own luxury bathroom available in my apartment.

I also live in the flat however I have my own bathroom as it’s a 2 bed 2 bath apartment.

The flat is large and bright with a huge terrace with views of the London eye.

Your room is a good size with plenty of wardrobe space, it's own TV and of course WIFI.
There is a large desk and office chair so there’s plenty of space if you are working from home.

If t
neighborhood_overview:
The location is just a few minutes walk from the Tate Modern, the river Thames and the Globe theatre.
This Southbank area of London is very trendy with many cafes and restaurants.
The pedestrian bridge across the Thames is right opposite the Tate modern and from here you can walk across to St Paul's cathedral.
The wonderful Borough Market and Southwark cathedral are just a few minutes away.
The Tower of London and Tower bridge and all the restaurants of Shad Thames about a 10 minute walk.

For transportation the Jubilee, Northern and Bakerloo lines are all within a few minutes walk.
Waterloo and London Bridge stations are also just under 10mins away.

It's a large modern block and there is a large late night convenience store below the building.
Across the street there are some cafes, a dry cleaners, a post office with ATM.
