My stunning stylish one-bedroom second-floor flat is large, modern, beautifully decorated, bright & spacious with high-ceilings & brand new kitchen & bathroom. A short walk from 2 subways, bus stops & local shops, & only 20 mins into Central London.

The space
I own a beautiful, large, spacious and bright second-floor one-bed apartment in Kilburn, Zone 2 Northwest London, just 20 minutes on public transport from Central London. It is available when I am on holiday. Modern and stylishly decorated with a large bright living area, wooden floors, leather sofa, large flat-screen TV plus digital and internet channels, wireless broadband and stereo. Fully equipped modern kitchen and bathroom - microwave, dishwasher, washer-drier, bath and shower. Large bright double bedroom with TV and radio. Located in Zone 2, 7 minutes walk to both Kilburn and Kilburn Park London Underground (tube) stations, 5 minutes from Brondesbury and Kilburn High Road Overground Stations, several
neighborhood_overview: The many local shops, cafes and restaurants of the buzzy multi-cultural and vibrant Kilburn High Road are right on the doorstep, but still close to pretty leafy tranquility of Queens Park, 5 minutes walk from The Tricycle cinema and theatre, and 7 mins walk from a huge supermarket. Less than ten minutes on the overland to Hampstead Heath.
host_about: I am a fun, quirky, open-minded, professional woman in my early 40s. I work as a science author, public speaker, TV presenter and climate activist. I love life and I love exploring the world. I take real pride in my flat, especially as I often work from home. It is my sanctuary and I have filled it with beautiful and stylish ornaments and paintings from my travels. And lots of plants. Please come and enjoy them all while I'm away!

name: Lovely room in cool Brixton
description:
The space
Available for you to rent is a lovely double room in a large house in cool Brixton.

The accommodation is comfortable and stylish with everything you need - free wifi, TV, Egyptian cotton sheets and stylish interiors. There is a private bathroom with separate bath and shower.

The area is fantastic, both just to explore for itself, and with great transport links to let you explore the rest of London.

There are a choice of Underground Lines, and the Tube Station is a 5 minute walk from the house. It is just a 12 minute ride to Oxford Circus for shopping or 20 minutes into the City of London for business travellers.

The immediate area is a lively cosmopolitan neighbourhood with something for everyone including high street shops, Marks & Spencers, H&M, Topshop etc. A great market which is now on London's tourist map containing excellent coffee shops, and Franca Manca Pizza Restaurant - winner of UK's best cheap ea
host_about: We are two kiwis (Kate and Malcolm) who have made their home in London. We have recently renovated our house and love living in Brixton. We hope you will come and stay with us and explore an exciting, vibrant and great area of London.

A home from home space in west London that serves as a perfect base to explore London and its surroundings.
For practical reasons I cannot take last minute bookings, a spacious double bedroom is available for rental.

Female visitors only as bathroom is shared. Children welcome. Veggie kitchen.

The space
Are you looking for somewhere to stay in London?

Welcome to a perfect base to explore London from, a spacious room, in a stylish apartment!

We have a big garden outside and a large double room available for short term visitors.

'Leafy Chiswick', as it is known, is popular and renowned for its vast selection of cafes, bars, restaurants and shops. These range from Michelin-starred restaurants to local cafes.

With excellent transport links for work or sightseeing, the location is just a 5 minute walk from Chiswick High Road.
It really is easy to get around London from here in pretty much any direc
neighborhood_overview: Chiswick is popular, close enough to the river to feel away from the intensity of urban London. A short train ride away from all the sights and sounds of the city.
host_about:
I am a Londoner and happy to welcome visitors into my home with a nice cup of tea. I have created a homely environment, comfortable and to a high standard. 

Se habla castellano. 

Chiswick is a great base for whatever I want to do in London, and I have an eclectic range of interests, so I hope it will be for you too!

description:
We welcome you to our beautiful home in the vibrant neighbourhood of Broadway Market and London Fields, Hackney in east London. The place consists of two bedrooms, large open-plan living room and kitchen, and front and back gardens.

The space
Please contact me before booking.

Overlooking Regent's Canal, it's a stone's throw from Broadway Market, and London Fields park.

The flat sleeps 4-6, with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, an open plan living room with sofa bed and kitchen with all modern amenities (over 2 floors) and fantastic front and back gardens.

The gardens will be full of beautiful organic produce and flowers during summer and autumn months. There is a patio, with outdoor table and chairs for alfresco dining. There is also a trampoline with safety net in the garden.

Upstairs:
1 large bedroom with king size (160cm) bed, built-in cupboards, a bureau with desk, and large windows overlooking the canal.

The Saturday market on our doorstep is a foodie's heaven.

Hi everyone,

Single room available to rent in a stylish and quiet ground floor flat in a Victorian House, North London. It is a convenient location, close to Turnpike Lane Tube station on the Piccadilly Line.

· 1 very spacious, newly redecorated bedroom in fully furnished two bedroom ground floor flat
· Back garden

LOCATION
· Opposite beautiful Downhill Park
· 5 minutes walk from Turnpike Lane tube (Piccadilly Line), 10 minutes walk from Hornsey station (overgound train to Moorgate)

· Many day and night buses towards Trafalgar Square, Ca
neighborhood_overview: The flat is situated in a culturally vibrant area in close proximity to bars, restaurants and high street shops. It is at a bus ride distance from a public swimming pool. You will certainly enjoy your staying.
host_about:
I am a video artist and an arts and education consultant. I love travelling both for work and to increase my spiritual and intellectual knowledge of the world. 

I would find very difficult to live without music and a good cup of coffee in the morning. I cherish intelligent and witty conversations, especially over a nice, tasty meal, and love meeting new and interesting people from other cultures.

Hosting is something that runs in my blood, as I was brought up with the idea that welcoming guests is one of the very nice things in life. Hence my choice for putting my home on the Airbnb website.

Nice people are always welcomed!

name: Comfy Family Home in London
description:
We have a comfortable, child friendly, family home in the wonderful area of Stoke Newington. Stoke Newington is a very sought after place to live in London. It's got a village feel to it with lots of families.

The space
We have a three bed house which accommodates max six people (2 single beds are for children). The design style is simple and clean with emphasis on natural light and minimal clutter. We've put a lot of care and consideration into making it comfortable and guarantee you'll be very relaxed here.

We have wireless broadband throughout the house and an excellent sound system in the lounge where you can plug in your mp3 player and enjoy your choice of music, plus radios in the bedrooms and kitchen.

Master Bedroom: This room is south facing so gets a lot of light. A snuggly king sized bed in this room. Over looks our sweet little garden with no traffic noise.

Lounge: This room gets lots of sunlight and looks out onto ou
neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington is a fabulous location in London, with quick and easy transport links to the centre of town. It's got a village feel, a community vibe which can be unusual for London. 3 min walk to Clissold Park, a large park with a big brand new playground, animal sanctuary, brand new cafe, ponds, tennis courts, skate park, leisure centre. There are lots of lovely shops, cafes and excellent restaurants.
host_about: My husband Joby and I live here with our 2 daughters age 14 and 11. We have a labradoodle dog called Lenny and a cat named Prince Nelson. Joby works in Radio and I am a complimentary therapist and life coach.  Joby is very into his music and art, I have a regular meditation and yoga practice.  We are very social, we love being outdoors, having fun.  We choose not to have a car in London as you really don't need it.  We cycle everywhere and use the buses, trains and underground.  The kids have their own bikes too.  Our favourite local restaurants are Rasa - Indian vegetarian restaurant (you must try it!) and Testis - our local Turkish food (the best!). We are quite active, swimming at our local pool, going for jogs around the park.  We love traveling where there are places to swim outdoors.  We love camping near the sea or lakes.  I am from Vancouver, Canada so we spend every other summer travelling around the Gulf Islands of British Columbia.

name: Room in Artistic house, nr Olympics
description:
The space
A quiet room overlooking the garden. I am an artisan, and there are always projects ongoing. These don't affect the room on offer, but around the house there will be timber, canvasses and other materials. There is a stereo and radio in the room, wi-fi is included, and clean sheets and towel. The bed is a double futon, with a foam mattress underneath.

Nearby are the Olympic site (a bus ride or 30mins walk along 'the Greenway'), Westfield shopping centre, Excel exhibition space, Canary Wharf, City Airport, O2 (the Dome), and local shops. Access to central London is easy with District tube line 10mins walk away. DLR, buses and Taxis are also in good supply.

Both Tate Galleries are an easy tube ride away; the Whitechapel is even nearer, as is Vyner St. with it's iconic private galleries.

Everyone is welcome; Artists, Architects, and Musicians may find particular interest here. There is a guitar in almost every room. I attend a l

name: Fabulous Hackney Flat  Victoria Park London fields
description:
Fabulous cool and vibey Hackney apartment with lovely roof terrace in Victoria Park Village - recently refurbished, in one of the most desirable areas of east London. The furniture and decor is mid-century inspired with lots of lovely plants.
The kitchen is fully equipped with very efficient appliances.
It is a very comfortable apartment to chill and relax in, yet only minutes away from a gorgeous park and superb restaurants.

The space
Fabulous contemporary first-floor living space within a London Victorian conversion.
The apartment features high ceilings, a new kitchen and bathroom, mid-century Danish furniture and local Hackney-based artists work on the walls.
The bed and mattress are new with good quality cotton bed linen - the bed is extremely comfortable and have a mattress topper.

East London is one of the most culturally rich areas in the UK - with great independently owned shops selling clothes, art, and all things vintag
neighborhood_overview: East London is one of the most culturally rich areas in the UK - with great independently owned shops selling clothes, art, and all things vintage. Hackney offers real diversity in terms of restaurants, with a cuisine to suit every palate. In addition, there are numerous bars and live gig spaces. Hackney has historically attracted artists and creatives in all manner of professions, Hence there's a strong art scene and impromptu events which pop up with great frequency. Victoria Park village has all the charm you might imagine - set in an urban atmosphere and vibe - here you'll find great locally-owned shops, which include an amazing delicatessen, freshly baked bread, a fabulous wine shop which also sells craft beers! Restaurants in the village include Italian, Cosmopolitan restaurants and 3 excellent coffee shops with delicious fresh pastries and very good coffee!! Share a sun terrace with my super friendly cat and I in my apartment in Barking town centre.

The space
This is a 2008 new build, top floor penthouse with spacious outdoor terrace in East London. It is perfect for socialising, sunbathing or just for peaceful reflection! The interior is spacious and fully furnished with stylish furniture. It is very well located, near to public transport, the town centre, a park and a gym.

The room on offer is a fully furnished double bedroom with views of Canary Wharf and has a fitted wardrobe.

As the main bedroom has its own en suite bathroom, this bedroom has the main bathroom as pratically an en suite!

Your LGBT host is a friendly gay guy, 43 years old and an adorable cat named Arthur so you must be a cat lover.

Ideal flatmates are those who work or study away from the flat or will spend time out and about sight seeing (I work from home).

The apartment is about a 5 minute
neighborhood_overview:
I live in Barking town centre, at one time the capital of England (!) and where Captain Cook got married! It also had the largest fishing fleet in England and one of the largest monasteries until King Henry burned it down in the 1600s (the church still remains and can be seen from your window). It's currently undergoing a lot of redevelopment with plans for a nearby film studio, brand new shopping centre and a new station. There are two gyms within walking distance, a multi screen cinema, three supermarkets and local shops.

Historial Barking Abbey.
Barking Park
Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park
Westfield shopping centre
the 02
Emirates Air Line
Local gay scene in nearby Limehouse features a gay club, pub sauna!

Do the Math

Hi all, im just a crazy kid in a body thats heading past 40! lol.  Love being around people that are fun, like trying new things and not afraid to push the boundaries, just like me!

neighborhood_overview: We are located in a residential pocket of Whitechapel tucked behind the brand new Royal London Hospital. You can also walk to popular tourist attractions such as the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. Our house is situated in a residential street so there is little  noise at night, and the guest room is facing the garden -you will have a great night sleep.
host_about:

My partner Lorenzo moved to London from Italia to study music and has been here for over 10 years. We love to go to gigs, watch films on our TV and enjoy good food.

I also love travelling and have travelled around South and Central America, India, Bangladesh, Papua New Guinea, parts of USA, Canada  and Europe. I spent a few months living and working in Barcelona so my Spanish is decent.

description:
We are looking forward to hosting you in our 100% covid-proof household. We are a cosmopolitan mother and son (19 years) team who enjoy sharing our lives and space with like-minded individuals while sticking to social distancing rules!
We are ideally located between the city and the countryside and well connected to buses, underground (Victoria Line) and train. Everything you need can easily be reached on foot or via a short bus ride (8-10 minutes).

The space
The room is generousm well lit and has a superb layout including your own sink area, plenty of cupboard space, a desk and chair.

We offer breakfast, but are also happy for guests to help themselves (Covid-related restrictions may apply).

Guest access
Due to Covid-19 we have restricted accees to our living room. As for using the kitchen, we will have to stick to a schedule and kindly ask you to clean the surfaces once you have finished (we will provide the anti-viral spr
neighborhood_overview:
We are a cosmopolitan family in a lovely neighbourhood nestled comfortably between the city and Epping Forest. Chingford Mount is a walking distance from our house with lovely restaurants, pubs, bars, and a great variety of shops.
We are a 15 minute bus ride (no. 34) away from Walthamstow Central (bus stop is at the bottom of the road) where the William Morris Gallery, Lloyd Park, and two fantastic landmark pubs - the Bell and the Rose & Crown (a vibrant theater incuded!) - await you.
From there you also have fast train and Underground connections to the City and London's Westend.

You can go for lovely walks along the nearby water reservoirs or you can hop on the 444 bus (directly in front of our house) which will take you all the way to Queen Elizabeth's Hunting lodge at the entrance to Epping Forest (25 minute ride).
host_about:
I am Senior Lecturer and Associate Head of Department (Languages) in the Faculty of Edcuation and Language Studies at the British Open University. I have been living in London for most of my adult life and feel very much at home here.
Having grown up in a vicarage back in Germany I am not only used to but throughly enjoy having people from all walks of life sharing my/our home. My husband, Huseyin, comes from a Turkish family where - like in many Mediterranean families - guests and visitors are not only always welcome but will be honoured and treated with respect.
We are both very much looking forward to being your hosts.

description:
Clean modern well-equipped apt in very central desirable arty, foodie Fitzrovia, W1. King bed. Free wifi. Walk to tourist London or use the close by tubes. Head in any direction for a great day out. Amazing choice of restaurants, pubs & supermarkets

The space
You'll have a lovely stay in this beautiful very Central London contemporary apartment located in wonderful Fitzroy Street in the heart of Fitzrovia (W1T 4BL). It is fully furnished with everything ready to provide an enjoyable and comfortable trip.

PROPERTY DETAILS

There is a KINGSIZE bed and free wifi access. The sofa also turns into a kingsize bed.

The flat is on an upper level (with lift) and is set out over one floor. It benefits from good natural light. The property is set at the rear of the building (so quiet for sleeping) and overlooks the local landmark, the impressive BT Tower.

The light and bright bedroom (4.1m x 2.9m) has a neutral decor. There is a
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! You won't find better than this!

Situated in Fitzroy Street, W1, we offer a top location in the heart of the West End in trendy Fitzrovia. Voted the best place to live in London by the Sunday Times (March 2016), Fitzrovia is a super central arty foodie paradise location with a villagey feel and Georgian architecture. The area was once home to such writers as Virginia Woolf, George Bernard Shaw and Arthur Rimbaud. Today it is a popular and lively neighbourhood with a residential and business mix and a bustling art scene. Over 50 art galleries (10% of all those in London) operate here. The numerous media companies based in the area feed into a trendy and vibrant buzz.

Fitzrovia has more restaurants than you'll ever get to visit (with new ones popping up all the time). Michelin stars, British pub grub, easy Italians and sandwich shops. fish n chips, Peruvian cuisine, Chinese, Greek, Indian, Mexican, Filipino. We've got them all and every
host_about:
We are Liz and Jack.  We manage a number of holiday let properties in Fitzrovia, central London and Lymington, as well as many long let properties. We look forward to welcoming you one of our super  home from homes.

We know Fitzrovia well and can thoroughly recommend it for its central London location, great transport links (although you'll probably be mostly on foot as tourist London is very walkable!) and wide choice of bars and restaurants. It's a highly desirable neighbourhood with beautiful architecture and interesting streets. People come from all over London to enjoy some Fitzrovia life. We're lucky enough to be based here and hope to see you here too! 

When we want to head out of the city, Lymington is our favourite getaway location. You'll love this quaint seaside town on the edge of the beautiful New Forest. 

We have been letting our properties for over 15 years. We hope we've perfected a warm and professional welcome. Really importantly, you can book with us worry-free. As you'll see from our vast number of reviews, we offer a friendly, guest-focused, helpful and absolutely reliable service.  

We're very happy to help with questions (before or during your stay) or to tailor any trip to suit your needs so just let us know if there's anything we can do. We look forward to seeing you in London or Lymington!

At times you may not meet up with me but please don't be alarmed. My husband is also around or you can contact me any time via Airbnb message page. I am constantly in contact with my guests to see that they have settled in nicely. My husband is a retired mental health nurse. We have 2 daughters who  are both married. I enjoy musicals, concerts, dancing and cooking. I also love travelling and meeting people from different countries. I am patient, understanding and calm. We will make your stay very pleasant and you will have a great time with us.
My motto is that I take good care of my guest as I expect the same for me when I am an AIRBNB GUEST.

name: £100 for entire one-bed garden flat in Islington!
description:
A cute one bedroomed flat in Angel Islington with its own sunny private garden.

Just five minutes walk from Upper Street with its dozens of excellent bars, restaurants, theatres & boutiques and a 10 minute walk to Kings Cross or Angel stations!

The space
ABOUT MY FLAT:

My property is a cute one bedroom garden flat just 5 mins from the tube which sleeps 2 people.

This flat, which boasts original wooden floorboards, has been recently repainted.

There is free fast wifi throughout.

The main street, Upper Street, is lined with lovely coffee shops, designer shops, antique and junk shops to rummage in and classic English pubs to sample a pint of traditional ale.

* Just moments from vibrant Angel Islington and Upper Street with loads of great restaurants, stylish bars and famous theatres and live music venues that rival the West End.

* Within walking distance to the West End and Oxford Stree
neighborhood_overview:
I honestly think Islington is one of the best places in
London – we’ve got it all: great bars, top-notch food
and great local shops.

Plus with fabulous parks, and a great cultural vibe thanks to many local theatres, a world-renowned dance venue and fascinating museums, there really is something for everyone!

The area around The Angel, Upper Street and Essex Road is of special interest to visitors it is home to a number of interesting shops selling antiques and collectibles as well as art galleries.

Diners are spoiled for choice in Islington, especially the Upper Street area between Angel and Highbury & Islington tube stations.

A wide variety of cuisine and price ranges are available. Mediterranean food dominates but with options like Indian, Afghan, Italian, French, Thai, and South American there is food for all tastes.
host_about:
My name is Debbie and I live in East London. 

I am a property renovator and love restoring old neglected homes back to their former glory.

I like eating and drinking with my friends and riding my bicycle in the sunshine, but most of all, I love to travel!

I have been lucky to travel to many amazing places around the world meeting wonderful people along the way.

neighborhood_overview:
Happening Camden! Home to the alternate and original. Noisy, grungy and always interesting, you could never be bored or un-enthused in Camden Town!

Home to the world famous Market with it’s vintage clothing, crafts and original little shops selling almost everything, it would seem, but many leaning towards clothing and music in one way or the other. Here you will find a live music scene that is envied by all, plus enough bars, clubs, music-venues, funky eateries and street food to keep even the most picky tourist fascinated and intrigued for the entire length of their stay!

The canals add a little bit of calm and serenity in an otherwise bustling and busy market atmosphere. They are very pleasant to sit beside with a drink in the summer, to walk by, or just to watch people cycling and walking their dogs. There is always a great duality here with young people hanging out and strumming a guitar with not a care in the world, and those milling around the markets, ea

name: Dbl en suite @ Oval tube Sth London
description:
In the words of a recent guest: 'The house is darling, and the room itself is lovely with its private shower. The neighborhood is close to so many interesting areas, and is a great jumping off point to embark from.
I highly recommend a stay here!'

The space
This is the spare room of a Victorian terraced house in a quiet street in a conservation area. The room is very peaceful (there's no traffic noise), at the back of the house, so overlooks my - and all the neighbouring - gardens.
It is furnished with a very comfortable double bed, plenty of wardrobe space and an en suite shower and toilet. Clean bedding and towels are provided - and plenty of spare blankets and duvets, if people need them. There's also a hairdryer and an iron. It's a good sized room, with two radiators and two windows, providing great light. There is also excellent hi-speed wi-fi throughout the house. The house has recently been redecorated and there's new flooring in the guest room
neighborhood_overview:
My neighbourhood is known as Oval.
There are plenty of local shops, cafes and bars and it’s close to two parks. Just north of my area is Vauxhall, which has been christened 'VoHo' because of the mix of bohemian shops, gardens, cafes and bars.
It is also close to the American Embassy (25 minute walk) for guests needing to attend to visa applications.
Other cool neighbourhoods nearby are Kennington, Clapham and Brixton.

The Tate Britain gallery is just across the river and the South Bank Centre is a few stops away in the tube.

neighborhood_overview: Kennington like Camden is a cross road of London it is directly the same distance to the City of London and East End as it is to Knightsbridge and the West End shopping and theatre district - The apartment is on the Dutchy of Cornwall Estate and over looks Kennington Park, currently owned by Prince of Wales and Prince Williiam will inherit it is one of 5 Royal Private Estates in London the others being Westminster Palace (White Hall), Kensington Palace, Buckingham Palace. and Richmond Park. Kennington is more of a village a community made up of Palace workers and their families, MP and Westminster, judges and city workers and many 20's have moved into the area giving a younger vibe.
host_about:
I started airbnb during my masters at St Martins as I was interested in the home as a multifunctional space - I wanted to create homes that were bespoke designed unique and cosy.
I continue to believe that beautiful design shouldn't just be for high end properties.
I am so grateful to all the wonderful  airbnb guests who have stayed over the years  who tell me what they like,  share  thier tips, thier cultures and travel stories with me. All this infomations gets fed back into the designs and the homes are constantly being altered and updated.
Its  the best part of my job and why I am so passionate about being part of the airbnb family.

Other things to note

- No smoking anywhere inside our house , no candles, NO drunken behaviour NO Drugs and no pets

name: Two bedroom luxury Flat in Brixton with city view!
description:
The apartment is on the top floor of a portered building. From the apartment there are amazing views of both the city of London and the hills of the south.

The space
The apartment is on top floor of a secure building in trendy Brixton. The flat comprises of 2 bedrooms and 2 bathroom. Guests will have exclusive use of the flat. The master bedroom has a king size bed and an ensuite bathroom with a powerful shower. The second bedroom is duplex, it has a double bed with a large wardrobe upstairs and a small office and a tv with a sofa downstairs. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher, coffee machine and a hot and cold (still and sparkling) on demand water tap. The lounge has a very large and comfortable goose feather filled sofa Which can become a better than average comfortable large double bed for two people, a 55 inch TV with Dolby digital sound system, a piano and leads into a small balcony where our smoking guests can enjoy a cigarette without the need
neighborhood_overview:
Brixton is a world unto itself, a volatile slice of London’s multiculturalism and a vibrant hotbed
of food, drink and music.
Supermarkets
Sainsbury’s Local A small version of a Sainsbury’s supermarket is located beside the tube
station on Brixton Road, exit the tube and turn right. There is another, generally with fewer
customers, further down the same road, also on the right.
Tesco Express If you walk to and from Loughborough Junction station there is a small
Tesco on Coldharbour Lane just 200m from the station.
Tesco Metro A full size supermarket is on Acre Lane, turn right out of the main gates,
continue across the main intersection with the town hall and tower, Tesco is on the left with a
large carpark out the front, approximately 10 minute walk.
Pharmacy
449 Brixton Road, Brixton SW9 8HH
There is a large Boots chemist at Brixton tube selling all the personal essentials. They also

name: Lovely flat in the heart of Islington
description:
Welcome to our spacious flat in the heart of Angel-where you can rent your quiet, private double bedroom with bathroom and make full use of the kitchen, lounge, dining area and balcony. Enjoy the area and great transport links to the centre!

The space
Welcome to our spacious second floor flat (85 sq metres/915 sq), where you can rent your private double bedroom with bathroom and make full use of the kitchen, lounge, dining area and balcony.

Your bedroom has a comfy double bed, plenty of storage space/wardrobe and an bathroom with heated towel-rails. The room has direct access to a large balcony at the back of the building, which catches the sun throughout the day and has its own bench, barbecue and pots of fresh herbs. Your room has fresh linen and towels and is professionally cleaned. Its is a peaceful and quiet room, away from the main road.

If you are travelling with kids or a baby let us know the details and we can make arrangements fo
neighborhood_overview:
The Area
The flat is within walking distance to super-fast transport links to the West End and Oxford Street; eight minutes from both Angel and Highbury & Islington underground stations; and there are also six buses that stop outside our doorstep all heading into Central London. Essex Road station is one minute away and provides an excellent link to the City (10 minutes to Moorgate Station).

We’re in the heart of Angel Islington – an area which is both amazingly convenient and very easy to fall in love with. Under five minutes from our doorstep you’ll find some of of London’s most exciting restaurants (you should definitely try Ottolenghi’s), bars, independent cinemas, coffee shops, music venues, galleries and the wonderful Almeida Theatre.
The picturesque Regents Canal is close by with its riverside bars and pubs – as are other must-sees such as nearby Camden Passage Antiques Market, eclectic Spitalfields market, Columbia Flower Market, Broadway market, Petticoa
host_about: I (Eleni) have been living in London for the past 16 years. I can never get bored of  exploring this city, especially the art, theatre, music and food. If you need any advice from a Londoner, I would be very happy to make suggestions and recommendations that suit you. I live with my partner ,Tom, who is a born and bred Londoner and even better at directing you to the right place. We both love travelling and meeting people from all over the world, and are relaxed and easygoing hosts, and respectful guests.

name: Double Room Hammersmith/Fulham Border By River
description:
My place is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families, and groups. I have 3 double bedrooms I Airbnb & the website works out cost based on everyone in one room. This works if you are solo or a couple, but if you require a second or third bedroom the cost will be incorrect and I will need to send you a new offer. Please be sure in your note to let me know how many rooms you need and the configuration of guests. Thank you.

The space
Double room by Thames, SW London

A lovely and spacious family house by the River Thames in Fulham, with a double room to rent and when available, two additional bedrooms for children or additional guests. All bedrooms are spacious with TV, wifi and fantastic bus routes to central London from the end of the road. Most of my bookings tend to come through this listing so if there is no availability showing here, it is still worth messaging me to see if one of the other rooms are free as I do have 3 l
neighborhood_overview:
It is unique in so much as it is so close to the centre of London, but has a real feel of peace, quiet and country side. It is close to the river, where I regularly do a 7K run around the 2 bridges loop (takes about an hour to walk this), and Bishops Park is 5 mins away which has a lovely Farmers Market every Sunday morning. There is a great local pub, The Crabtree, on the river 5 mins walk away and a great little corner shop for all your basic shopping requirements. The famous River Cafe Restaurant is about a 10 minute walk away along the river and I can recommend many others.

Jump on a bus at the top of the road and you can arrive at the great museums of South Kensington within 20 minutes and Piccadilly Circus is 15 minutes on the tube once you get to Hammersmith.
host_about:
I live with my adult son in a lovely family Fulham terraced house with unusually large garden. 

I am very social and enjoy meeting new people so thought the combination of that and earning some money to help with the mortgage seemed a good plan 10 years or so ago and have never looked back! I have three spare double rooms (depending on how many children are home), that are available for guests. They have separate listings so I can accommodate solo travelers up to a group of 6, depending on what is booked out. 

Also, when we are all away, I rent the entire 5 bedroom house. We have 2 friendly cats who are part of the family too.

I very much look forward to hearing from you and welcoming you to my home.

name: Bright sunny appt on garden square
description:
Entire bright two-bedroom apartment in central London (Zone One) in Chelsea very close to London's major sights and only a few minutes walk from Earls Court tube station. The flat is very bright and sunny and has great views over the garden square.

The space
The flat is on the third floor with windows facing south and east, so very bright and sunny all day. The main bedroom has a double futon bed, the second bedroom a single bed and there is a sofa in the lounge. It’s a historic 1870s Victorian townhouse building, but unfortunately no lift.

Guest access
You will have the entire apartment to yourself, so no sharing.
neighborhood_overview: You are surrounded by many restaurants, pubs, supermarkets and tourist attractions. The Victoria & Albert, Natural History and Science museums are about twenty minutes walk away and Harrods only another ten minutes. You can see Chelsea football stadium from the window.
host_about: British professional who loves to travel - last pre-covid trip was three weeks hiking to Everest Base Camp.

name: Bright single room in family home.
description:
Small, bright, single room in family home, overlooking garden. In quiet road, conveniently close to buses & trains & to East Dulwich, Peckham & Camberwell shops, pubs and restaurants. Close to Kings College Hospital for those working there.
Toast, jam, muesli, fruit, milk, tea & real coffee provided. Please request gluten-free or dairy-free in advance.

The space
Single room in three-bedroomed Victorian terrace house on the border of Camberwell, Peckham and East Dulwich..

Guest access
Guests will have access to shared kitchen, bathroom and garden.

Other things to note
The garden backs onto railway line so there is some noise from trains. Our house is terraced so we have neighbours next door. We also have a cat.

We are 10-15 minutes walk away from Denmark Hill, East Dulwich and Peckham Rye stations. Three swimming pools and gyms are 20 minutes walk away. We are 5 minutes walk from 'Bellenden Village' and Dulwich Hamlet Football Club and 20 minutes walk from Camberwell Art College, South London Gallery and Kings College Hospital.

description:
Bright double room in beautifully renovated house, fronting large peaceful park in central London.

Very convenient for transport to key locations including West End, City, Canary Wharf, Greenwich (UNESCO site), O2 Arena, Excel and East London.

The space
Big bright & airy double room in beautifully renovated house fronting large 7ha park. Please note it is a full, proper private house, not an apartment!

The house is luxurious & well-renovated, facing a big beautiful park, very near city centre. Modern kitchen & bathroom (heated floor, central heating, huge shower, separate bath). Faces beautiful Deptford Park across a very quiet street with free car parking in front of the house.

Very convenient for transport to key locations including West End, City, Canary Wharf, Greenwich, O2 Arena, Excel Centre, Shoreditch & East London. London Bridge (2 stops / walking distance) & Bank (3 stops)
- West End / Soho (~20 mins, 6 stops di
neighborhood_overview:
The area is very central, but relaxed due to facing Deptford Park across a very quiet street and in a lovely Victorian pocket. Located short walking distance to one of London's UNESCO world heritage listed sites: beautiful Maritime Greenwich (20 mins walk / 5 min bus) and London's second UNESCO site at the Tower of London (~35 minutes by foot / 15 minutes bus)

Deptford itself is very historic with Tudor era Royal Docks & diarists John Evelyn and Samuel Pepys, ancient churches & Watling Street. Deptford High Street has galleries, the great Deptford Project Cafe and vibrant market. We are very near Surrey Quays tube station, shopping centre and restaurants.

I love travel (40+ countries in the last 5 years) and meeting people. Really into snowboarding. Also economics and 20th Century History. 

We have a flatmate, who's great. 

Looking forward to meeting you and having you to stay!"

name: Chelsea Studio by Kings Road London
description:
The space
Hi,
Are you looking for a cozy place to stay in London's swanky Chelsea without having to break the bank? Happy to help.

My 280sq ft. studio is situated less than 15 minutes from three tubes (Sloane Sq., South Kensington, & Knightsbridge); this means quick and easy access to the District, Circle, and Piccadily lines. It is just one stop on the underground to Victoria (or just a short walk), and from there you can catch trains and buses which go to all of London's major airports, as well as destinations all over the UK.

More importantly, Harrods, Kings Road, the Saatchi Gallery, and Partriges Saturday Market are all just a short walk away!

The flat:
A 280sq ft. studio style flat
3rd floor walkup with morning sun
Sleeps 2 on fold out bed/couch
The bathroom boasts a spacious standing shower
Kitchenette with washer/dryer machine
Virgin Wifi
neighborhood_overview:
South Kensington is home to major museum's, with the beautifully gilded Natural History Museum and the Victoria & Albert Museum. Royal Albert Hall is the UK's most famous concert hall, just a 20 minute walk or 10 minute bus away from Draycott Place.

Sloane Square is a shopping centre for Brits, with two major streets. Kings Road is more low key with several small parks, a short walk to the river Thames, the Saatchi Gallery, and has your more interesting stores such as Vivian Westwood, Antropology, LK Bennett, Bimba y Lola, plus great dining and nightlife. Sloane Street has all of your D&G, Prada, Hackett, Marni, ending up near Harrod's of Knightsbridge.

Knightsbridge gives to the south of Hyde Park, which is also a great place for walking, biking, horseback, or just enjoying tea overlooking the Serpentine pond. Enjoy the West London living experience.
host_about:
Hi,

Are you looking for a cozy place to stay in London's swanky Chelsea without having to break the bank?  Happy to help.

American ex-Pat enjoying Europe.

name: Comfortable and Bright Central Apartment
description:
This flat is located in the trendy neighbour of Brixton! It is well equipped, stylish and it is close to cool bars and restaurants...not to mention just a 3-minute walk to the underground and 10 minutes away by underground from the heart of London!!

The space
The flat is decorated with a shabby chic decor and with real oil paintings. The kitchen is amazingly well equipped too. The apartment is just a stone's throw away from the heart of Brixton still located on a quiet street.
Victoria Underground runs 24hrs on the weekend!!

This apartment is very close to shops 24hrs and supermarkets providing easy reach to daily essentials.

Amenities
Utilities: Central heating, Wi-fi, 40inch smart TV, Kettle, Toaster, Iron board, Cooker, Fridge, Freezer, Washing machine, crockery, pots, pans, dishes etc.
Bed linen is provided along with fresh towels.
Crib and high chair - £10.00 per day - Mandatory if you have an infant. All other kids
host_about:
Hello, I'm a friendly Italian man with a positive outlook on life.

I am endlessly curious. I love to experience the world with eyes wide open. I never stop exploring, discovering and evolving.

Likewise, I love Science, the Arts, and creative people. Life to me is a storybook full of fascinating tales. I amass information 'on the hoof' and very little passes me by. Understanding what makes others tick is meat and drink to me and proves to be a source of endless joy.

I always keep my mind active. I love beauty in all forms, I am well-educated, and I like to remain totally classless. This makes it easy for me to get on with just about any sort of person. I am thought-provoking and even quite deep on occasions. I also get involved in other exciting things which keep me busy too, such as painting, reading books, newspaper and cultural magazines, photography, video editing, cycling, theatre, music, and movies.

Furthermore, I strongly believe a very clean, secure, welcoming feel, and comfortable apartment is of paramount importance for travellers.

My life's golden rule is to treat others as you wish to be treated!

I am always on an adventure. Enjoy hearing about people's travels and lifestyles.

You may want to know that I am a very responsive host, so if you encounter any issues while staying in my properties, I very much appreciate you to address them straight away and give me the chance to fix them.

Sincerely,

Adriano

host_about: My husband, Nick, and I have lived at our property for 41 years, bringing up our four sons.  They are all now married with families of their own and have chosen to stay in this area so we feel very fortunate.  We also now have seven granddaughters and two grandsons.  My husband is a trial lawyer and I retired last year after working as a magistrate for 35 years.  I have also worked at the Wimbledon tennis championships for many years although most of my time these days is spent helping out with our nine grandchildren!  I enjoy being an Airbnb host very much and have met some lovely people from many different countries around the world.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Simon. Welcome to a collection of self contained studio suites located in one of the most fashionable and well located parts of Central London. I have lived in the area for over seven years now and I can honestly say it's one of the best places that I've lived in the Capital [and there's been quite a few!]. I'm also a seasoned traveller and like to think I have a good feel for what guests are looking for in a travel accommodation experience.
Your independent en-suite bedroom is like a small apartment and occupies a whole single floor of my house. It has its own lockable door and is directly accessible from the staircase. You also get the front door key. So you are completely independent. I live in one of the apartments, so if you want privacy and security here you have it or if you fancy a beer i can show you some local bars, restaurants and tourist sites.
In short you get a high quality en-suite double bedroom apartment, a bit like a hotel suite [linen, towels and toiletries are included and the bedroom is cleaned and prepared by a professional cleaner]. All at exceptionally competitive rates.

Easy access to the M4 and Heathrow Airport, short walk to high street. Well connected to Central London via underground, train and buses.

The space

Lovely and airy room with King size bed, period wardrobe and bedside tables, large desk area with book shelves, private cosy sitting area around a magnificent Victorian fireplace. Great sound system with DVD and CD player that can be connected to your phone or computer.
Private and lar

It's leafy Chiswick!!!
We are in a great central area, with easy access to Central London and the airport, both by car and with public transport (buses, train and tube are all at easy reach) and yet we are only 2 minutes' walk from the beautiful park Chiswick house and grounds!
The high street, only 10 minutes away, is packed with great and exclusive restaurants, as well as less expensive but very tasty little pizzerias and cafés.
host_about:
Hi, I'm quite new at this, let's see how it goes!
I'm a relaxed mosaic artist and I spend a lot of time in my studio down the garden making art. I also tend to travel a lot lately. I have two cats, but they are very independent and you don't really see them much in the flat, they love to wander around the surrounding gardens.
I am here to help you, if needed, but in general I prefer to respect people's privacy and independence.

neighborhood_overview:
Chiswick High Street is a short walk away, with an abundance of available restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and shops.

Chiswick offers riverside pubs, lovely parks and good schools, which all contribute to its overall charm: combining city life with village living. Chiswick has easy access to the M4 and all major routes in and out of London. Chiswick is also ideally positioned for short journeys to the West End, the City, and Heathrow Airport is fairly close.

Chiswicks transport links include underground stations such as Stamford Brook, Turnham Green, Chiswick Park and Gunnersbury.

Locally there is excellent shopping centre at Westfield - Shepherds Bush, the biggest shopping centre in London, which is a 10-15 minute tube or bus ride away. Notting Hill with its Portobello Market is a couple of miles away and Earls Court and Kensington Olympia Exhibition Centres are nearby too.

neighborhood_overview:
Ladywell Village is just that - a little village located within Central London. It has a very unique character, but it only takes 16 minutes to get to London Bridge (for Tate modern;Tower Bridge;Globe Theatre;The Tower of London;St Paul's Cathedral) and 22 minutes to Charing Cross (within walking distance of Trafalgar Square; The National Gallery and Portrait Gallery; Horseguards Parade (for the spectacular Horse mounted Changing of the Guard);10 Downing Street;Big Ben;Houses of Parliament;Westminster Abbey;Buckingham Palace and Tate Britain).

Ladywell station is less than 2 minutes walk, and the village itself has a lovely feel and some really great shops. Probably of most interest to visitors are the cafes and restaurants.There is a French Patisserie/cafe on the corner by the station with great croissants and Oscars, a little independent cafe with a tiny garden, where the German lady owner bakes all her own delicious cakes and great coffee. host_about: I am a professional opera singer and singing teacher, and I run my own antiques business specialising in silver, glass and jewellery. I once trained as a chef, and love cooking. neighborhood_overview: Neatly tucked away between the wealth of Marylebone, the edgy energy of Soho and the grandeur of Bloomsbury, Fitzrovia is peaceful and attractive, home to small media organisations, small pubs and small restaurants and a smattering of decent hotels. Wide streets lined with tall buildings in Victorian brick mingle with cosy side alleys, with a variety of architectural styles from the eighteenth century to the present day, all of it dominated by the BT Tower, one of London’s tallest and most iconic buildings. Tottenham Court Road is the major shopping street, and the best place in London to look for home furnishings and electronic goods. The area around Oxford Street mixes good high street shops with pubs and bars catching the overflow from Soho’s nightlife.

I love cinema, theatre and good food! 
London is a great city to live and to explore and my flat is in a great area to explore all London has to offer.

name: Beautiful warehouse flat in London
description:
This is an artist's live-in Studio space in an original old East London factory building located in the heart of Dalston, which has become one of the trendiest and liveliest areas in London over the past few years.

The space
This is one of the original old factory buildings that got converted into artist studios before the gentrification of the area kicked in and which made this area so popular in the first place. So expect an original piece of the old East London with more of an industrial feel to it, as opposed to the newly built shiny apartment blocks that have started to appear in the area. This is a charming and charismatic old factory building with high ceilings and big south facing windows. I actually do live and work in this space, so it has many personal objects, books, records etc around. You are welcome to read the books, listen to records, get inspired by things you find as long as you treat the place with respect and leave everything where you found

neighborhood_overview:
Clerkenwell is a popular and thriving area of central London - directly adjacent to The City. It seems to have it all from antique shops and art-galleries to local produce markets such as Exmouth Market. This is an area where you will also find a vast array of London’s very best gastro-pubs, bistro’s and Italian Deli’s.

The famous and fabulous Barbican Arts Centre is housed here and it is a feast for lovers of art and culture. It is Europe’s largest art and conference venue and is the home of the London Symphony Orchestra.

If street markets are your thing, you are spoiled for choice. If you take yourself over to Hoxton you will find the Columbia Road flower market, Pettycoat Lane, Spitalfields, Brick Lane and Broadway Markets. There are also a few excellent and respected galleries around this way like the Cube and the Geffrye Museum.

This is a great area for walking. Stroll through the City, past St Paul’s and cross the river Thames to the Globe

The house is traditional Victorian terrace in style. It has a large open plan kitchen/diner, a shared bathroom/wc with excellent power-shower and a sun-room leading to a large southwest facing garden.

The room is ideal for visitors, or those wishing to work or study in London. Fresh bed linen and towels are provided. A starter-kit breakfast package is provided on arrival. The kitchen/diner can be used for making meals and a washing machine is available. During spring and summer the sun-room is the ideal place to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening or a cu
neighborhood_overview: The Telegraph Hill area is a vibrant community with its own annual arts festival in spring. I recommend Dinner For 100 pizza pop -up outside the Hill Station Cafe. The Hill Station is great for breakfast, lunch and tea. We also have a lively local pub which does Thai food and has regular music nights.There are great views to the city from the local park.
host_about: We are both Londoners, happy to host independent travelers and offer practical advice and fun tips to make a great visit to London even better. We have traveled extensively around Europe and we love to meet people who enjoy exploring different countries and cultures.  We also enjoy being at home. New Cross is a creative  community with plenty going on from  local theatre, arts festivals, music and film events.

neighborhood_overview: On Fridays and Saturdays you must visit Portobello Market which is literally 1 min walk from our apartment. The space

Full

name: Clerkenwell penthouse, huge terrace
description:
"Best views in London - Far exceeded expectations - Fab bedroom suite with glorious terrace - incredibly quiet but so central - Trendiest hood - Walk to Covent Garden..." share my home and have the best ever London experience.

The space
This is high-rise living at its most spectacular. Sunshine pours in from the triple aspect floor-to-ceiling windows, and with it, a view that takes in nigh on every major London landmark; St Paul’s Cathedral, The London Eye, The Gherkin, Tate Modern,The Telecom Tower, Canary Wharf… There's a 1500 (YES 1500) sq foot wrap around terrace to enjoy the views and outdoor dining throughout the summer

Even if splendid vistas were all that was on offer, you’d be moving in. But turn your back on the windows and you’ll find two very large double bedrooms, an enormous open plan living space equipped with beautiful leather furniture and an ultra-modern kitchen. Fully furnished, including large screen plasma TV, wifi and luxury finis

This light and airy one bedroom flat is set in an Edwardian house in Hackney, North East London and is available for short term stays (2-10 nights).

My stylish but cosy flat is in a quiet road but near to the fashionable hustle and bustle of Dalston and Stoke Newington.

The flat itself is very large for London. The bedroom has a king size bed and room for hanging clothes. In the bright living room there are large sash windows overlooking the garden and the city. The thee seater sofa is cozy and turns into a sofa bed. The kitchen has everything you'd need for cooking and baking and the bathroom has both a shower and bath as well as a washing machine. I've got lots of books for you to look at, FreeSat TV with plenty of channels and free wi-fi.

Locally there is a Sainsbury's supermarket and small shops like a grocer, fishmonger, newsagent and a nice friendly cafe just a couple of minutes walk from the flat. For more variety bohe
host_about:
Hi I'm Zoë,

I'm hoping to let my lovely London home out to visitors via AirBnB occasionally at other times too.

The flat is very clean and tidy, and you'll have lots of nice clean sheets and towels.  It's also got  toys and books for children as Vincent (8) is also a resident. I'd like to get to know you a bit before you arrive and would love to help you make the most of your stay and time in London. If you need anything just ask.

Zoë

neighborhood_overview:
The home of Oval Cricket Ground. MI5 and 6 = Cricket and Spies - what could be more english!
Kennington is partly owned by the Dutchy of Cornwall (Prince Charles currently is the Duke) and the rest is owned by southwark and Lambeth and the dieces of the Palace of Lambeth. The Imperial War Museum, southbank to houses of Parliament, Waterloo southbank Tate Modern and Britian are all walking distance about 17min to Lambeth Pier at the bottom of Black Prince Road- there are lots of great local restaurants, bars, and cafes for guests to use and the area has several parks with cafes and lovely walks, Burgess Park has great views of the city, Vauxhall has wild meadows of lavender, Kennington has tennis courts and walled gardens.
host_about:
I started airbnb during my masters at St Martins as I was interested in the home as a multifunctional space - I wanted to create homes that were bespoke designed unique and cosy.
I continue to believe that beautiful design shouldn't just be for high end properties.
I am so grateful to all the wonderful  airbnb guests who have stayed over the years  who tell me what they like,  share  thier tips, thier cultures and travel stories with me. All this infomations gets fed back into the designs and the homes are constantly being altered and updated.
Its  the best part of my job and why I am so passionate about being part of the airbnb family.

name: Bright Double room, LONDON. Zone 3
description:
This is a 3 bedroom 1 bathroom Victorian House in a quiet neighbourhood of South West London along a tree-lined street surrounded by Victorian homes. This is not a "working from home" space or for those wishing for a Central London/tourist-oriented experience of London . Tooting is a vibrant and hip area of South West London and the house is 15 minutes walk to the underground or there are frequent buses.

Guest access
Guests have access to the kitchen for preparing breakfast only however this is negotiable for longer term guests..
Laundry facilities for guests staying 5 days or more.
Wifi throughout the house.
The room is cleaned, bedding and towels changed once a week for longer term guests.

*The property is not suitable for children.
*No pets allowed.
neighborhood_overview:
‘Captivating’ Tooting has been named one of the best neighbourhoods in the world, alongside exotic hotspots in Rio, Seoul and New York. Sound unlikely? The south London neighbourhood of Tooting has joined the ranks of the world’s coolest city areas according to Lonely Planet.
And Lonely Planet is not the first big name to recognise the buzz in Tooting. In January 2017 the New York Times published its guide to the “The London of London’s Mayor”, a reference to Tooting resident and its former MP, Sadiq Khan.
host_about:
Hi
I am fun loving and adventurous.  My tastes in music, the arts, food and style of travel reflect me... eclectic.
I throughly enjoy my work as well as the time off it allows for travel.
As a Londoner I love exploring the city by bike to check out the places the tourists have yet to discover.

description:
The space
I am offering a bright room in a spacious 3 storey victorian house in a quiet street in North London, close to central London. It is in travel Zone 2 - only 20 minutes away from Oxford St and Covent garden. The nearest tube station is Finsbury Park.

I live here with my son, and daughter who is at university. I am a university lecturer, We love to welcome people from all over the world to our beautiful and exciting city.

We like music and the arts and can advise about good places to visit for different age groups and tastes, whether you want the coolest places in East London, or museums in West London Our house is in a really quiet street, only minutes walk away from shops, good restaurants, transport and parkland. We have a very soppy Labrador who loves everyone.

We are within easy reach of the Olympic Park, and close to lovely spots like Alexandra Palace, Hampstead Heath, and Camden

I have put acc
host_about:
I am a lecturer working in initial teacher education. My partner and I have 4 grown up children,   and 1 dog, a  big handsome labrador poodle cross.  

We love London and all the things it has to offer.   We are very well placed for travelling around  and can advise you about nice places to visit be it museums, gigs, theatres or London's lovely open spaces like Hampstead Heath and Alexandra Palace.  

We are 10 minutes walk or 5 minutes by bus to Finsbury Park Station which gets you to all parts of central London very quickly.  However the local area has good restaurants and pubs, parks, a theatre and a cinema.

name: Cosy Double room London, River View
description:
our flat is overlooking the river Lea and it's houseboats, the room is cosy, with reclaimed wood furniture and fitted with a flat-screen tv and shutters on the windows. Looking out of the window feels more like countryside than being in London. Own toilet opposite guest bedroom, shared shower. Free coffees ;-)

The space
Double bed room with a proper comfy bed. We know how important a good night's sleep is!

Free parking in Timberwharf Road (1min Walk) Central London (Euston) is 11 Minutes journey time from Seven Sisters station.

Walking along the canal, you will see ducks, geese, swans, herons and cormorants. There are a few local pubs within walking distance. (15 mins) The nearest restaurants are about 25 mins walking distance.

Our flat is filled with pieces from auctions and carboot sales and things we found in the skip and renovated. As I am trading with vintage items, there will be large amounts of ceramics and glass items o
neighborhood_overview:
Compared to other London places it's really quiet here, you will hear the geese and ducks and people rowing on the canal. We live in a Cul-de-sac and there will be kids playing outside in the afternoon. Generally, it's a very safe community and a brilliant close-knit neighbourhood in our street.

Our place is located in north-East london, right in the middle of the Hasidic Jewish community. Generally, Hackney is one of the most diverse places in England. There is a large Turkish community (lots of yummy kebab shops), Polish, Afro Caribbean and many others.

There are a few big supermarkets in walking distance (Sainsbury's and Asda) and many small local shops just a few hundred yards away (most of them won't be open on sabbath though)

If you're brave, rent out a bike and explore the area, it's well worth it. Or go for endless walks around the marshes and the canal.
host_about:
Hi, 
we are a couple in our mid 50's with a 12 year old daughter. I am German and my husband is of Irish origin. We love having guests and friends over and enough space to accommodate them.

We like getting around London on our bikes, shopping on flea markets and restoring old things. Tom is working full-time and I am working from home, running a vintage and antiques online business and website.

I had loads of lodgers in my old flat in Germany and it was always fun to meet new people.  We use Airbnb also for our travels and always had thoroughly enjoyable experiences.

Murielle, Tom & Alice

I love London and I hope to show off the best of it!
I'm very happy to recommend local galleries, bars, cafes or clubs. It might also be possible to use my art studio, which is 3 minute walk from the flat.

I'm also a distance runner, so let me know if you want any advice on running routes. It's possible to run for 20 or 30 miles through parks, along canals, marshes and woodland - only being on a road for a couple of minutes from the flat!

name: Gorgeous Spacious Bloomsbury Studio
description:
Gorgeous peaceful, spacious and light-filled studio - an oasis of calm in London's literary heart.

The space
Full of original features, the south-facing studio has a large main room with a wood floor, an extremely comfortable four-poster bed, two sofas (one of which turns into a double sofa bed), and a dining area.

There is a sun-filled balcony with a table and two chairs overlooking a park with a lovely view of the City skyline. A separate kitchen is small but well-equipped, with an electric hob, grill and oven, microwave, washing machine and tumble dryer, and a range of kitchen equipment. The bathroom is full of original features, including an old-fashioned mirrored alcove and a (recently restored) 1930s bath, with a shower. Fresh linen and towels are provided, and there is a fast wireless internet connection. There is also a TV.

That's what I love about my apartment - being able to be in the heart of London, able to walk to most of th
neighborhood_overview:
Bloomsbury is a fantastic neighbourhood, full of little restaurants, great pubs, independent shops, spacious green squares and lovely little unexpected pleasures tucked away between the main thoroughfares. It's walking distance from the heart of London, and a lovely place to stay to get to know the city.

Bloomsbury is famous for having been home to a number of Britain's creative writers, and as a hub for a bohemian group of people who included Virginia Woolf - the Bloomsbury Set. The streets around are peppered with blue plaques commemorating those who lived in this area, and there are various nearby attractions associated with writers, such as the Charles Dickens museum. The British Museum is a short walk away.

Nearby amenities include some great restaurants, an excellent shopping centre with a Waitrose (UK's best) supermarket, an arthouse cinema, patisserie and chemist, a 24 hour grocery shop just across the road, and lots of good restaurants, pubs, and cafes.
host_about: Hi, I'm an academic & love to travel. Something I like about hosting people on Air BnB is getting to meet people from all over the world.

description:
This room is up three flights of stairs - it's sunny with some street noise, and in a great location - guests share a bathroom and kitchen with me. Washer Dryer, clean linens, and the a deep bathtub for soaks. There's a refrigerator, oven, microwave, and tea kettle. The room has two single size beds, and is completely private. centrally located in the East Village. I live in the back room, kitchen is in the middle.

The space
Rent my sunny front room in the East Village. It's private and has everything you need, from wi fi to a tidy bathroom.! Its an extremely safe 24 hour neighborhood. There's lots of work by local artists in my kitchen, and a washer dryer you can use. Couples are ok, its just extra~! The bed is full size and has pillows and the linens are fresh. It's a third floor walk up, in a well maintained prewar building, My block has a couple of nice restaurants, Supper and The Fry Guys, and my favorite pizza is Rizzo's, a block and a half away on Clin
neighborhood_overview: People are easy going here, they're not in such an incredible hurry, and I love to go to Tompkins Park, on 7th Street, and people watch in the central area. It's diverse, relaxed, and still quirky - the East Village  and the Lower East Side are the best neighborhoods in NYC!
host_about: I'm a New York based writer and singer who does a lot of spoken word gigs, and often visits San Francisco. I have 4 pop type books published, I hang out at Double Down, Sidewalk Cafe,  and many other spots in the East Village. The Fry Guys and 99 Cents Pizza are right across the street.! My friend Remick, a Brooklyn based comedian, will be your host if I'm in California, the area has an amazing comedy venue scene, some of the top people!

name: Cozy Clean Guest Room - Family Apt
description:
Our best guests are seeking a safe, clean, spare room in a family apartment. They are comfortable being independent, accommodating of family noise (quiet hours 11pm-7am), and aren't afraid of a friendly two year old golden lab (dog). Our guests aren't put off by an old bathroom that while perfectly clean, has some peeling paint. In short, our guests want to feel like they are staying at their sister's apartment while visiting the city! (only their sister changed the sheets and cleaned).

The space
Stay in my family's little guest room and enjoy privacy, a warm welcome, and security.

Your guest room is comfortable and clean. It is small but well outfitted, has a single bed and a fabulous mattress which is firm and yet pillowy on top, all at the same time. The bathroom is shared and immediately across the hall. ("Shared" in the sense it isn't "en suite." The family will use our second bath while you are staying with us). The bathroom is fully suppl
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is full of restaurants and cafes.  There is plenty to do.
host_about:
Welcome to family life with my oldest two away at college all the way down to a seventh grader. You may see everything from lively dinner conversation to a nearly empty apartment with everyone out enjoying the city.  I'm friendly, leave tea and coffee always available and responsive to a guest's needs.  My family has enjoyed everything from the guest who tends towards the private as well as the ones who dive in with the science experiment! 
Hosting through Airbnb has created a wonderful opportunity to meet people from all over the world, plot their addresses, and  learn about other places.   I began hosting through Airbnb four years ago as a work-from-home job. I continue because the whole family entirely grooves on the notion we get to meet people from all over the world and help them visit our city.

description:
Welcoming 3 bedroom duplex in the heart of Park Slope, rated the city's most desirable neighborhood by NY Magazine!

(URL HIDDEN)

It's quiet, close to transportation and many amenities. Perfect base for exploring all the city has to offer.

The space
Spacious duplex (1,500 square feet) in a classic turn of the century brownstone on a beautiful tree-lined block in Park Slope, Brooklyn. The Carroll Street location is close to many great neighborhood restaurants, cafes and trendy shops on 5th Avenue and 7th Avenue.

First floor: Ground level entry (no stairs) leads to a spacious open living area, kitchen and dining area with French doors leading to backyard garden with barbecue grill. One half bathroom.

Parlor Floor (second floor): Two large, comfortable bedrooms, each with a queen bed and air conditioning. The master bedroom has a view of the garden, as well as a 38” flat screen TV. The sunny front bedroom faces the fa
host_about:
I'm a meeting and event producer and a long-time Brooklyn resident. I'm interested in all the culture that NYC has to offer and in nice weather I tool around the city on my vintage Vespa scooter.

Our property had been our primary residence, but now we also own a vacation home in upstate New York where we spend a good portion of our time.

Park Slope in Brooklyn is a great neighborhood with many shopping and dining options, as well as easy access to all the cultural activities of New York City. It is a true neighborhood where people sit on their stoops in good weather and talk to their neighbors and people passing by.

name: Only 2 stops to Manhattan studio
description:
Comfortable studio apartment with super comfortable king size bed and full kitchen and bathroom located in FABULOUS Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

The space
Our comfortable 500 sq foot (46 sq m) studio apartment with full kitchen and bath is for short term rental. The apartment is private and is in a two family house. The house is located in FABULOUS Williamsburg, Brooklyn within 10 minute travel from Manhattan. The studio is a perfect place to stay for budget minded visitors of New York City!

IN THE APARTMENT:

Comfortable luxury king size bed, soft flannel bed linens, pillows, comforters, a couch with queen size pullout bed, air conditioning, hangers, iron & ironing board, alarm clock, radio, TV(No Cable/Satellite), DVD/VCR player, wireless internet access for guest's laptops, dining table, room divider/screen

IN THE BATHROOM:

Fluffy bath towels, hand towels, bath mat, wash cloths, toilet paper (initial supply), plunger/toi
host_about:
We love to travel. When we travel we like to stay in a comfortable place that is clean, neat and sweet smelling, for a reasonable price. That's what we rent to you. We love city life but we also love outdoor adventures. We like keep up with all that's new and exciting around New York and we're happy to tell you where to find it. Want to hear the new young musicians that people are excited about or the promising new artists - we'll tell you about them. The best restaurants - ask us.
Want to take a break from the city we'll tell you about wilderness canoeing on the Delaware river - just an hour and a half's drive. We can tell you where to find the great salt water fishing with clean beautiful waters just an hour away from the city or how to take a one day trip by bus to ski in Vermont.


WHY WILLIAMSBURG?

Williamsburg is FABULOUS. It's fast growing and it's fast changing. It's hip. In the 1960's the new and exciting place where culture was blooming was Greenwich Village. In the 70's the SOHO neighborhood was where cheap industrial loft space were being turned into places where the adventurous could move to New York, live cheaply and make the new art, music, and culture. These days Williamsburg has that special chemistry of the New York that's constantly renewing itself.

name: Sunny 2BR near subway & shops
description:
Enjoy peace and quiet and the comforts of home in a vibrant neighborhood with easy access to Manhattan!

You'll have this sunny, quiet, newly renovated (2021) 3rd floor apartment all to yourselves; we live in a separate unit downstairs.

We’re just a couple of blocks from one of the liveliest parts of Astoria, with plenty of shops, bars, and restaurants to enjoy. After a short walk to the Ditmars N/W stop, the train is 15-20 minutes to Manhattan.

The space
With two bedrooms, one with a queen and one with a double bed, the space is perfect for families or for friends traveling together. The larger bedroom can be opened to the living room to let in the light, or closed off with doors and curtains for complete privacy. It has a wardrobe for storage and a desk for remote work; the second bedroom is cozy with a large closet.

The kitchen has refrigerator, oven, microwave, and dishwasher, and is well-equipped with cookware. Our FiOS intern
neighborhood_overview: Astoria is famous for its low-key atmosphere and vibrant diversity. Our street is very quiet with minimal traffic, but we're less than a 10 minute walk to just about anything you might need: the N/W subway; dozens of great bars, food trucks and restaurants; a 24-hour market and drugstore; and more. The neighborhood is famous for its Greek and Middle Eastern food, as well as the nearby Bohemian Beer Garden. And Astoria Park is 15 minutes away with a huge pool, track, and lawn where you can have a picnic with a great view of the Manhattan skyline.
host_about:
I've lived in Astoria since 2003 and love hosting both friends and strangers. I've got over 10 years of experience doing short-term rentals in this and other apartments, and I love meeting people and helping them feel at home in my neighborhood!

We've got three sons (born 2009, 2011, and 2014), so I especially love hosting families and helping connect them to activities and resources for kids.

And as travelers, we love to take our boys to see new things, especially to give them a change of pace from their urban life.

My husband is a high school teacher in Manhattan, and I work from home building websites, mostly for nonprofits and education organizations.

name: Charming Artist's Flat, East Village
description:
The space
If it's an authentic New York experience you're looking for, you've found it. Located in the heart of the East Village of Manhattan, this one bedroom apartment is as cool as the city and as cozy as the country. Perfect for couples or singles. Not suitable for families. East & west facing windows wash the flat in lots of morning and afternoon light, flat screen tv (for watching DVD's only) internet, queen size tempurpedic bed (with memory foam mattress!), laundry/dry cleaners on ground floor, kitchen, full bath.
I collect early American antiques which impart a country charm to this small yet beautiful city apartment.

10-15 minute walk to the F train; 15-20 minutes to N/R & 6 lines. Beautiful historic Tompkins Square Park is just blocks away and anchors the colorful diversity of the neighborhood. The East Village abounds with a bar and cafe culture unmatched in other parts of Manhattan. If you were to throw a stone from my roof the arch of
neighborhood_overview: The East Village is the best neighborhood in New York.  Rife with a history of artists like Basquiat and musicians like The Ramones and The Talking Heads, the area is alive with culture.  Amazing restaurants, bars, cafes and vintage stores are waiting for you to explore!
host_about: Artist.  Adventurer.  Explorer of all things.  Studied abroad and traveled about this lovely world before making New York home.   Love the city.  Love to leave it but always love coming home.  Come for a visit.  I'm here to help!

name: UES Beautiful Blue Room
description:
Beautiful peaceful healthy home

The space
Home is fun healthy.
Your Night’s Sleep: 100% cotton sheets and a fluffy down comforter.
Just pack your favorite comfy shoes and bring your empty suitcases to fill.

The Blue room has a twin bed built on the legs of a piano from the 1800's. There is a dresser and a nice size closet for all your clothes. Hairdryer, bedding and towels are provided in your room. The room is sound proof, no street noise, perfect for jet-lag recovery.
I feel that if my guests have a good nights sleep, they are full of energy for their adventures, then my guests are happy.

The Common Space: approximately 500 square feet, features an Eat-in kitchen, living room and bathroom, to share. There is never more than 2 guests here at a time, this way there is enough space for each of us to get lost in, if we need too.

WIFi, and Netflix,

The home front is a work of art in constant change.
<
neighborhood_overview:
Location: Five minutes to Central Park, Museum Mile (Guggenheim Museum, Metropolitan Museum, Whitney Museum, The Cooper Hewitt Museum, The Frick Collection and many more. Movie Stars pepper the hood and the area is considered “The New Downtown”. Today’s hipsters moved uptown to escape the over gentrified neighborhoods, such as the LES, the Village and now Chelsea.

Shopping: Many cool consignment shops to get your Haute couture, such as the famous Encore.

Food: Around the corner, Gourmet Garage, Japanese, French, Mexican, Health food bars, and Joy Burgers

Laundry: There is a laundry service on the corner, drop before 10am and pickup after 5pm, washed, dried and folded for $11. You will not miss a beat on your venture and you can still look good.
host_about:
Capturing the Steinbeck side of life in its Fillini moment.
Home is a special place, it is a live-in work of art... A great experience I hope all to enjoy...

name: Amazing location! Wburg. Large, bright & tranquil
description:
Large, private loft-like room in a spacious 2-story apt in the heart of Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The apt is in the heart of a vibrant neighborhood - while there's lots going on outside, inside it is peaceful inside, making it a beautiful base for your visit.

The space
The room has a large closet, a desk/work area, love-seat (couch) in a living room area. Ideal for one person; accommodates two cozily. Shared kitchen and bathroom, both with big skylights. On the second floor is a washer and dryer—and my wonderful flatmates (a gay couple), with whom you share the kitchen and bathroom. There is more than enough space for everyone.

The apartment is tranquil and bright, full of plants, providing a bit of calm amidst the chaos. It's also close to all trains, galleries, shops, cafes, and restaurants.

APARTMENT
—Furnished room, perfect for 1 person (could accommodate a couple, but cozily) very private, on the 3rd floor of a 3-story building

- One stop from the East Village, Lower East Side; an easy ride to other parts of Brooklyn and Manhattan

- We are surrounded by innovative restaurants serving delicious food of every kind--Japanese, American, Vietnamese, Korean, French, Italian, Turkish, etc.

- Grocery stores (Whole Foods, etc.) and delis nearby

- Art galleries, local designers and boutiques all around

- Pottery studio right downstairs with a beautiful garden.

- Cinema 1 min walk away; art-film house 7-min walk

- Two great parks a 10 min walk away (McCarren Park and Domino Park)

- This is a really fun area - everything you could want is here!
host_about:
