name: Cozy Low Priced Room in Quiet Convenient Queensway
description:
Quaint room in Queensway in a private apartment above Queensway Shopping Centre! Super convenient!

High speed wifi, free utilities all included, pay and stay!

5 mins by cab to Sentosa, Orchard Rd, Clarke Quay etc.

Perfect also for students who want a quick commute from schools such as MDIS, NUS, NYU, Kaaplan etc.

The space
Very cozy and quaint bedroom, perfect for students/interns on a budget

Guest access
- Common Kitchen
- Laundry Area
- Hallway
- 2 Bathrooms
neighborhood_overview:
Queensway/Alexandra is a small town of its own, with Queensway Shopping Centre just below the apartment, you have tons of great deals on sports wear (one of the cheapest) and even a 24 hour ANYTIME FITNESS GYM *Separate fees

Anchorpoint Shopping Centre has all the amenities such as Supermarkets, Pharmacy, Food Courts(aircon) and other shopping items you may need.

IKEA is also just opposite, should you need any household items or just want to eat their world famous Swedish dishes!

Finally Alexandra Village for people who want to try out Singaporean local delights such as Chicken Rice, Laksa, Fried Kway Teow, Chilli Crab etc!

5-7 mins away from tourist destinations such as Sentosa, Orchard Rd, Clarke Quay etc.
host_about:
Hi Everyone! 

If you're a student, or a young professional looking for a somewhere which is better than a hostel, but cheaper than a hotel, you've come to the right place!

4 rooms in total (in the same place) And 1 studio condo available!

I am always a message/phone call away should you have any questions about the apartment or Singapore in general (From the tourist sites, general knowledge of Singapore, where to unwind and relax etc)

I'm a very friendly albeit busy guy who has made friends with my guests, so don't treat me as a landlord who just ensures the place is clean and safe, I'm a friend.

Hope to hear from you soon!

name: Central Location, Near MRT & Food. Long Term Rent.
description:
Wake up to bird calls on a high floor of a Kallang apartment. Canal view. Window, queen size-bed, desk and office chair, wardrobe, kitchen, dining table. Shared toilet & shower. Long term stay welcome (6 months onwards). Please inquire first.

The space
Fresh bath towel, face towel, bedsheets, blanket, pillows provided. Complimentary teabags and coffee sachets. The room will be cleaned and sanitised for your health and comfort. We love nature and seek to conserve energy and the environment, so do observe little things like switching off lights and air con, practice recycling by placing recyclables (glass, paper, plastic bottles, aluminium cans) in the box provided in the kitchen. We provide re-usable shopping bags for your use, and a glass jug of water with glass (not plastic) bottles to drink from.

Kallang is located in Central South Singapore, and is convenient to get to town. The nearest mass rapid transport (MRT) station is Kallang MRT, alight ther
neighborhood_overview: Local folks, oldies and pets walk around the canal. Groups performing free martial arts in the morning, where you can join in.
host_about: I'm a writer, sustainability consultant and researcher, plus a music lover from Singapore. I founded the sustainability related website Gaia Discovery.  I love the outdoors as much as quiet time to read, As a guest, I am respectful, quiet and will clean up after use of kitchen with preparation of probably light meals like cereal or a wrap, no heavy cooking. Please don't hesitate to ask more about me.

name: Private room in Katong (near town)
description:
Landed property with decor of olden days, private room furbished with 2 table, 2 wardrobes, 2 bed with sheets and 2 chairs. Room is equipped with air-conditioning and fan. Windows had added curtains if you do not like the sun. Quiet and quaint room in the east, just 20 mins away from orchard road.

The space
Oriental house that is rarely seen around Singapore as compared to modern apartments and condominiums will be an experience!

Guest access
Guests are able to access, the living room, kitchen and dining table

Other things to note
You can let us know your itinerary once you get here, we will do our best to advice you on how to get around more efficiently.
- Breakfast will be available with extra charge
- Room serves 2, maximum 3
- 3rd occupant for the room will be chargeable at $30
neighborhood_overview: Katong is a heritage neighbourhood under conservation. A very friendly and abundance of food in this area. It is tourists friendly and they can learn of the Peranakan culture.
host_about: I am a fresh graduate helping my mom with the admin matters of this lease :)

description:

-Very quiet and relax environment,beside Japanese Garden

neighborhood_overview: Japanese garden and the lakeside is right beside us. A stroll or jogging is perfect. There are Taman Jurong shopping centre, taman Jurong hawker centre and supermarkets near by. Bowling, restaurant and fast food are close too. The place is quiet and close to natural. You can "hear" the natural at night ;)
host_about:
I'm currently a student in NTU, studying EEE. Would like to meet people and travel around! I've been to Malaysia(Johor Bahru, Melaka, Genting highland, Pengang), Thailand(Danok), China(Beijing, Hong Kong, Macau, Shenyang, Harbin), Russia (Moscow, Saint Petersburg, Vladimir, Suzdal, Nizhny Novgorod)......

I spend 10 days traveling alone in Russia and a 4 weeks summer school in Saint Petersburg to learn Russia. I can speak a little Russian.

Hosted guest from Canada, Hungary, Malaysia, China, India, Philippine, Indonesia, Spain, South Africa, Vietnam, US, Netherlands, Germany, Cyprus, UK......

Watch action movies. E.g Fast and Furious, Marvels, Mission Impossible,  Die Hard etc.

Enjoy good food and be a healthy chef! Steak, salmon, pasta, soups, porridge, fried rice.

Cycling, jogging and swimming during free time.

description:
(Only 2 adults are allowed in Harbour Hideaway)
This luxury one bedroom Apartment is on the lower level of our house, which overlooks Sydney Harbour, It has its own private entrance and is totally separate, it has direct access to the beach in Clontarf, there are 62 steps up to the apartment.
Seaforth Village and Manly are only a short drive away.
A wide variety of first-class dining and shopping options are available locally, some of the best Restaurants are just across the water.

The space
The apartment is unique in that it is on Clontarf beach so a swim or a kayak are only a short step away. It is also on the Spit to Manly walk which for the more adventurous will take you to Manly via the beautiful foreshore.

Guest access

neighborhood_overview:
We have a beautiful sandy beach 1 min across from the Apartment.....
We are also on the Spit to Manly walk way , which is a stunning costal walk on our doorstep.
We have 4 local restaurants on the water, 5 mins drive or a 30 min walk.
Manly is 10 mins away by car and you can also catch the ferry from Manly to the City which takes about 15
mins away by fast ferry...
I'm sure you will enjoy our little Clontarf Retreat....
host_about:
Live life to the full. It is a journey, so travel it well !

We love to travel to  different countries, we love all the different cultures people etc ...

We have our bucket list and we are trying to get through it  even though covid has changed it a little bit for the moment …

We have two beautiful girls who love to travel,  one lived in Copenhagen on an exchange, my other daughter has just finished  Uni In Wollongong 

I love hosting different people from all over the world, I strive to achieve 100% being a super host 

I’m always looking for feedback to improve...

description:
You have found one of the best food locations in Sydney to stay during your visit. Surrounded by busy cafes and popular restaurants, Potts Point is a vibrant "inner city village" that is walking distance away from city centre, Sydney Harbour, Opera House, NSW Art Gallery, Australian Museum, beautiful parks and excellent public transport is minutes away.

The space
Designed and equipped for Airbnb visitors, the apartment is situated in heritage building called The Springfield (corner of Orwell St and Llankelly Place, Potts Point Sydney). This apartment is on the 3rd floor of this building with no lift access. So we recommend that you are mobile and enjoy being active. We provide a high-quality bed (picture included), computer and many handy items to enhance your visit. Metro buses & trains are only minutes away. Daily visitor car parking vouchers are available on request. Check the street view to see how central this location is within Sydney.

If this a
neighborhood_overview:
Rich with history, culture and sophistication, Potts Point is an ideal place to stay or visit for those who want to enjoy the picturesque surroundings of a bygone era and still be close to everything Sydney has to offer.

Potts Point situated within Sydney City is just a short 20-minute walk to the CBD and a stone's throw from Kings Cross Railway Station, so you can easily catch a train to some of Sydney's major attractions. Sydney Buses, Taxis and Car Hire are also readily available in the immediate vicinity.
As for dining out, Victoria St, and in particular Macleay St, are dotted with a range of restaurants to suit all tastes. Kings Cross, Darlinghurst Rd offers a countless number of nightclubs, bars and theatres for those who enjoy the nightlife.

Or for the more subdued there are plenty of parks, museums and harbour side charm in the neighbouring suburbs.

name: Luxury apartment by the beach
description:
This newly renovated 2 bed unit in a great location on the edge of the South Pacfic ocean at North Bondi. It has a new lux stone tiled bathroom and kitchen, white washed floorboards. Surrounded by blue sea, with great restaurants and cafes right outside your door. This top floor unit has a terrace with views and a garage.

The space
This 2-bedroom beachside pad is in a perfect position in North Bondi. Sundrenched and light-filled, it has sweeping views of the South Pacific ocean and Bondi beach, as well as the distant lights of the city and Tamarama.

The apartment is designer decorated in laid-back beachside chic. Combined living and dining enjoys dining for 4 and a lounge area with 42” LED screen, Blueray, DVD, sound system (bring iPod or CDs) and cable television. Enjoy programmes in HD and even 3D. There is a high speed wi-fi connection as well.

The main bedroom has a Queen size bed while the second bedroom has a double, both w
neighborhood_overview: This is the best street in North Bondi, in the Ben Buckler enclave on the edge of the deep blue Pacific Ocean. Out the front door it is a 2-minute walk to the North Bondi village, with great cafes, cool little neighbourhood restaurants and local shops.  Meander another 2 minutes and you are on the sand of Bondi beach.  On the way, stop for a glass of wine and a plate of calamari at trendy North Bondi Fish.  Or pop upstairs for a schooner of beer and the best views of Bondi Beach at the laid back RSL Club, where travellers are always welcome.
host_about: I love the North Bondi lifestyle - my tip is to try and get out there at sunrise to tap into the local life, go for a surf or run the iconic coastal path to Bronte past Icebergs sea baths or just grab a coffee and chill on the legendary sands before they heat up with sun and sun worshippers.  Don't forget your bathers. THE BEST start to a day in Sydney.
neighbourhood: North Bondi, New South Wales, Australia

You will be staying in a unique duplex apartment on the top floor of a centrally located boutique building.

The apartment is over 2 levels with your room located downstairs giving guests a good level of privacy. The room is large with an exclusive use bathroom off it, a cute balcony, own fridge, coffee station and comfortable queen bed with luxury bedding.

Location in one of the best city suburbs with easy walking to everything you may need, lots of cool cafes and bars and lots to do.

The space
A charming two-level, two-bedroom, two-bathroom duplex apartment on the border of East Sydney, Darlinghurst and Kings Cross with everything that Sydney has to offer within easy walking distance: Sydney CBD 10mins, Hyde Park 5 mins, Oxford St 10 mins, Kings Cross 5mins

The apartment occupies the top floor of an older style boutique building. It is spacious, elegantly decorated in a modern contemporary style and very well equipped with all
neighborhood_overview:
The location is really central and there is number of things to do and see all within a few kilometres; Stanley St (Sydney’s little Italy) is just around the corner which has some great restaurants and a real European feel.
Darlinghurst is wall to wall of cafes, bars and restaurants to suite all tastes and budgets.
Woolloomooloo marina is at the bottom of the hill with its ritzy restaurants and famous residents (Russell Crow has the penthouse at end of wharf) it is beautiful to hang out on a nice evening.
The Australian Museum and The Art Gallery of NSW have both interesting exhibitions and evening events, The Bridge can be seen from my corner and the Opera House is a pleasant stroll through the Botanical Gardens and Domain.
Chinatown and Darling Harbour are just at the back of the CBD and Sydney colourful nightlife of both Kings Cross & Oxford St are on your doorstep.
I also have lots of more information on things to do while in Sydney just ask me.
On b
host_about:
I am originally Scottish but I have made Sydney my home for the last 20 years, I  love the city and the country and would not live anywhere else. I am well-travelled, I enjoy seeing new things, having new experiences, challenging myself and meeting new people.
I an a freelance HR Consultant and currently work from my home office, which is in my garage and currently around most of the time. My social life is varied, I have lots of different groups of friends, always doing something.   I am open-minded and value peoples differences, though I hate the term, this is a GLBTQ friendly house. 
I would describe myself as a bit of a "foodie";  host dinner parties/ soirees, I eat out and I travel for food.  I love shopping for the unusual from markets to tucked-away little shops, designer sample sales to high-end boutiques. I am creative, collect contemporary art and enjoy the creative arts.  
I also have a new puppy Archie, is currently (Feb 21) 6mth old, is a Japanese Spitz, only sheds his coat one a year and is very cute. He loves people and is good with other dogs. He is good on his house training and his general training and behaviour but can get a little excitable as a puppies do. 
My life's motto is "Be the best version of you" & " I can do that"

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is centrally located in Sydney's village like setting of Potts Point.

Everything is in on your door step – Woolworths Supermarkets is located 150m from the apartment making it easy for you to stock up on groceries, laundromats and dry cleaners a few doors down, post office across the road and all majors banks and ATMs within 100m.

On the weekend, stroll over to the markets right across the road for all types of great stalls from fresh food, organic produce, vintage clothes, plants, & flowers to name a few.

At night there is so much to see and do, restaurants, bars, nightclubs. Potts point really comes alive at night! You won't be sitting around.

I have become well accustomed to all the restaurants and bars in the area and supply a list on arrival of places I highly recommend if you are lost for ideas during your stay.

The building 'The Gordon' is a classic example of Art Deco architecture in a Potts Point. The
host_about:
Since I've had such great experiences with AirBnB, I thought it was only natural that I list my properties for visitors to Sydney. 

The inner eastern suburbs of Sydney  are swimming in good caffeine and food for that matter - any number of cuisines are available nearby as the area is scattered with amazing restaurants and cafes.  

The inner eastern suburbs is extremely central to what Sydney has to offer and has a great village feel to it.  I love living here and can't imagine living anywhere else and I hope for you to have the same experiences during your stay.

name: Sunny Darlinghurst Warehouse Apartment
description:
Sunny warehouse/loft apartment in the heart of one of Sydney's best neighbourhoods. Located on the corner of two iconic Darlinghurst streets famous for laneway bars and eateries, and just footsteps to equally amazing Surry Hills and Potts Point. Walk through beautiful parks to the city in less than 10 mins, the opera house in 20 and access Bondi Beach easily via the bus stop directly in front of the building.

The space
My apartment is a beautiful, simple, open plan / one bedroom loft with soaring high ceilings and hardwood floors that hint at it's previous life as a printing factory in the 1940s. It has huge windows that flood the space with glorious sunshine throughout the day and provide a refreshing breeze during summer.

A few key features:
* Wireless harman/kardon aura stereo system so you can stream your music wirelessly from any bluetooth device
* Internal laundry with washer and dryer
* The kitchen is equipped with gas cooking, m
neighborhood_overview:
Darlinghurst is home to some of Sydney's best restaurants, coffee and designers. The apartment is located on the corner of two iconic streets (Crown St and Stanley St) - famous for eateries, bars, boutiques and galleries. It's also a very short walk through beautiful Hyde Park to the centre of Sydney city and is an easy stroll to many other awesome neighbourhoods, including the creative precincts of Surry Hills and Potts Point. With galleries, museums, the Royal Botanic Gardens and other harbour side parks (even the Opera House!) all within walking distance, the apartment really offers the ideal base to explore from.

A few location highlights:
* There are many fantastic restaurants and cafes located on the same street as the apartment - literally footsteps from the front door
* Some of Sydney's coolest wine and cocktail bars are hidden in the laneways surrounding the apartment building, including Love Tilly Devine, Shady Pines and more...you won't need to budget f
host_about: Curious about the world and full of wanderlust. I am both an airbnb host and traveller. By day I work as a doctor and rent out my inner Sydney city loft when traveling myself for work or holidays. I love that this allows me to help share our beautiful harbour city with guests from all over the world.  As a traveller, I seek out experiences that offer me a glimpse into what local life is like in the places I visit.

name: Studio Yindi @ Mosman, Sydney
description:
An open plan apartment, adjacent to a spacious garden. Self-contained, bathroom, 1 queen size double bed in the open plan area, plus 2 single beds in the dedicated bedroom. Mosman is a smart Sydney suburb, with the harbour on 3 sides, 18 - 20 minutes from city centre by bus route 243.

The space
Studio Yindi is a self-contained, open plan studio apartment on Level 1 of our house, which opens onto a spacious garden. It includes bathroom, and a fully equipped basic but practical kitchen for self-catering.

There is 1 Queen size double bed which is screened off from the open plan area. The separate bedroom has 2 bunk style single beds. (see photo)

Furniture can be moved around, within reason in the open plan space to meet the needs of your group, for the acoustic or visual privacy that best suits you.

4 large sliding doors can be opened up on 3 sides of the open plan spaces to maximise the benefit of cooling north-easterly b
neighborhood_overview:
Mosman is a smart, middle to upper class suburb on Sydney's lower north shore, with Sydney Harbour on 3 sides. Mosman shopping centre has a village feel that makes it popular for fashion and food shoppers from all over Sydney.

There is lots of natural bush and wildlife in Mosman - the kookaburras and lorikeets are guaranteed to give you a noisy brilliant early morning dawn chorus in the summer time! Our location is convenient for a harbour edge walk to Manly, and visiting Sydney's famous Taronga Zoo.

Studio Yindi is a great base for seeing Sydney in detail. The hosts are regular oversees travellers themselves, and we enjoy the variety, surprise and informality of AirBnB accommodation.

There are lots of interesting cafes and restaurants within 10 minutes drive, many of which will also home deliver.
host_about:
Faber est suae quisquae fortunae

We became Airbnb.com hosts back in December 2010.   I was originally an architect, but worked in IT sales/marketing for the next 30+ years.  Semi-retired now,  I still manage consulting projects involving the Internet for small-medium businesses and some community based campaigns to promote better planning outcomes for the whole community, not just developers and their “top end of town” mates.

I call myself an Internet Architect on my business card these days.  Most of my current projects involve marketing using social media tools.

A born and bred Sydneysider, I lived in UK for 10 years till 1984.  I have done lots of travel in Europe, Turkey, Egypt, Jordan, Sri Lanka, Thailand, China, Vietnam, Japan, New Zealand, USA. 

Studio Yindi incorporates the things we look for when selecting boutique hotels, pensions, hostels and B&Bs for ourselves - space, privacy, wifi Internet access, reading light at the bedside, comfortable and practical for working while "on the road", a bit unusual, a little surprise, and value for money. 

My own preferences are for adventure and off the beaten track, rather than luxury, international 5 star. 

We love meeting travellers from all parts of the world, and helping them enjoy the experience of a first visit to Sydney.

We have lots of experience assisting overseas based friends and colleagues to see the best parts of Sydney, using public transport, and avoiding the expensive tourist services.

Messing about on boats is one of my passions. I have a 7.2 m (24') yacht moored nearby on the harbour and know a lot about the nice parts of our extensive waterways, including its part in Australian history.  I love sharing tips on how to see the best of the harbour, using inexpensive public ferries, plus strolls around Cremorne Point from Mosman Bay, or the 3 - 4 hour walk from the Spit to Manly, via Sydney Harbour National Park.

My major work project now is as a volunteer Director of the Keeping Place centre for aboriginal art, culture and history.  Our biggest challenge is finding a permanent physical home for 2000+ pieces of art and sculpture, plus 200,000+ photographs!

name: Charming 1880s Newtown Terrace
description:
Charming 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom terrace in central Newtown. Was originally built in the 1880s and has recently been renovated with modern upgrades.

The space
Our house is available from time to time, usually when we go on holidays over summer.

It is an 1880s two-floor terrace with three bedrooms and two bathrooms in the heart of Newtown, Sydney — the same street that Henry Lawson, Australia's great bush poet, lived. In fact, he lived in the terraces opposite us.

With a one-minute walk to King St and Enmore Rd, you can access dozens of pubs, restaurants and shops all the way up and down these two iconic Sydney streets. One minute from Newtown train station too, which means you can also be in the city in 10-15 minutes!

Our terrace has recently been renovated and has new spotted gum wooden floorboards, two brand new bathrooms with large showers, a claw foot bath, classic subway tiles and fixtures, plus a brand new kitchen with mode
host_about:
I'm a writer and musician from Sydney, Australia. I was born in London but grew up in Sydney from the age of 3. I have published books of my poems and I've released records with bands that I've played in over the years. I also work in a bookshop, but also sometimes as an editor and a creative writing teacher.

My partner is a Human Rights lawyer and a writer as well. She grew up in Albury. Her parents are Irish. She likes to run long distances.

We have a Staffordshire Terrier. She is very neat.

Apartment overlooking the water

One queen size fully furnished room available in a high rise apartment with beautiful water views from most rooms. Lift access, sharing with 1 female.

Modern furnishings, large bright airy apartment, balcony to sit and enjoy the view.

Nearby

Its just a 2 minute walk to the bus stop where you can get to the Sydney CBD in 20 minutes. The beach is 10 minutes walk and Manly is a 10 minute drive across the Spit Bridge and easily accessible by bus.

Mosman has many cafes and restaurants and a great shopping strip if you want to buy a gift for yourself or the people back home. The beautiful and historic Taronga Zoo is right nearby and there are many bushwalks in the area.

For You!

host_about:
Mid 30s, professional, I enjoy weekends at the beach, trying one of the many restaurants and cafes in Sydney, and spending time with friends and family.   I don't have any kids or pets, I love cooking and enjoy an occasional night in with a good dvd. 

I enjoy traveling both internationally and within Australia and my favourite destinations have the Greek Islands and Italy.  I have done a lot of travel around Australia and can offer useful travel insights into where to go and what to do!

name: Bright spacious terrace in desirable leafy street
description:
About me:
- 5 star reviews
- more than 8 years experience hosting happy guests

About the property:
- bright spacious room flooded with natural light
- large terrace with original features
- beautiful artistic details
- safe location and secure house including safe in bedroom
- bedrooms on quiet upper level of dual floor house
- two bathrooms
- prize location in loved street

About transport:
Bus stop 2 minute walk
Central station 15 minutes (city centre)

The space
I will try to provide as much relevant information concerning the house and the location, though if you have any queries please send a message.


Kepos Terrace is on the border of Surry Hills / Redfern and it is perfect for exploring Sydney with bus stops around the corner taking you in any direction, or there is much to see and do within walking distance. The nearest train station is Central Station.
neighborhood_overview: We are surrounded by cafes, restaurants, pubs and bars in Dank, Crown & Bourke Streets, all within easy walking distance, and a short walk to Centennial Park. Our current guest referred to this area as a 'hipsters neighbourhood', and I quite agree. I like that it is accepting of all age groups and at any hour of the day ( it seems ), there are people in the streets.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Paris! 

Welcome to Sydney and Kepos Terrace. 

I've lived and studied in Sydney all my life, and I love where I live. 
I'm an artist, so ask me a thousand questions about the Sydney art scene, but watch me blush if your query requires sports knowledge. 

I graduated with an honors degree with National Art School NSW, so there are a few of my paintings around the house, and I am currently working on my next piece.  

I do work full-time, and regularly I attend new shows and gallery openings after work,  and on the weekends I like to have no plans but to simply enjoy being around the house and sometimes having friends over. I am quite busy during the week,  but on the weekends I have more time to sit and talk with  you about my ideas and thoughts about places to go and things to do in Sydney, or even to plan to see events together.     

Regarding pets, I have a lovely cat named Roger, who is friendly and very well mannered. He will come for a pat if encouraged, or he will leave you alone,  (he gets a mention in every review).

I have done some traveling, and in 2009 I traveled through New York with airbnb. 

That's me in a nutshell! 

We look forward to meeting you.

name: Great Location, Paris End,  Potts Point Sydney
description:
This immaculate apartment is private, modern and recently renovated, on the second floor of a beautiful historic Art Deco building. Surrounded by the best restaurants, cafes, scenic destinations, leafy quiet parks and nightlife, Potts Point is the Ideal location to explore Sydney.

The space
This beautiful apartment is private, modern and recently renovated, on the second floor of a beautiful historic Art Deco building. It is fully furnished with large windows that allow lots of natural light and airflow. The apartment has unlimited high speed Wi-Fi throughout the entire space. We've also provided the basics in terms of kitchen and bathroom essentials for your convenience. There is a secure door to enter the apartment complex, complete with intercom.

The apartment is tucked away in a quiet leafy street not far from the bustling life of Potts Point and Kings Cross. In Potts Point, you are close to everything. It is brimming with little cafes, great rest
neighborhood_overview:
Potts Point has undergone a huge transformation to become one of the trendiest, most appealing neighbourhoods in Sydney. It's one of the most sought-after areas and best-kept secrets in the city, and around every corner is something incredible to do or see.

The neighbourhood is full of Art Deco apartment blocks, terraces squeezed between multi-level buildings, as well as small, quaint and intriguing cafes, bars and boutique shops. Leafy, tree-lined streets alternate between avenues full of bustling life.

The location of our apartment is convenient to everything. Surrounded by fine dining restaurants, quirky bars and antique and retro shops. The organic fresh farmer market is held every weekend and both Woolworths and Harris Farm are close by. The Kings Cross train station is an easy 10 minute walk and the Sydney CBD, Opera House, Botanical Gardens and Rushcutters Bay are all within walking distance.

Spacious self-contained bayside apartment in quiet location with beautiful views over Malabar Bay, Malabar Headland and across to Maroubra. 5 minute walk to the nearest golf course. Ocean pool just a 5 minute walk away & 10 minutes walk to the beach.
New headland walk from Malabar beach to Maroubra which has spectacular ocean views. Also 10 minute drive to La Perouse National Park.
Bus to city 5 minutes walk.
**PLEASE NOTE: There is min 1 week booking between 19th May and 6th August 2019***

The space
Fully self contained top storey of house with separate access, own balcony with beautiful bay and ocean views. Swim at Malabar beach or ocean pool which is only a 5 minute walk away. Easy access to many beautiful bays and beaches and interesting walks.

Spacious living area with well equipped kitchen, large bedroom with queen size bed and large built-in wardrobe, modern bathroom, and your own washing machine. Just a 5 minute walk to the
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is quiet as house is in a residential street. As the bay is quite small, there are never large crowds using the beach. The golf course & club are very picturesque being on the ocean front. The ocean pool is very popular with guests and with ourselves as it is 5 minutes walk so no need to take anything with you but your towel, keys and sunscreen.
Nearest eating and drinking venues are the Leagues club which also provides reasonably priced and varied meals. The golf club is more expensive but still good value. There is also a Chinese restaurant and fast food places within a 10 minute walk and some excellent cafés especially the Heritage and Beach Cafés. La Perouse, Little Bay, Yarra Bay and Maroubra are 10 minutes drive away and have a good selection of cuisines.

I am a single parent in Sydney with a split level loft style apartment in Redfern. During the major holidays I always get out of town and look to rent my home out for the duration of my holidays.  My home is cosy and clean and has everything you'd need for a comfortable holiday in Sydney's vibrant City.
When I book accommodation through airbnb for my own holidays - I do always travel with my young son.  He is a great kid and really very well behaved but he is a kid so the accom I look for would have to be child friendly.

name: Potts Point Apt - Regents Court A
description:
Freshly renovated, furnished, sunny, studio apartment with an amazing location and shared access to a beautiful roof terrace garden. The garden has views of the city skyline, Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Wonderfully located on our unique Springfield Avenue in Potts Point.

The space
★ If the dates you want are not available but you would still like the convenience of Potts Point, please view my other listings close by.

★ The building is the art deco Regents Court. Originally built as gentleman's chambers in 1926 and once home to actors, painters, dancers and writers, Regents Court is a great boutique accommodation option in one of Sydney's funkiest neighbourhoods.

The apartment, located on the top floor, has a large north facing (what you want in the southern hemisphere to catch the sun) picture window. The spacious studio has been designed to offer a more comfortable accommodation alternative to discerning travellers. The apartment has
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in Potts Point, one of the most cosmopolitan neighbourhoods in Australia. It is a vibrant inner-urban community with grand old Art Deco buildings and harbour-side parks. It's walking distance to the city through the Botanic Gardens.
host_about:
My family and I live in Potts Point. We love it and think it is the best neighbourhood in Sydney. It is full of life - cafes, restaurants, bars, markets, shops and parks. If Potts Point does not have it, it is nearby by foot, taxi or public transport. It is rated as the most liveable part of Sydney.

We like to travel. I have been fortunate enough to live in Singapore (Tanglin School), France (Dijon - Universite di Bourgogne), Holland (Delft), Italy (Perugia - Universita per Stranieri), UK (London), PNG (Moresby) and Germany (Hamburg). Our experience in travelling and living abroad has been distilled into our apartments.

Airbnb gives us the opportunity to offer to you the five homes we own (not just manage) in this neighbourhood for your stay in Sydney.

All our homes are well designed, comfortable, clean, secure and fully equipped with everything you will need to enjoy your holiday or business trip. We live a minute away so we are available should you need something.

HELPFUL TIP: If you are new to Airbnb, and have not yet completed your profile, it is highly recommended by both Airbnb and myself, that you do. If this is not completed prior to contacting me, then please take the time to introduce yourself in your first contact message when sending in an inquiry or booking request. We would like to know who is coming to our homes. 

The homes we have on Airbnb can be found below.
neighbourhood: Potts Point, New South Wales, Australia

name: Hastings Family Hideaway—Footsteps to Bondi Beach
description:
Positioned on one of Bondi’s most coveted streets, this family-friendly apartment is a stone’s throw from the sand and surf. Take in the views from Ben Buckler, learn to surf on Bondi Beach and discover back-to-back cafes, restaurants and boutiques lining Hall and Gould streets. Wake to watch the sun rise over the ocean and follow the scenic coastal trail from Bondi to Bronte. Come home to this relaxed and cosy apartment, with high ceilings and an unbeatable address designed for coastal living.

The space
Those looking to immerse themselves in Sydney’s laidback coastal lifestyle need look no further. This quintessential Bondi Beach apartment has everything you need on your doorstep – including the sparkling shoreline, vibrant cafes and public transport straight to the city centre.

Stepping inside, you’ll find a warm and inviting living space to start and end your day. There is plush sofa seating, with books and a TV catering to your entertainment needs
neighborhood_overview: There's a good reason why Bondi is Australia's most famous beach. Go for a surf, swim in glistening ocean pools or walk along the foreshore on the clifftop Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk. On Hall Street you'll find renowned restaurants and cafes – including Bills, Gelato Messina and A Tavola - while the waterfront strip of Campbell Parade is lined with surf rentals, fish 'n' chip shops and trendy bars. There's something to enjoy at every hour of the day. Don't miss a morning coffee and pastry at Sonoma, perusing Australian designer fashion along Gould Street and a sundowner at Hotel Ravesis overlooking the ocean. An express bus ride will take you straight from the beach to Bondi Junction and onward to the CBD.
host_about: I enjoy exploring and discovering new places and being able to learn from different cultures.  I love meeting people from all over the world and I look forward to connecting with you as a host. I am thrilled to have found what I do and I am excited for my next adventures!
neighbourhood: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia

name: Rainforest garden apartment - deck
description:
Fabulous location for travellers and business people working in the CBD of Sydney or North Sydney. Transport very close with even the ability to walk either to the city or North Sydney.

The space
Charming apartment with one room to rent, 5 minutes walk to Kirribilli Village with great choice of restaurants, cafes, small supermarkets and boutique shops. 5 minutes walk to Sydney Harbour Bridge, a ferry to the city or train to the city or suburbs. 2 minutes walk to a bus into the city, harbour foreshore and the Ensemble Theatre. Added bonus is the rainforest garden and outdoor deck.

Kirribilli is across the harbour from the CBD, so you can easily avail yourself of the transport or get some exercise walking across the bridge - spectacular. There are beautiful harbour foreshore walks from here too in different directions

There is a charming single room for one person with a bathroom to share. Wifi is available, along with landline to Austr
neighborhood_overview: Kirribilli is a wonderful neighbourhood with a delightful village feel - great coffee shops, with a terrific choice of local restaurants and bars - seafood, Asian, modern Australian, burgers - all very close to the harbour.
host_about:
I am a single woman, who is now retired from paid work.  I now do a bit of volunteer work and spend time connecting with friends old and new, and play boules and mahjong when I can.  I am also enjoying discovering walks in various parts of Sydney - I am amazed how I can be delighted by new discoveries in the city of my birth. All the better informed for guests from out of town. 
I have lived and travelled extensively - San Francisco, Tokyo, Saigon and outside of London when I was a child.  Love to travel and meet new people, particularly those from other places.  Have travelled in Asia, and a bit in Europe. Love Italy and la dolce vita.  Have seen quite a bit of the US (my dad took me to New York for my 14th birthday!!) and been on safari in Africa but not made it to other continents yet.  
Can't imagine life without friends, good spicy food and the prospect of another travel adventure.  Have backpacked, and travelled in style, kayaked down rivers and even hiked the Kokoda Track sharing a backpack with my boyfriend of the time.  I continue to travel now with perhaps the focus being on catching up with beloved friends all over the world from the days of living and working overseas.
Now prefer softer options along with a good bottle of wine, delicious food of the region wherever, classical music or some great rock.
Age is a state of mind rather than the years lived, and it is good to be able to look backwards and forwards.
I love meeting people through airbnb - different chats over a glass of wine and if the opportunity arises showing them the lesser known beauty of Sydney.

name: Pittwater Boat House
description:
This is an intimate two storey Boathouse suitable for the romantic getaway situated on the waterfront at Clareville. Set amongst native palms and gum trees with a magnificent view across Pittwater, the Boat House is a romantic one bedroom retreat with its own jetty, outdoor spa, outdoor dining area, kayaks and a small motor boat ideal for fishing and exploring Pittwater.

The space
Magnificent romantic hide away, right on the water. Minutes from Avalon Beach. Interior designed boat house. One romantic bedroom with stunning views across Refuge Cove. All entertainment systems (website hidden), dvd, music system.

Down spiral staircase to kitchen breakfast room. Leading through to shower room. Full width windows to beautiful sundrenched patio with day bed, bbq, wine cooler and out door spa. Down a few steps to your very own beach

Fish of your very own jetty or use the two kayaks or motor boat to explore this unique little corner of the world
neighborhood_overview: Avalon is just a few minutes drive with it's bountiful choice of restaurants, cafes, surfing, ocean pool, cinema, bookstore and supermarket. Clareville Beach is a 5 minute walk from the Boat House and close to a residents lane offering a small secluded part of the beach there.  Clareville Kiosk, one of the best restaurant's on the Northern Beaches, is a two minute drive or an 8 minute walk. This restaurant is ideal for a special occasion dinner but you will have to book. Alternatively,  have lunch at  Bay View right on the water until the sun disappears.

description:
Hideaway Cottage is nestled on the shores of Fisherman's Bay in Port Hacking in the Royal National Park, just 50 klms drive south of the Sydney CBD. It is a quiet location abundant with wildlife and wonderful bushland walks. There is so much to explore locally but still within comfortable distance of exploring the main sites that Sydney has to offer
Please check NSW Health for travel restrictions before booking
Fully vaccinated guests or negative results within 48 hours only, at this stage

The space
Experience the best of the Australian bush and Sydney city life with a holiday in this spacious open plan and comfortable waterfront cottage, hidden away at the end of a bush trail and located on the shores of beautiful Fisherman's Bay in the Royal National Park within 50kms from the Sydney CBD and just 40 minutes from Sydney Airport.
Whether you are traveling from overseas to experience Sydney and the surrounds or just want a great short getaway wit
neighborhood_overview:
A special part of the world. If you want a slice of the Australian Bush and also like the water and still do not want to travel for hours to find both. Then this is for you.
The Maianbar/Bundeena basin is an artists haven and there are plenty of small studios to explore.
host_about:
I spent 2014/15 taking a much needed break and spent the time exploring hidden gems in Europe.  I was based  at a friend's place in Surrey in England and spent much of my time in Germany, Portugal and Wales, before setting our on my own.  
I enjoy meeting people of all ages and exploring different places and cultures.  I have two sons who thought I was a little crazy traveling on my own but the people I met and the places I have stayed were fantastic.
I am looking forward to hosting so I can repay some of the kindnesses shown to me.

name: Potts Point Apt - Sunny with Views
description:
Furnished, sunny, 1 bedroom apartment with a beautiful view of the city skyline through a huge picture window. Wonderfully located on our unique Springfield Avenue in Potts Point.
Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood.

The space
★ If the dates you want are not available but you would still like the convenience of Potts Point, please follow this link https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/1261500/listings to view my other listings close by.

★ The building is art deco. The apartment has windows on three sides. It has a queen sized bed, a kitchen with dishwasher, a washer/drier and a two flat-screen TVs.

★★ Key Features ★★
LIVING ROOM:
- Plasma TV
- PlayStation 2 & a selection of games
- Dvd player (in the playstation)
- ipod sound cube
- Tastefully & comfortably furnished
- Huge west facing window
- Unlimited wireless internet connection
- Fireplace
- Desk

KITCHEN
neighborhood_overview:
Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC).

During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings, and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urban community.
host_about:
My family and I live in Potts Point. We love it and think it is the best neighbourhood in Sydney. It is full of life - cafes, restaurants, bars, markets, shops and parks. If Potts Point does not have it, it is nearby by foot, taxi or public transport. It is rated as the most liveable part of Sydney.

We like to travel. I have been fortunate enough to live in Singapore (Tanglin School), France (Dijon - Universite di Bourgogne), Holland (Delft), Italy (Perugia - Universita per Stranieri), UK (London), PNG (Moresby) and Germany (Hamburg). Our experience in travelling and living abroad has been distilled into our apartments.

Airbnb gives us the opportunity to offer to you the five homes we own (not just manage) in this neighbourhood for your stay in Sydney.

All our homes are well designed, comfortable, clean, secure and fully equipped with everything you will need to enjoy your holiday or business trip. We live a minute away so we are available should you need something.

HELPFUL TIP: If you are new to Airbnb, and have not yet completed your profile, it is highly recommended by both Airbnb and myself, that you do. If this is not completed prior to contacting me, then please take the time to introduce yourself in your first contact message when sending in an inquiry or booking request. We would like to know who is coming to our homes. 

The homes we have on Airbnb can be found below.
neighbourhood: Potts Point, New South Wales, Australia

name: Manly - Gorgeous Large Art Deco Apartment
description:
Welcome to my stunning 2 Bedroom Art Deco Apartment where you can glimpse the ocean through the trees in the park. 5 minutes walk to famous Manly Beach and 2 minutes walk to the even more famous Sydney Harbour and the Manly Ferry. The Bedrooms have AIR-CON the other rooms do not but it is double brick so remain cool in the other rooms. The kitchen and reception rooms have recently been renovated and the whole place has been freshly painted.

The space
The apartment takes up the whole floor and is bathed in light with really high ceilings! Can you see the Griffins holding the Holy Grail in the ceiling roses in the lounge room? This Art Deco darling is full of magic and the history of a bygone era and yet is fresh and modern at the same time.

Guest access
Just a few cupboards where we put our clothes

Other things to note
There are 270 cafes and restaurants in the Manly area many are world class so you will be spoilt for
neighborhood_overview:
Manly is just stunning like the brochures say: "7 Miles from Sydney, 100 Miles from Care." Every day I wake up and feel grateful that I live in paradise. Whether it is strolling along the Harbour at dusk and seeing the Little Penguins waddling up the sand or walking along the Ocean Beach and seeing Dolphins frolicking in the waves.

Manly is a fairytale world full of delightful surprises. Fairy Bower hugs the coastal cliffs on the way to Shelly Beach and you can discover the miniature sculptures along the way. Or snorkel and watch a huge Blue Groper and other coloured fish. Or find the hanging pond through the hole in the convict sandstone wall. Or watch the waves crash wildly against the sandstone cliffs on the other side of Shelly Beach. Or discover the hidden tunnel cave at the Queenscliff end of Manly Beach. Or if you like meandering around the shops you can find the unexpected treasures at the Vintage Vinnies, the weekend markets or the little shops along the Corso.
host_about: I am a warm, happy welcoming person. I have a passion for the 12th Century when there were Knights and Ladies and Fairytales were born, although I know that life wasn't really like that then. Many of the decorations in my home reflect this kind of theme and the Pre-Raphaelite Movement in Art. I love Paris, South America and Vietnam, as well as, Native American Culture. I read hugely mainly historic fiction. I travel overseas at least once a year and sometimes two or three times. I have been running my own Life Coaching and Training business for over 14 years now and work from home. I love horses and most animals and have a very shy little cat called Tiger, but you may not see him. I also love to write and have a book almost completed called "Once Upon an Archetype - Your Quest for Passion, Purpose and Identity. My life motto is "Follow your Bliss". PS I make really great gluten free pancakes!

Walking distance to several beaches, supermarkets, restaurants and parks. Getting to Manly's cafe scene and
neighborhood_overview:
Balgowlah is a great area and has the luxury of being close to the beach while having the city easily accessible as well.

Surrounded by natural beauty, the area is blessed with several beaches and stunning nature reserves where you can while away the time picnicking, barbecuing and sunning yourself or enjoying many of the adventure or sporting activities the area has to offer.

Not far from the cafe culture and Bar scene of Manly, Balgowlah also has an array of restaurants and cafes right on the doorstep

Hi! I'm Lucy. 

I’m all about coffee, health &  fitness, good food & wine, exploring cities, discovering great restaurants, nightlife and enjoying live music.

Sydney is a beautiful city and I’m so lucky to live here!

Welcome to our home. We hope you enjoy your stay with us. Our home is situated in between Sydney CBD and the Blue Mountains, near to Nepean River. We love to receive guests and offer hospitality - you will have your own space with a seperate bedroom, bathroom and living room. You are welcome to join us for meals or to have your own use of the kitchen space.

The space
The bedroom has a double bed and plenty of space to unpack your clothes and belongings and relax. You also have use of the pool and outdoor space. you are welcome to use facilities such as the kitchen space and laundry. We are happy to show you local sites such as the Nepean River and the Blue Mountains. The CBD of Sydney is easily accessible by train.

host_about:
Love to travel and meet other travellers. I've been to over 40 countries and have lived for 9+ years in three. So I'd like to think that I'm quite familiar with most cultures of the world. Easy going, friendly, and respectful. 

I work during the day in a big bank, and after work am mostly doing other types of activities!

The outdoors is much better than indoors, but sometimes its nice to relax and do nothing.

Hobbies: Running, music, exploring, freediving, movies, eating and laughing!

Favourite places:
Mongolia
Iceland 
North Korea (not really a 'favourite' but definitely an eye opening experience)
Japan
Greek Islands
Cambodia
Tanzania
North America 
Philippines
And Australia

Hope to meet you all one day on this blue/green planet we call Earth!

G'day!

Please use the squeejie provided in the bathroom for showe

Or catch a bus or train ride from Campbell Parade or Bondi Road into the city and beyond.

description:
A 'traditional' style B&B run as a lifestyle, not as a business. Centrally located in a tranquil bush setting within walking distance to everything Palm Beach has to offer All 4 rooms have queen or king beds, ensuites and ocean or Pittwater view balconies. Tastefully decorated, not overdone.

The space
This is the Riviera room. Room rate shown is for one bedroom (one couple) Discounts are available for off peak seasons and multiple night stays. doesn't hurt to ask !!! (There are 3 other bedrooms in all accommodating 8 people.)

Off street parking for most guests

host_about:
Rudi is a well travelled host, classic Baby Boomer, chucked in a successful corporate/executive career many many years ago to embark on a life of rolling mid life crisis and bucket list fulfilment A self confessed motoring enthusiast with a broad  penchant for the classic and unique, don't do 'normal' cars.  Never did grow up and not planning on doing it any time soon !!! A typical Saggitarian ... 

Avalon hails from Adelaide but has lived in Sydney for more than 40 years, over 20 of them in … Avalon !!! Since joining Rudi over 7 years ago she has added a much appreciated female touch in every aspect of the Bed & Breakfast. Now entering its 25th year it continues to improve and is becoming more enjoyable day by day.   

Our B&B motto, since day one has been “A traditional style B&B that's not run as a business but as a way of life” ... and it shows"

name: STUNNING City Loft Warehouse Apt
description:
A large inner-city loft apartment in a beautifully refurbished heritage listed warehouse building. One train stop from the city. Stay in a historical part of Sydney!

This refurbished creative space is tastefully decorated & styled, featuring artworks everywhere and plenty of books

With a dedicated office area, 3 large tables (one with 24" monitor+inkjet printer) & fast 100Mbps FTTB WIFI, all working from home needs are covered

Contact us for significant discounts on stays of two weeks or more

The space
Constructed in the late 1880's, the building originally served as a steel and metal work factory, along with the locomotive and carriage rail workshops located nearby in the Eveleigh railyards and the Carriageworks theatre site. It is an example of industrial design in the Victorian era, with the building's history and story recounted within the foyers of the building in a museum-like display of objects and photographs.
neighborhood_overview:
Located 1 train stop from the city in the inner city area of Darlington in Sydney. We are next to Surry Hills, Central, Redfern, Chippendale and Newtown.

The local area is vibrant and lovely with 5 cafes at my doorstep. There is an organic farmers market held every Saturday morning 3 min walk away.

Redfern has become the new 'hip' area with lots of new bars and restaurants a short 5-10 minute walk away.

We are very close to the Universities.
It is a 5-10 minute walk to University of Sydney and University of Technology.
host_about:
I am French/Australian and reside in Europe for part of the year each year which is why I often rent out my beautiful apartment. I am passionate about the city I live in and hope to share lots of tips with you. I also speak fluent French if you prefer to use that language when communicating with me. 

I look forward to meeting you.

A quiet oasis very close to the city, Wondakiah offers landscaped gardens between two nature reserves and waterfront to Sydney Harbour.

name: Great studio next to Carriageworks
description:
Our bright and peaceful studio is perfect for short to medium stays in Sydney. Situated in the city's funkiest suburb, only a few blocks from Sydney uni, Carriageworks Performance Space, RPA hospital and public transport. Can even walk to the city!

The space
We have recently renovated our self Contained Studio Apartment at the back of our property. It is bright and spacious with everything you could need for your stay. There is separate access from the side lane so you can be as private as you like but we are available for advice should you need it. The studio is set up for two adults however we are happy to accomodate families with a vast amount of kids paraphernalia around that you are welcome to borrow.

Location:
The studio is adjacent to Carriageworks with its multiple performance spaces, saturday farmers market and monthly artisan market. The local streetscape is quiet with beautiful mature english plane trees lining both sides.
neighborhood_overview: Newtown is very funky and ecclectic. The suburb has gentrified a lot in the last 20 years so it has a suaver edge to the grittiness.  King St is the main street with up and coming designer shops and every kind of restaurant you could dream of.  Over the last few years there has been a bit of a baby boom in the area which has made it very child friendly.
host_about:
Life is great.  I have 2 great kids, an amazing husband and a great career in a wood workshop.  We are keen sailors, campers and generally outdoorsy people.  

As a host, I try to give our guests maximum privacy while still being available to answer questions or deal with issues should they arise.  As a guest, I'm very respectful of the places we stay and know what goes into a changeover so try to help out where I can.

I grew up in Sydney and have finally returned after many years living in various parts of the world - France, USA, UK, Singapore.  Airbnb has enabled us to keep the travel bug alive within us.

name: Sydneys garden suburb, bright & SC
description:
The space
G'day!
Our studio apartment is self contained with a Queen size bed, sofa, dining table and chairs, work bench and plenty of storage space. It is equipped with TV, Wi Fi, Air Cond, well stocked kitchen, bathroom with shower and a private entrance. You would also have the use of our pool and we can do your washing for a small fee if need be.

We live in what is known as Sydney's Hills district and are within walking distance to Muirfield Golf Course and Westfield shopping Centre, North Rocks. Macquarie University, one of Australia's leading universities is not far away.

The studio apartment is attached to our house which overlooks Bidjigal Reserve, a place of rugged natural beauty and full of hidden treasures; a time capsule of ancient ecosystems, aboriginal shelters and colonial history with sheer sandstone cliffs, towering eucalypt forest, sparkling creeks and sheltered rainforest gullies, it is an oasis of natural habitat in the
host_about:
Friendly and fun-loving; I'm a retired businesswoman, mother of six children and five gorgeous grandchildren.  Together with my partner I love to travel the world far and wide although there are still many countries we have yet to experience.  We occasionally host international homestay students, having had visitors from the USA, Turkey, Japan, Korea, Thailand, China, Colombia, Peru, Argentina and Germany and would love to host Airbnb members visiting Sydney.

“One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion”  Simone de Beauvoir (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: 2BD house close to beaches & city
description:
Cosy two bedroom house close to Sydney's best beaches, including Bondi, and the vast Centennial Park, in a great little neighbourhood. The city centre is only a 15 minute bus ride from the end of the street. The house is ideal for a couple or small family.

The space
Our two bedroom terrace house has been recently renovated and is a great place to be if you're visiting Sydney over summer. It's close to beaches, including Bondi, and very convenient to the city - near rail and buses. We're in a pretty and quiet street with a small park 50 metres away that kids love. Centennial park is 5 minutes walk away.

The house has two large bedrooms. One has a king size double bed, the other has a bunk bed suitable for up to two children. We also have a portacot for very young children. It has a modern and well equipped kitchen and a TV with HDD/DVD player/recorder, as well as wifi. The bathroom is best described as 'efficient' - it's small but new and clean. There'
host_about:
I live in Sydney with my partner Melanie and son Elliot (8). We love living in Bondi Junction - it's so easy to get to the beach or the city and there's always something to do. We've done a fair bit of travelling, especially in Europe, and our favourite part of it is always living in someone's home so we can get a sense of what it's like to be local - that's why we're happy to list our place on Air BnB. 

As we will only be renting out our place when we are away, we won't get the chance to meet you if you stay in our home, but hopefully you'll get a sense of who we are from where we live.

name: Private room with Bronte beach view
description:
The space
I have a private room available in a lovely apartment with Bronte beach views from the garden!

Your Space & Shared Facilities
The room can be arranged as two separate single beds or the beds can be put together as a double bed!

You will be sharing the bathroom and kitchen with a friendly, easy going family. WiFi and Cable TV are available and there are laundry facilities for you to use.

Location, Shops & Transport
The apartment is 5 minutes walk to the beach, and just a moment to transport to the city, trendy local restaurants and cafes. All the basics can be found in Bronte itself, and there are some lovely breakfast cafes such as the Bogey Hole Cafe along the beach front.

Catch the bus from the beach directly into central Sydney in about 20 minutes, or up to the train station in 10 or less. The Westfield shopping centre at Bondi Junction hosts every shop you could possibly need!
host_about: I enjoy living near Bronte beach with my family!  Come and see this beautiful part of the world! I'm happy to suggest great things to see and do.

name: Dee Why 2 bed unit- stroll to beach
description:
The space
Come and stay in my bright and sunny top floor 2 bed apartment located on Sydney's Northern Beaches, just a short stroll to the beautiful Dee Why Beach. Buses to the city and Manly are at the door. There is a ferry from Manly to the City. Close to the shops and beachside restaurants and cafes.
Dee Why beach is a hub of cafes and restaurants right next to a 2km long surf beach. There is an Ocean pool at the beach as well as a grassed BBQ area if you dont want to get sandy.

Guest access

You will have access to a bathroom, toilet, kitchen and laundry shared with the host.

name: AMAZING STUDIO, In URBAN OASIS!
description:
BEST LOCATION, BEST RATE!
Great Coffee Everywhere!

The space
Welcome Home!

This amazing studio offers a real home feel in an Art Deco building of 16 apartments with a common rooftop offering district views. The apartment offers a great use of space, with sleeping alcove and has been beautifully renovated in a chic, contemporary manner optimising all available space. The studio is fully furnished with all linen and towels provided.

Set in an urban oasis, in the middle of Sydney's best bars, restaurants and night life, small and tidy but everything you need and want, plus a few extras - security building, built in surround sound with docking system, American Oak floor boards, lux double bed, 40 inch flat screen, blue ray and plenty of dvds, Internal laundry, fully renovated kitchen with oven, dishwasher, range-hood, 40mm stone bench-tops and hexagonal splash back tile.

Fully renovated bathroom in white with curved vanity and
neighborhood_overview: The location is arguably the best and boarders all the hip suburbs like Potts Point, Paddington and Darlinghurst, literally seconds away from great Darlo restaurants, Potts Point bars and the night life of Kings Cross. The apartment is centrally located to everything, including supermarkets (a 3min walk on the same street) and wifi cafes, which are literally next door at Jeremy & Sons Cafe. Walk 17min west and you'll be in the heart of the city, 10min walk south and you'll end up on Oxford street, 10 min east and you'll be exposed to incredible harbour views and parks, the Botanic Gardens and Opera House are also walking distance with the night life of Kings Cross only steps away. Feeling lazy? Kings Cross train station is less than a 5min walk and will get you in the city within 7min and only 2 stops away from Bondi.
host_about:
A lover of food, wine, the arts, theatre and travel. Love meeting new people and get excited telling them local places to check out in Syd!

Love where I live and sharing it with people, passionate about music, life and being by the harbour or beach.

name: Huge bright loft in sunny Sydney
description:
This beautiful private loft space takes out the 3rd level of this modern terrace.
Lots of space, windows facing east and west (sunrise and sunset - yay).
Fully furnished - with modern and hand built furniture.
No joke: Location location location.

The space
I'm renting my really big (i'm not exaggerating, it's huge), really bright and airy, fully furnished, relaxing bedroom-loft in inner Sydney.

My room occupies the entire 3rd floor of a beautiful and modern 5 bedroom terrace. It's a loft (no door) and it's stunning.

You'll be sharing the house with 5 friends, young (25-30) professional and from varying backgrounds. Girls and boys, all very friendly and social who will make you feel welcome.

The house has new bathrooms and kitchen, which is all yours to share in. Some of us like to cook, so we have a plethora of kitchen utensils for cooking.
The house is really bright and sunny with a beautiful main room for sh
neighborhood_overview:
If you are looking to explore Sydney, my place is virtually perfect: away from the hustle and bustle but so close it's ridiculous.

The area has some really good cafe's that are just 2 minutes walk from my door (e.g. Tapeo). And over 50 local restaurants deliver if you are having a lazy moment.

If you're more into bars, then Redfern is really cool right now. There are loads of brand new bars in the area and they are a great hang-out just a few minutes stroll from my door. The Bearded Tit is my favourite, you have to go there!
host_about:
This is my first AirBNB host. So if I forget to tell you something or do something silly, please let me know. I'm just a beginner.

I'm a 29 year old professional, working in environmental engineering in Sydney, right next to Central Station. 
I love food, music and travelling. This is why i'm on here! I'm travelling overseas and want to share my house while I'm away.
My favourite place is still Mexico, but I'm not scared of finding a place I love more. I'm still a backpacker at heart but have landed in a few big hotels once in a while.

I hope you love my place as much as I do. And I'd love to hear your feedback about your stay and if you have any tips for me, that would be awesome. Thank you.

name: Massive Warehouse Loft Apartment
description:
Earlier this year, Marrickville was voted the 10th coolest neighbourhood in the world by Time Out. And this would be the coolest pad in that neighbourhood. It's a big space on the first floor of an old warehouse. Downstairs is a working art studio - The Bakehouse Studio Marrickville run by Lisa Hoelzl. The guests who love our place the most are the ones who like the idea of staying in a warehouse flat on top of a studio and engaging with our odd extended household and neighbourhood.

The space
Although we Marrickville residents take with a grain of salt the whole 'world's 10th coolest neighbourhood' thing, a few years ago, Airbnb sent a New York photographer/artist/writer called Todd Selby around the world to stay in 5 Airbnb properties. He went to London, Paris, LA, Tokyo and....... Marrickville. Airbnb and Todd thought ours was the most interesting Airbnb property in Sydney.

A guest recently said our place was 'what Airbnb used to be like'. I know wh
neighborhood_overview: We are in an area of Sydney called the 'inner west'. Politically, it's a left leaning area with lots of immigrants - Greeks from the 1960s and Vietnamese from the 70s. That means the local food options are plentiful, cheap and interesting.  It also has lots of artists and is gay friendly. About 700 metres from our place is the train to the city - 15 minute ride. There is also a bus to the city just up the road.
host_about:
That's the only photograph I could find. Looks a bit corporate, doesn't it. I'll have to find one of the family or one of me doing something whacky.
Lisa and I live in the house next door to the building where the apartment is.
Over the years, we've had various people living with us at our rambling property. And now, thanks to Airbnb, we are sharing the place with the world. There are three buildings: the house, the studio/apartment building, the garage where one long term visitor is still living (11 years and counting). There are often interesting people hanging around our place and we'd be keen for you to be part of all that if it suits you.
I work in the city - office job. My wife is far more interesting. She's an artist and does great stuff in the downstairs studio (The Bakehouse Studio Marrickville) as well as teaching art and design at a university. (I might have to make up some stuff about myself.)

New to the market. Three rooms with a combined kitchen and living room with main bedroom ensuite in my newly renovated and completely refitted house, less than 10 minutes by bus from the center of Sydney.

This house has a fully fitted kitchen with electric stove, gas cooking and dishwasher plus all needed kitchen utensils, cutlery and glassware. There is never any problem with parking in my st.

This is a non smoking house however there is a small courtyard at the front for those who like to sneak one or two.

As my house is always kept clean and tidy I would appreciate it if my guests followed suit, and I
neighborhood_overview: Great neighbourhood adn only a short walk to the heart of Balmain or Rozelle which are thriving with cafes, bars, restaurants and retail.

I just recently renovated my whole house, pretty much a knock down job so new everything. I heard about air B&B and thought what a great idea. I have a clean house including a great kitchen so feel free to make yourself at home when you stay with me. Just let me know if there is anything in particular you may need. This is also the perfect room to shut yourself away in if that is what you'd prefer.

host_about:
Hi,
I'm a prop stylist from Sydney. I live with my husband Michael who is a musician and school teacher. We have a wonderul art deco apartment in the sweetest suburb on the inner west side of Sydney by the name of Summer Hill. We are renting our home for two months while house sitting nearby.  
 We like to host friends for dinner parties that don't go too late. We are respectful of our neighbours and their working hours and expect the same from our guests. We love all forms of visual art and we absolutely love music. When we travel, we like to travel light so we can spend most of our time exploring other places. We loved visiting the south of France and I fell in love with Berlin.  If you like being close to the city and not being woken up in the middle of the night then this is the place for you.

description:

Covid gave us a chance to renovate! New bedrooms with beautiful spotted gum hardwood floors and lots more...

name: Curl Curl Beach Living
description:
A tranquil beach side lagoon setting.

The space
The House

This Curl Curl beach house has been transformed into a modern open plan home ideal for entertaining. It features a modern kitchen, 2 bathrooms, living room and fully furnished outdoor bbq patio.

The Area

Curl Curl is a suburb of northern Sydney in the state of New South Wales, Australia 18 kilometers north-east of the Sydney central business district. The house is located located on a cul-de-sac just a 5 minute walk to the the beach. Curl Curl is known for some of the best surfing on the Northern Beaches. Walk across the reserve and you're off the beaten path making for a tranquil setting along the Curl Curl Lagoon.

You'll find pubs and restaurants within easy walking distance. There are also numerous pubs, restaurants and cafes along the famous Manly Corso, which is a short bus trip away.

Transport

Curl Curl is serviced by 4 bus routes 136

name: Gorgeous retreat. Close to Sydney Opera House.
description:
Explore Sydney from this gorgeous one bedroom apartment located in Sydney’s historic entertainment district.
Close to everything !! Walk or jump on a train (3 mins) to the city, Opera House, and harbour. Close to museums, night life, cafes, art galleries, shopping, markets, and all of Sydney’s great attractions. Local harbourside parks nearby and within easy striking distance of Bondi beach.
The apartment is cozy and comfortable with everything you need to make your stay an enjoyable one.

The space
Thoughtfully furnished with a gentle nod to the history of the area, this comfortable one bedroom apartment has everything you need to make your stay enjoyable.
Enjoy relaxing in the lounge after sightseeing with smart TV, free netflix and wifi.
Cook up a storm in our kitchen, stocked with condiments, spices, teas and coffees.
Comfortable Bedroom overlooking small garden courtyard. Clean bathroom with organic shampoo and conditioners.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is situated right in the heart of Potts Point. The area is home to cutting-edge theatre and comedy, hip bars and cafes, stylish restaurants, food markets and intriguing history.

Within walking distance of the City, Sydney Harbour and the Opera House (approx. 2 kms / 1.2 mi). It’s also very close to public transport. Only 5 to 7 minutes into the city on a train. Enjoy the best that Sydney has to offer all within easy reach - Bondi beach, the city, harbour, and much more.

The area was once known for its music halls and grand theatres, it was rapidly transformed after World War II by the influx of troops returning and visiting from the nearby Garden Island naval base. Today, it is a mixed locality offering both services (railway, gyms, supermarket, bakeries) to nearby residents and entertainment venues including bars, restaurants, and nightclubs to visitors.
host_about:
Hi there
My name is Kylie which, not many people know,  is actually an Australian aboriginal word for Boomerang. 
I bought this apartment decades ago because I loved the area and wanted to close to the city and my work. It’s such a melting pot of interesting culture and entertainment, but also a real community. 
For over a decade I worked at the Art Gallery of NSW which is a short walk from the apartment. I’d walk into work every day and most days do a quick walk at lunch time around the Botanical Gardens to take in the view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. 
I moved out when we had our baby and wanted to be closer to family. We love doing Airbnb as we love hosting and it keeps us connected to the area.
neighbourhood: Potts Point, New South Wales, Australia

name: Sale Modern room -Waterloo near CBD
description:
The room is furnished with built-in wardrobe, AC/heater, bedside desk & a small bookcase. Bathroom will be shared with the other 2 other tenants.

The space
Hello, I'm looking for guest/s to occupy a medium-size bedroom in our unit which is located in Meriton apartments complex, Waterloo. The area is a favourite spot to live among professionals, as it's not far from the city, frequent buses, safe, many shops & eateries within the area. There's a dual cooling/heater system in the room, which is essential for the upcoming hot day. There's no TV in the room but you can use the TV in the living with the guest who live in the living room. Other 2 rooms have their own TV inside.

There's also Coles & Aldi (5 minutes walk from my unit) within the complex, and 12-15 minutes walk to Redfern/ Green Square train station. I have a indoor kitten who is very curious & loves to play all the time. Also still in toilet training in the bathroom, therefore discounted rent
neighborhood_overview: Waterloo is very popular suburb among professionals. A lot of trendy cafes & restaurants surroundings. There's Coles & Aldi in the complex.
host_about: Friendly & mature Sydney Accountant, been living in Australia for 25 years I've been living with many people from different nationalities which I really enjoy! For me, family is the most important part of my life & since 2016 I have returned to Bali, Indonesia & now I'm based in Sydney. I'm really into fashion, music, surfing & movies, and in my spare time I usually spend time with my friends; go out to have meals, go to movies, & shopping.

name: Sea Breeze
description:
The space
New Amazing Beach Apartment:
Just up the road from Queenscliff and the world famous Manly Beach, enjoy sweeping Lagoon Views that you can see throughout the flat. You can BBQ or just relax on your own balcony and take in the view. Fully equipped, enjoy the ease of a new kitchen to cook up a storm. The flat has all the comforts of home.

Location:
Cycle or stroll along the beach to Manly or take the bus that stops right outside the house. You can be in the heart of Manly in only 5 minutes, with all the restaurants and shops there. Or carry on to the Manly Ferry, and catch the beautiful Manly ferry into central Sydney,

Regular buses also depart into the city.

Wifi is included in the price.

Matt and Amy look forward to welcoming you and will help to ensure your stay is relaxing and fun.

Guest access
Guests have their own laundry and BBQ facilities, as well as their own bikes for transportati
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is fantastic because it is right beside the beach.  It has a lovely beach feel and a very laid back atmostphere.
host_about: We live just a little way from Manly beach and I love living here.  I try to speed walk or run the soft sand at least 3 or 4 times a week because it is so close and I am trying to lose weight.  I couldn't survive without my family, music, a bit of wine and lots of friends.  The best part of visiting here is not knowing what lovely surprises you have right around the corner and not knowing what you will do each day.  That is just life on the beaches here.. beautiful blue sea and lovely golden sand. Come and see for yourself.
