name: High Quality, Professionally Managed Apt in Galata
description:
One of the four modern apartments in a fully restored 19th century building.

The entire building is managed and cleaned professionally.

Located near Galata Tower, close to Istiklal St. and Galata Bridge, within a few minutes walking to Karakoy Tram.

**There is a floor plan of the apartment in the photo stream. We kindly ask our guests to review the plan before booking.**

***Please note that the terrace area is separate and a common space of the building***

The space
COVID-19 MEASURES TAKEN BY OUR MANAGEMENT:

*Our staff has been trained for Covid-19 measures.
* After each checkout the rooms are disinfected with a UV Air Sterilization fogger machine.
* All dishes and utensils are washed pre check in.
* All linens and towels are professionally washed and ironed.
* Terrace and all other common areas are additionally disinfected with the UV Air Sterilization fogger machine as well as with ble
host_about:
I am Turkish, born and raised in Istanbul. I studied in England for high school. I moved to the United States to attend university in Washington, DC. After I graduated, I moved to New York to start working. I also finished my masters degree while living in New York. After working in the financial sector in New York for many years, I moved back to Istanbul. I live here now with my husband who is an American and two kids. We love living in Istanbul as it is beautiful, fun and culturally very rich. 

After moving back, I started working with my family on a residential renovation project. We renovated a registered historical building and turned it into four rental units and an art gallery. The renovation works were implemented through an understanding of responsibility towards history, culture and environment by preserving the building's authentic structure and elements. The building was awarded a LEED silver certificate by the US Green Building Council for its environmentally responsible features. 

My family and I love traveling. We'd like to stay in serviced and furnished flats when we travel because we find them more relaxing and more homey; we like cooking our own breakfast in the morning, for example. Plus we believe that you can feel a city better this way. This is why we wanted to bring the same concept to Istanbul. 

We believe that our apartments bring the best of two worlds together. They are professionally managed by our wonderful manager and cleaning staff, but we also have that personal touch so that you truly feel that you have a "home away from home" with real hosts who look forward to getting to know you and help you enjoy your stay in every way. 

I am sorry if sometimes I am unable to meet you in person because I have a baby at home and a full-time job so I am not always at the premises. But please know that I am reachable anytime and our building manager is more than happy to help you and welcome you.

This room also has a wonderful view and a huge terrace in a double storey flat in the heart of Kadıköy.

Situated on the Anatolian (Asian) side of Istanbul Kadıköy is the biggest district on this side, very close to everything; cinemas, restaurants, bars, churches, mosques, High Streets and local food markets. And my flat is just in the middle of a High Street on 6th floor. When you go upstairs (yes, there is an elevator) you are completely detached from the crowd downstairs and it is such a relief!

After working in the financial sector in New York for many years, I moved back to Istanbul. I live here now with my husband who is an American and two kids. We love living in Istanbul as it is beautiful, fun and culturally very rich. 

After moving back, I started working with my family on a residential renovation project. We renovated a registered historical building and turned it into four rental units and an art gallery. The renovation works were implemented through an understanding of responsibility towards history, culture and environment by preserving the building's authentic structure and elements. The building was awarded a LEED silver certificate by the US Green Building Council for its environmentally responsible features. 

My family and I love traveling. We'd like to stay in serviced and furnished flats when we travel because we find them more relaxing and more homey; we like cooking our own breakfast in the morning, for example. Plus we believe that you can feel a city better this way. This is why we wanted to bring the same concept to Istanbul. 

We believe that our apartments bring the best of two worlds together. They are professionally managed by our wonderful manager and cleaning staff, but we also have that personal touch so that you truly feel that you have a "home away from home" with real hosts who look forward to getting to know you and help you enjoy your stay in every way. 

I am sorry if sometimes I am unable to meet you in person because I have a baby at home and a full-time job so I am not always at the premises. But please know that I am reachable anytime and our building manager is more than happy to help you and welcome you.

name: Central & peaceful home @ Bostanci
description:
Our flat is very peaceful and central with easy access anywhere! Once you enter the flat you will love it. Well that's the feeling I have even after so many years living hear. It has a nice set-up and everything you may need to live here for a couple of month. It is a nice typical traditional MAHALLE (neighborhood), where you know and greet the BAKKAL (tiny shop) or the KASAP (butcher) etc.
A place that gives you privacy, but still open its arms to welcome you.

The space
There are two bedrooms in the flat and a large living room + dinning area, a lovely kitchen and cute bathroom.
A small open balcony facing the front of the building and a closed area prepared as wash room.

The master bedroom has a double bed and a working space with a nice desk.

The other room has a pull out sofa which can accommodate additional guests, further a large closet and shelves.

In my apartment max 2 guests can sleep easyly, but it is not ch
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is only a 15 minutes walk to the seaside and Bagdad Street.
Seaside jogging district (Sahil Yolu) is about 17 km long with cafes and restaurants already available starting from Bostanci.
Minibus road is only 7 minutes walking distance.
From Bostanci you have easily access to ferries leaving to the Princess Islands (ferry station 15min walk). By minibus/bus/car it will take you about 30 min. to the main district Kadıköy where you can have boats to the European side. The boat takes only 20 minutes, just enough time for you to enjoy the fresh sea air.
For a shopping day it is only a 15 minutes walk to the very famous Bagdat Street which is full of shops, restaurants and cafes.
host_about: I was born in Germany, but I am a native Turkish, speaking excellent German &English, who is very interested in meeting people from other cultures. As a professional in business live, I am flexible and happy to assist guests to get to know Istanbul. So far I hosted many  foreign guests and would love to welcome them now in mu home. Since I am traveling a lot most of the time my flat is empty, but if someone some how, needs to stay on certain days while I'm around i would be open for this as well. Please do not hesitate to contact me for any questions. I hope to welcome you soon!

host_about:
I love Istanbul and love helping people discover this amazing city.

Here're 2 main benefits for choosing our apartment: 

1) you will be staying right in the heart of Istanbul, steps from the 14th century Galata tower with BEST restaurants, cafes, bars and boutiques all within your reach. All major historic sights are within half an hour of walk or a short ride by tram or metro.

2)  After a long day sightseeing, you'll be able to relax in luxury stylish settings of the architect- designed apartment, while enjoying  the views over Bosphorus, Golden Horn and historic Galata tower.

Because I am a frequent traveler myself, I know how important it is to stay somewhere stylish, clean and feel welcome.

Book our place now and let us help you discover the best of  Istanbul:  when you arrive, you will receive a practical GUIDE with our recommendations for greatest restaurants, bars and cafes.

name: Sultanahmet-Istanbul, Adalar Suite
description:
The space
Welcome to Adalar Penthouse Suite in Istanbul, located in a charming 19th century Ottoman house recently renovated in 2011 and designed for our guests into studio apartments with modern facilities, nestled in the heart of the old city. The exterior has been restored to its original grandeur and the interior has been completely gutted and renovated.

This magnificent penthouse suite is located on the top (fourth) floor, and was designed with its own unique character. Traditional curtain and wood finishings are tastefully used throughout and exude the quality expected from a high-end international city accommodation. The decor is rich, simple and luxurious, with all facilities and appliances of superior quality. Large windows offer panoramic views of the Istanbul skyline, Marmara Sea and Princess Islands. The suite comes with a king size bed, private kitchen fully equipped with high-end modern appliances, corner dining area and large bathroom.

I
host_about: Have been in Tourism since 1998, worked in small hotels in Sultanahmet, studied Tourism in Kemer-Antalya, worked in several 5* hotels after. Joined my first Cruise ship in 2001, worked in different big companies, worked in hotel department in different positios, did five world cruises, had the opportunity to visit over 80 countries. Settled back to Istanbul in 2008, have been doing apartment rentals since 2010 professionally, added my travel agency into the work and now able to host my guests not only with apartments, also with airport transfers, tours in Istanbul and all over Turkey. I would describe myself as a host who is eager to make his guests as comfortable as possible with anything i can.

description:
The space
This unique concept allows guests to luxuriate in the space and privacy of their own beautifully renovated private house, whilst enjoying hotel-style services.

Our property is located in the vicinity of the former stables of the Topkapi Palace. Apart from the rare luxury of having so much private space, Stablesgate’s special location provides a real flavour of Istanbul life and many hours can be spent in exploration of the labyrinthine streets, taking in the fascinating mix of colours, smells and sounds.

The property is the result of several years’ careful renovation. The concept is very much one of an extremely luxurious and spacious hotel suite - rather than a self-catered villa or apartment. The house is cleaned every day and guests are invited to enjoy breakfast each morning on the roof terrace of the nearby Hotel, with its fabulous views across the Sea of Marmara and up to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia.

A one-minute stroll

host_about:
Hi there, 
I am a Istanbul lover. Wherever i go i come back to istanbul missing it even more.  I have worked and travelled as a journalist into many countries. i like exploring new cultures and get involved with locals. Seeing so many places made me appreciate different cultures and people. I have lived over the last 10 years in istanbul and am happy to share my own great istanbul to do list. I love caffe and good food. So you will be getting a lot of tips about great eating options. 
I am an easygoing and uncomplicated host. I respect every bodies space. love to chat. I am little slow in the mornings and it takes me time and few cups of caffe to socialise

Love thinking,discovering and enjoying good food, good music good people....

name: Lovely, bright, historical: Galata
description:
The flat is in Galata, very close to Tunel square, next to Şişhane metro station, 10 min. to Karaköy ferries, buses and tram. A room equipped with wi-fi, double bed, an i-mac, a place for studying, editing, exploring the city.

The space
Our flat is more than 100 years old and has it's own character. It's well preserved typical "Beyoğlu" building. It's good for guests who are not in to tip top hotel rooms.

Guest access
Our guests are able to access to whole house but our bedroom.

Other things to note
We have a cat named Lyudmila. She is curious about our guests can give a visit when you are in your bed. We also have a little bird in a cage, he sings early in the morning.
neighborhood_overview: Galata is a very central and active neighbourhood, lots of nice cafés, bars and restaurants, art galleries, museums and shopping boutiques around. There are also musical instrument shops close by.
host_about: I am based in İstanbul. I am quite helpful to my guests as they explore the city. I work in the cinema & photography area. I like traveling around and sometimes I am not around, especially in summer.

The space
My apartment is in a very central location of Istanbul and right near the famous Galata tower. It is in a 100 yrs old historical stone building with a great terrace which will be shared though.

name: Rooftop terrace, tower& water views
description:
This flat is located directly in front of the Galata Tower, which is right at the center of it all. You’ll have an unobstructed view of the tower from not just one, but multiple rooms.

The space
This flat is located directly in front of the Galata Tower, which is right at the center of it all. You’ll have an unobstructed view of the tower from not just one, but multiple rooms. You’ll see it from the living room, which is furnished with various designer chairs and a large sofa. You’ll also have a view from one of the three bedrooms. (You might want to claim that room right now.). As for the other two bedrooms, one is furnished with a king size bed and the other has two bunk beds. Of the two bathrooms, one features a large marble shower/bathtub and the other, a shower stall. The kitchen combines high-end stainless steel appliances with wooden floors and cabinets for a modern, yet warm feel. It’s the ideal apartment and the ideal location from which to enjoy all Ist
neighborhood_overview: In Istanbul, apartments don’t get any more ideally located than this. Walk 100 m North and you’ll be at the southern end of the Istiklal Avenue- the mile-long, popular entertainment and shopping area. A walk along Istiklal will bring you to Taxim Square.  Continue walking 100 m in the opposite direction and you’ll find yourself at the Golden Horn and Galata Bridge, where you can catch the tram to the historic district of Sultanahmet. There you’ll find the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi.
host_about:
We’re a group of lifelong friends and avid travelers. We’ve been all around the world. Some of us, even twice. Combine that with our diverse professional backgrounds in engineering, architecture, finance and marketing, and we have everything it takes to ensure your stay is a great one. 
We enjoy meeting new people, from all around the world and all walks of life.

description:

The space
Located on the first floor of a historic building, this one bedroom has been lovingly renovated to include everything a world traveler could wish for. name: Light, peaceful & high ceilings
description:
Azure La: This fully renovated 1 bedroom flat is located in a historic building, on a peaceful street, just steps from the center of all the action.

The space
This fully renovated 1 bedroom flat is located in a historic building, on a peaceful street, just steps from the center of all the action. Three large windows flood the living area with light and the over-sized sectional sofa beckons for you to kick back and relax. And if you need to work, there’s a small desk and comfortable chair from which to do so. The bathroom’s large glass shower and white marble décor will have you feeling like you’ve just stepped into a spa. As for sleep, that should come easy thanks to the extremely comfortable, king size mattress that’s fit for …well, a king.
neighborhood_overview: This flat is located on a quiet street in Cihangir- one of Istanbul’s trendiest neighborhoods. Cozy cafes, amazing restaurants, local shops and trendy bars are everywhere you look in this neighborhood, which could explain why so many intellectuals, expats and artists choose to call it home. The metro and tram are both less than a 10 minute walk away, making it easy to get to the old town and anywhere else you might want to go. With so much to offer, it’s easy to see why the UK Guardian named Cihangir one of the top five places in the world to live.
host_about:
We’re a group of lifelong friends and avid travelers. We’ve been all around the world. Some of us, even twice. Combine that with our diverse professional backgrounds in engineering, architecture, finance and marketing, and we have everything it takes to ensure your stay is a great one. 
We enjoy meeting new people, from all around the world and all walks of life.

This bright, comfortable one bedroom is the perfect example of “the best of both worlds”. There's a 5 min walk to the bus stop on the sea side. And the bus trip to the city center is a nice route along the bosphorus (the channel). It takes like 40 minutes to the central squares. The same distance by taxi would cost you like 8,5€ ..

neighborhood_overview:
About Istanbul & our neighborhood Galata :
Istanbul is a city where not only continents meet, but many traces from different cultures and old civilizations can be found and history is preserved . A synagogue, a church, a mosque all can be found in the same quarter.

A part of Istanbul over Europe another part being in Asia where you can find unique beauty, interesting nature and straits of Bosphorus for sightseeing.

Galata area being around Galata Tower is the most popular and cosmopolitan neighborhood of Istanbul. Actually it is the old and now popular retro downtown offering a wide variety of choices for shopping, design ateliers, entertainment, art galleries and dining, cafes, restaurants, pubs, bars...
A magnificient panaromic view from the Galata Tower towards the Old City, Golden Horn & the Bosphorus is a rare find view to see with bare eyes.

Imperial buildings, aqueducts, churches with preserved fresques and mozaics like St. Sophia, Ch
host_about:
I enjoy travelling in and outside of Turkey, and I prefer  exploring the cities. (Still exploring Istanbul!) Although I am an amateur, I am  enthusiastic about photography; children and architecture being my main subjects. 
I like good food, good coffee and good music, and I know how to find them. 

Together with my brother Izel, we have been hosting vacation rentals since 2012 and delighted having built up our global community. Travelers do come in as our guests and return their homes being our friends for life knowing they have a house in Istanbul :) 

Professionally, I am an architect specialized in conservation and restoration of old sites.

Looking forward to meeting with new people, I am open to developing new friendships and connections throughout the world.

name: Deluxe 2 Br Apt Close 2 Blue Mosque
description:
Welcome to our 2 Bedrooms apartment in Sultanahmet - Istanbul, a charming modern house recently renovated in 2013 and designed for our guests into apartments with modern facilities including 2 bathrooms, nestled in the heart of the old city.

The space
The apartment is very spacious and currently accommodates 2 king size beds in bedrooms (can be twin beds) and 2 sofa beds in the living room for a family or friends of seven to eight. Rarely found in Sultanahmet area, features 2 fully equipped bathrooms. The living room also comes with fully equipped kitchen, fridge, table and chairs. Has two flat screen LCD HDTVs with satellite, and FREE WiFi access. Our second floor Deluxe apartment provides additional space and offer a 'home-from-home' experience (75 squaremeters).

Guest access
While retaining its period features, our apartments offer uncluttered modern luxury for everyone from the single business/leisure visitor to couples, families and ex
neighborhood_overview: Our central location is within walking distance of Istanbul's most popular historical, cultural and tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome Square, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Egyptian (Spice) Bazaar, the Golden Horn and many others. Just a few minutes' walk from the apartment’s door are the tram and train stations, offering rapid and easy transportation to all parts of Istanbul.
host_about: Have been in Tourism since 1998, worked in small hotels in Sultanahmet, studied Tourism in Kemer-Antalya, worked in several 5* hotels after. Joined my first Cruise ship in 2001, worked in different big companies, worked in hotel department in different positios, did five world cruises, had the opportunity to visit over 80 countries. Settled back to Istanbul in 2008, have been doing apartment rentals since 2010 professionally, added my travel agency into the work and now able to host my guests not only with apartments, also with airport transfers, tours in Istanbul and all over Turkey. I would describe myself as a host who is eager to make his guests as comfortable as possible with anything i can.

The space
The house is in the one of the most elegant neighborhoods of Istanbul, Nisantasi Topagacı. Location is near to the old city, and Nisantasi is also an historic quartier with beautiful old buildings...

The location is great for nightlife and shopping. Some of the city's best cafes and restaurants, bars, art galleries and stores and designer shops are within walking distance. A short stroll from the main convention and exhibition centers. Near to many historical sites and the Bosphorus.

It has also very convenient access to Metro and to other public transport; 10 minutes from the Osmanbey metro station and 10 minutes from the Bosphorus ferry port at Besiktas.

Quite place with 2 bedrooms and a nice garden...
The large bedroom has a double bed, the guest bedroom has a single bed both with a large wardrobes. After a long day of site seeing you can relax and rest in a cool breeze in the back garden.

The space
This unique concept allows guests to luxuriate in the space and privacy of their own beautifully renovated private house, whilst enjoying hotel-style services.

Our property is located in the vicinity of the former stables of the Topkapi Palace. Apart from the rare luxury of having so much private space, Stablesgate’s special location provides a real flavour of Istanbul life and many hours can be spent in exploration of the labyrinthine streets, taking in the fascinating mix of colours, smells and sounds.

The property is the result of several years’ careful renovation. The concept is very much one of an extremely luxurious and spacious hotel suite - rather than a self-catered villa or apartment. The house is cleaned every day and guests are invited to enjoy breakfast each morning on the roof terrace of the nearby Hotel, with its fabulous views across the Sea of Marmara and up to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia.

neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood: Beyoğlu
In a few words: The true heart of Istanbul
Closest transport link: Metro, bus, dolmus etc.
Move here to be near: Istanbul Technical University, Bilgi University, Taksim square, the Gezi Park, boarding schools, embassies etc.
Suitable for: Professionals, students, families..

Overview Beyoğlu, also known as Pera, is one of the oldest and most charming parts of the city. Consisting of several smaller districts, Beyoğlu was once a base for European merchants and became an important symbol of Istanbul. Although remaining an old city by heart, Beyoğlu features many trendy areas such as Cihangir, Tophane and Tarlabaşı, while Taksim is known to be the symbol of the city.

name: Artist's Studio, Central & Near Taksim
description:
Designed by a tasteful architect and located one metro station away from Taksim Square and 5 minutes walking away from Nisantasi, our studio flat offers you all you need on a Istanbul getaway. Especially great for couples and the building has an elevator.

The space
Our studio is a unique property in every sense as can be seen on pictures. It has great lighting, two large glass tables both for dining and working. Many closets and drawers are very useful to put away your stuff.
It has a very comfortable double bed that can be used as a couch during the day. There is another couch where you can rest after a long walk and before getting ready for the evening.

We have a small and cute kitchen hidden behind a closet. You only see it when you need to use it. There is a small fridge which will be more than enough for your trip.

Our bathroom has a door like one you can find on a ship. Quite interesting I must say. Bathroom itself is a functiona
neighborhood_overview:
It is perfectly located in Harbiye, which is one metro station and 15 minutes walking distance away from Taksim Square. In Harbiye, you will find anything you need within walking distances.
Upscale neighborhood of Nisantasi; which is famous for its street life, cafe's, high-end brands and entertainment is five minutes by foot.
Beyoglu Region, Taksim or Istiklal Street (Well, whichever you call, we refer to the same area in Istanbul. Keep that in mind) is the main entertainment district of city center.
There are endless options in Beyoglu for arts, eating, drinking, live music, bars, clubs and you name it... You can live in Istanbul for 5 years, and possibly eat and drink at a different place everyday.
host_about:
Hi Guys... I am Efe!
I grew up in Marmaris, lived most of my life in Istanbul except for 4 years in the States and a year of Round The World Trip. I love travelling myself, and have been to 22 countries during my travels.
I am a movie freak and love photography.
Spare time is for enjoying Istanbul with friends...

The space
My flat consists in total of two bedrooms, one quite large living room, a bathroom, a kitchen and a beautiful terrace.

It is situated right in the city center of Beyoglu, which is as you have probably already read about in many many travel guides, the heart and soul of Istanbul. Beyoglu is a district located on the European side of Istanbul, and is therefore separated from the old city (the so called historic peninsula of Constantinople) by the Golden Horn.

The surrounding neighborhood of Beyoglu is mostly characterized by its diversity regarding music, art, fashion, interior design, architecture, and culture. Due to this immense variety of options, staying in Beyoglu will never become boring and you will leave Istanbul will amazing memories and valuable experiences.

And finally with my flat's proximity to the main entertainment locations and all different public transportation means, your trip will just be easier to organiz
neighborhood_overview: Flat is located in the famous Asmalı Mescit district of Beyoglu and Only a few footsteps away from the vibrant 'Istiklal street' and the neighboring areas Galata, Karaköy and Taksim , you are surrounded with cultural pursuits, restaurants, entertainment and shopping.
host_about:
My philosophy of life is simple and to the point: confidence and faith. 
In Turkish you would say 'güven'.

name: Very central place-small room for 1
description:
My flat is very centrally located (in Sisli) and accessable from anywhere in town. One very small room with a single bed and wardrobe is ideal for a student.

The space
About Sisli, the neighbourhood:

- Located on the European side of the city, central Sisli (where I live) is full of residences in the back alleys, and shops and eateries on the main streets Abide-I Hürriyet and Halaskargazi.

- I was working as a journalist for Food and Travel and TimeOut Istanbul magazines before, therefore I can easily recommend you best spots in the city written or verbally.

- 5 minutes of walking distance to the Metro station (Sisli on Line M2). By making connections at metro; you can go to Hagia Sofia, Sultanahmet area approximately in 25mins.

- 10-15 mins of bus ride to the Taksim Square. By metro, it takes about 10mins.

About your room and the apartment in general:

- 1 small bedroom with a single bed that ove

host_about:
For people who meet me for the first time, I usually look cold and cocky. Actually I consider myself quite fun and caring most of the time but you have to get to know me a little until you see these features:)
I also think that I respect other people's personal space and need of privacy, which are the basic elements in personal relationships.
I have travelled to a few countries so far and my favorite destination was Hamburg. It's such a dynamic and alive city. I could actually live there:)

name: Great place in Buyukada, Istanbul!
description:
Great place for the ones who want to be close and also a bit away from the city's chaotic atmosphere. It is an historic building close to the ferry pier where you can relax and have a great time.

The space
Buyukada is the biggest of the Princess Islands. Very easy access, 50 minutes away by ferry from the city center-Kabatas. (or 30min from the Asian side-Bostanci) Great place for the ones who want to be close and also a bit away from the city's chaotic atmosphere, or the ones who want to spend the last or first 2-3 days of their stay a bit more silently. (No cars on the island by the way!) The flat is the 2nd and the attic floors of a very well taken care of white wooden house, built by an Italian architect. About 10 minutes walking distance from the ferry pier. It has a separate entrance and a small garden for common use. 2 quite big bedrooms with double beds and a small room with a single bed. (all with bathrooms) There is also accommodation availability in
neighborhood_overview: It's quite lively in the summer time. Some of the best restaurants and entertainment venues are just around the corner. Most of the houses around are historical buildings, coated with white painted wood. It's a very green area like most of the island. You can take walks, go to the beach or to the forest.
host_about: I'm an architect and PhD student working in Istanbul.

name: Elegance and high quality with breezy sea views
description:
Truly beautiful apartment on the 3rd floor of an elegant 19th Century building near Galata Tower. Stylish, spacious, bright and airy with stunning views across the Bosphorus and Golden Horn. Furnished with a balance of antiques and contemporary pieces, it's 'quality' and guests tell us they don't want to leave. On the most sophisticated street in this bohemian area.

We also offer a selection of experiences with our local guides, to help build your genuine and memorable perspective on the city.

The space
This is one of Istanbul Place Apartments' sensitive restoration projects. It's on the third floor - three flights of original marble stairs - of a grand and elegant 19th century building near the beautiful Galata Tower. The street is sophisticated, with smart cafes, top Turkish fashion design boutiques and a cool bohemian feel.

The apartment is only 1 minute walk from Sishane metro station, 3 minutes walk to Tünel funicular and a short down
neighborhood_overview: Galata has a genuine, very welcoming and diverse community with an intriguing mix of cafes, restaurants, small grocery shops and artistic boutiques. Elegant 19th Century buildings line cobbled streets, with discoveries waiting around every corner. No matter where you wander, you’ll always find your way back to Galata Tower, which has been a well-loved landmark for the last 700 years.
host_about:
Our historic apartments make comfortable, secure, private short term homes and we understand and respect the issues of social distancing.

Julia, Tarkan and manager Taskin are certified by the UK Institute of Hospitality for 'Coronavirus: Taking Proactive Action'. High-touch areas are disinfected with alcohol spray and apartments are cleaned more thoroughly than ever, though we had a great reputation for our cleanliness before too!

*****

We've been busy, building up a collection of lovely historical apartments in Galata, our favourite part of Istanbul. We've personally renovated most of them and stay in them ourselves whenever we can. Recently we've added a sweet flat in the UK's Cotswolds into the mix.

20 years ago we met in Istanbul, Tarkan's home city, while I was there for a photography assignment. Since then we've led international lives together, based in Istanbul, Singapore and now England, my original country. 

Along the way we've raised our son, Eren, across the cultures as we've steadily grown this holiday apartment project, our second baby. We see it as a way to find balance in our family life and to always have a home in our best-loved city.  

We understand from our own experiences, what makes a great city-break stay and we try our very hardest to deliver it to you in Istanbul. For this we've won i-escape's global Guest Award for 'Best City Apartment' two years running and Tripadvisor's Certificate of Excellence 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020 (2021 isn’t announced yet ;) 

We’re also listed in many guidebooks. 

Your questions and booking will be handled by us. On your arrival our manager Taskin and  friendly team with their natural Turkish hospitality, will welcome you to your apartment, pass over your keys and explain practicalities and the neighborhood. You'll have as much or as little help as you choose and we're sure you'll soon feel at home in the cosmopolitan and very welcoming local community.

"Life is a balance of holding on and letting go" said Rumi.
We agree, do you?!

name: Stylish gem with amazing charm and nightlife buzz!
description:
This is a truly unique apartment. It has many grand features from the 19th century, well-balanced with contemporary style and an astonishing original gilded ceiling. If you'll enjoy being in the midst of vibrant night-life yet close to daytime cultural highlights it's a great choice. Shared roof terrace access.

The space
This is one of Istanbul Place Apartments' sensitive restoration projects. It's on the on the first floor - one flight of stairs - of a 19th century building overlooking a busy little street with a baker shop, bars, cafes, restaurants and night clubs. The famous Istiklal Avenue is 1 minute walk away and Taksim Metro is a 10 minute walk. The picturesque vintage tram stops very near the top of the street.

This apartment is great if you wish to have a memorable, authentic experience of Istanbul based in the very centre of everything and with a lively and unique party atmosphere at the doorstep.

The surrounding streets are noisy
neighborhood_overview:
Istiklal Avenue is the elegant pedestrian street at the core of Beyoglu. It's 1.4 kilometers long and thronged with people for much of the day. It's lined with boutiques, music shops, bookstores, art galleries, cinemas, theatres, libraries, cafés, pubs, night clubs, historical patisseries, chocolateries and restaurants.

This apartment is 1 minute walk down a side-street from Istiklal. It's very near Nevizade Sokak, which is famous worldwide for its meyhane restaurants and lively street scene at night. There are late night food vendors and nightclubs very nearby.

name: Bright clean near Istiklal Street ! (5)
description:
This is bright 1-room apartment, located in Taksim, in a very quiet area next to the Taksim Square and Istiklal Street.
Apartment is on the 1st floor of a building without elevator.
Blanket, towels, shampoo, soap, fridge, electric kettle etc.

The space
- Modern, large and comfortable apartment.
- Quiet Street
- Near to Metro Station and Bus Station
- Close to all amenities including restaurants, coffee shops, Banks etc..

Guest access
*24/7 check-in
*Nice apartment with own bathroom
*High-speed Wifi
*Daily cleaning
*Kitchen, fridge & cupboard space
*Like hotel room, but smarter
*Ideal for 2 people
*The apartment consists of one room

Check-in / check-out process
- Check-in: automated 24/7 and early check-in for luggage possible, apartment available after 2pm
- Check-out: before 12.00am
host_about:
Hello everyone! 
I was born in Istanbul and grew up in this huge city. I love it here, I hope you will love Istanbul and my places too! I studied International Relations, soon will be wandering in Latin America! I love travelling, football, and skiing.  It is important for me that you enjoy your stay here, that is why me and my team do our best.

Hope to meet you guys!

I am a woman working in a Tourism office in Istanbul, I speak English very well as I have been livin in Great Britain for several years. I am open to meet new contacts and happy to welcome people from all over the world.
Room is long term, females

The space
The apartment is located in Harbiye, a very nice and quiet business and hotel area, 10 min walking distance to Taksim square, which is the heart of the city. It is an 85 qm apartment, the room for rent is 20 qm big. It is fully furnished, the whole apartment is in a very good and renewed state. All costs are included (Internet, Water, heat) There is a new washing machine, dishwasher, 2 big sofas, a wooden table and televison in the big living room. You share the apartment with a woman who is working all day and only at home during the night. It is a very welcoming and cosy atmosphere, an oasis of relaxation and comfort in a vibrant and high speed city.
You can reach everything very easily: Only 10

name: Charming Apartment in Golden Horn
description:
The space
The apartment is 55 m2 it is a nostalgic apartment.

The apartment is furnished and can accomodate 4 people. The kitchen is equipped if you want to cook at home. There is wireless internet connection and a cable tv. There is also air conditioning at the apartment.

The area is in old Istanbul where the Byzantine was. You can find groceries around for basic needs. You are actually very close to historical part of Istanbul where the Ottoman and Byzantine architecture is. You can Travel around by walking or take the public bus to go Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque), Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia. If you like more of a night life, you can go to Taksim in about 10 minutes by bus. Taksim istiklal street is great full of activities, cafes, bars and restaurants. You can also go to Kumkapi for a more turkish traditional night life.



It is not available daily rental. Extra guest costs 30TL. At weekend it costs 150TL.
host_about: I have an experience of 20 years in the Hospitality Industry. I work with my partner and do hospitality professionally. I would like to be your host for your coming stay in Istanbul. I and my partner can speak turkish, english, german, dutch and a little spanish.

name: Wanted:nice company :) Moda-Kadikoy
description:
The space
Hello,

I live alone in a flat with 2 rooms and a living room. My apartment is located on the Asian side of Istanbul, precisely in the district of Moda / Kadikoy. From my neighborhood it is only 10 minutes to the sea side, public transportation (24 hours from almost every location) and all kinds of shops.

The flat is on the third floor, sunny, fully furnished and comfortable. There are oven, washing machies and wireless internet available.Right now, there are one bed, one commode, one writing table, one chair and a gardrop in the room.
I don't smoke. But you can smoke ☺

If you are interested please send me an email for anything you want to ask and more photos of the flat etc.

Have a nice stay in Istanbul,
Betul

name: Very Central Room With Sea View
description:
A Great Room in Cihangir/Beyoğlu. 5 min walk to Taksim Square, Istiklal Street...

The space
Our house is in Cihangir, Beyoglu with its stylish decoration and awesome sea view. It has 3 bedrooms and we offer one of them for guests. We are a friendly couple, that's why, our rooms are rarely empty. Friends are always there to fill them up.

The bedroom we offer and the livingroom have sea view. It is pretty inspiring if you like Istanbul... From the bedroom, you can see the historical peninsula (The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc.) with a beautiful Golden Horn view... From the living room, you can see the Princes' Islands and Marmara Sea...

Let me explain you our place...

LOCATIONWISE:

We live in Cihangir area. Cihangir is the heart of Beyoğlu. It is 5 min walk to Taksim and famous Istıklal Street. Taksim and Istiklal Street are the center of shopping, cafes, bars and night clubs...

It is 10 min wal
host_about:
Little bit about us... I and my boyfriend are sharing this flat. My name is Pinar (Pi) I am Turkish (26). My boyfriend is Kourosh. He is Iranian (37) and our common language is English. 

I am working in a TV station and involved in the movie sector, basicly in dramas and scripts... So everyone and everything new around me are simply inspiring (you know, for scripts...) Kourosh is a super fun, lovely man who has been working as a business development manager in an international company. We both like to have fun, meet people and we have an international group of friends... We would like to have some more...

name: 5 min to Taksim - central & clean
description:
The space
Hi there,

We have 5 studio apartments five minutes walk away from Taksim Square Istanbul. This is our standard 25 square meters studio wth double bed.

Facilities at the apartment complex include a lift, free Wi-Fi and a dry cleaning service. It also offers a currency exchange, luggage storage and a car rental desk. Travel arrangements can be made at the apartment complex's tour desk.

All apartments are air conditioned and include a TV, a balcony and cable / satellite channels. They come with tea and coffee making facilities, a full kitchen and a DVD player.

With a relaxing setting, our on-site bar offers a range of premium drinks. Guests can also try one of the many bars and restaurants nearby.

Istanbul's attractions, such as Istiklal Avenue and Old City (Sultanahmet), are within an easy distance of the apartment. The apartment complex is located less than a 20-minute walk from Istanbul Congress Cent

name: Apartment flat entrance - Beyoglu
description:
The space
This private apartment is very centrally located in Beyoglu/ Istanbul. The historic Galata Tower is only a short walking distance away. Despite beeing very close to the city center, the street is pretty quiet. In this authentic street you can widness the unique lifestyle of local people.. It takes you a short walk to get to the very popular Istiklal street, the Tunnel (a short underground railway line in Istanbul) as well as to Asmali Mescid, a street very popular for its night life and Taksim Square (the city center of the European side). In other words the flat is located in alternative / artistic area off the beaten tourist track :)))

The flat is comfortable and spacious as well as suitable for handicapped people with a wheel chair. It is located on the ground floor of a four-storey house. The flat can accommodate two people and a child. Air conditioner, washing machine and DSL internet wi-fi are available.

For further information please

name: Studio Apartment in Beyoglu/TAKSIM
description:
This is an entire floor in an Ottoman liberty style townhouse in Beyoglu. The location is very central, walking distance to istiklal street, one of the main centers in Istanbul. There are many cafes, restaurants, bars, and shopping, night life.

The space
This is a self-contained apartment that takes up an entire floor. It's located one level below our entrance floor. On the street side we have half windows and gets decent light during the day.

The apartment is furnished and you have:

- bedroom with double bed, two armchairs and desk with chair
- modest kitchen
- bathroom

I provide traditional turkish breakfast with homemade marmelades. It is 5 euro per person if you want to try it. You can use the washing machine free. I give traditional turkish cooking courses in my apartment. You can also join us as my quest. If you want to organise it for yourself for your group, whole program costs 50 euro. We buy ingredients togethe
neighborhood_overview:
Tarlabasi neighborhood was a middle class Greek neighbourhood when it was founded at the beginning of 19th century. The area is full of houses of eclectic Ottoman liberty style buildings and ours is one of them. By the 1950’s most of the greek population of the area had to immigrate to Greece because of political reasons.

The area was deserted and by the 1980’s got an internal immigration from the east part of Turkey mostly of Kurdish origin. In the neighbourhood very few Istanbulite Greeks remained, there is a big Kurdish community of rural origin, a gypsy community that settled down many years ago and work in the area as musicians, many transgender people, poor families from the East and the Balck Sea coast, expats who fell in love with decadent touch and reasonable prices of the area, young artists, old artists, students, and us.

We, in our extent, fell in love with the building and liked the spirit of the area that welcomes all the outsiders of the town. It
host_about:
I am from Adana, a town in old Cilicia, have been living in Istanbul for quite a while. I have worked in tourism sector for a long time now I am retired and want to know new people. I can speak english and I can join you through your visit to show Istanbul or giving you some local information. 

I love cooking and feel myself lucky to know both eastern and wester cooking traditions of Turkey and willing to give half day cooking classes to whom it may interest.

name: Bosphorus View, terrace Taksim flat
description:
Beautiful apartment in Cihangir, famous artists' district of Istanbul. Centrally located just a short walk from Taksim Square. Two terraces with stunning views of the Bosphorus. A double room, a single room, fifth floor. Internet Access

The space
The flat is located in the heart of the city! in the bohemian artists' neighborhood of istanbul: cihangir.

SPECIALITY: The house is on two floors, 2 terraces with stunning view on the Bosphorus: in front of you will find the magnificent intercontinental bridge, the green hills of Asian neighborhoods, the pier and mosques Uskudar (Scutari), the old buildings of Taksim.
The flat is a little special: i used to live here, a few years from now. so it looks more like home, that a cold flat for tourists. even after movving i left all, even some of my books, wall pictures...

FLAT: the apartment although small is comfortable and pleasant: furnished with taste and attention. equipped with all comforts.
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION: The flat is a 5-minute walk from taksim, the true center of istanbul, hundreds of restaurants, bars, café, live music, shopping centers along the way of istiklal, Metro is also there, all just 300 meters away.
It is here you want to be here to spend the evening in the incredible life of this great young and lively city. it is here that you will eat all the best regional foods, there are restaurants for all tastes and all budgets, it is here where you will be shopping for yourself or souvenirs, and you will drink in the myriad of bars and cafe', with live music, listening to music or watching the bosphorus ...
host_about:
We are a married couple, we choosed to live in Istanbuli out of love for this fascinating never-ending beautiful city, her history, her landscapes, her secrets, her pleasures...
Roza is young professional, a mother and a Turkish woman, assertive and resolute, fun and pleasure seeker when is needed, serious and strong when is needed.
Miko is a university teacher, a father, a gourmet and "home-chef"...

We love this city, its narrow streets and bazaars, its magnificent mosques and hidden churches, its superb landscapes and back-alley eateries...

When we are not traveling around the world, Miko teaches in the Turkish university.
We also work with travel agencies as a guide of walking tours into less-visited neighborhoods and hidden gems of the city for culture-aware travelers. Don't hesitate to ask if you are interested in having walking tours.
We Roza & Miko, and our sweet baby, are looking forward to hosting you in this most magnificent city of splendors, history, and life

name: Charming sea view from the balcony!
description:
It is a spacious room overlooking the main shopping street in Kadıköy. Still it is not noisy as it sounds because the street is mostly a pedestrian one. the room is located downstairs so those who stay there can enjoy the privacy of a floor.

The space
This room, just like the other rooms in the flat, has an amazing view of old city as well as a quiet atmosphere despite being in the middle of a very bustling shopping street.

Guests can use the living room and the study as well as the kitchen and balconies.
Linen and towels are provided.
Just accross the building is an opera house, or round the corner a cinema, countless restaurants and cafes on the street.

Very close (10 minutes walk) to pier in order cross the Bosporus to the European side.
It takes only 15 minutes walk to the Metrobus station.

The huge terrace serves as a giant escape from the buzz of city life and for a sip of a drink under the sun in a warm da
host_about:
I  rent the rooms in  my two-storey flat in the heart of Kadıköy with a splendid view of old İstanbul; namely the classical view of mosques and towers. There are three rooms upstairs overlooking a huge terrace towards the view. Downstairs there are three other rooms; one living room and one study for common use and another comfortable bedroom  and a biggish kitchen as well as the balcony in front of the living room. 
It is a spacious house with plenty of positive energy, sunshine, laughter and good food. Impression from the guests come from the same direciton; they emphasize the view as well as the atmosphere at home. You do not feel that the rooms are prepared for rent, on the contrary, you feel home. 

Apart from being an academic and a sagittarius, I am a good cook, a hospitable landlady  and an open minded intellectual. I like meeting people from different cultures and adding values to my life. 
 
You are more than welcome..

name: Style, character, frescoes, terrace views, Galata!
description:
This stylish yet homely apartment is on the 1st floor of a historically grand 19th century building not far from Galata Tower. It's spacious, stylish and comfortable. A few floors up on the roof-top, a shared terrace has views across the Golden Horn. The streets below are a characterful mix of cafe-restaurants, boutiques and residential apartment buildings.

We also offer a selection of 'experiences' with our local guides, to help you build your own genuine and memorable perspective on the city.

The space
This is one of Istanbul Place Apartments' restoration projects. One flight of original marble stairs take you up to the apartment and a few more floors up on the roof-top, a shared terrace has lovely views across the Golden Horn. You're welcome to take your drinks, meals or simply thoughts up there any time. The streets below the apartment are atmospheric with small, trendy boutiques and cafe-restaurants, yet are quiet and residential at night. Galata'
neighborhood_overview: Galata has a genuine, very welcoming and diverse community with an intriguing mix of cafes, restaurants, small grocery shops and artistic boutiques. Elegant 19th Century buildings line cobbled streets, with discoveries waiting around every corner. No matter where you wander, you’ll always find your way back to Galata Tower, which has been a well-loved landmark for the last 700 years.
host_about:
Our historic apartments make comfortable, secure, private short term homes and we understand and respect the issues of social distancing.

Julia, Tarkan and manager Taskin are certified by the UK Institute of Hospitality for 'Coronavirus: Taking Proactive Action'. High-touch areas are disinfected with alcohol spray and apartments are cleaned more thoroughly than ever, though we had a great reputation for our cleanliness before too!

*****

We've been busy, building up a collection of lovely historical apartments in Galata, our favourite part of Istanbul. We've personally renovated most of them and stay in them ourselves whenever we can. Recently we've added a sweet flat in the UK's Cotswolds into the mix.

20 years ago we met in Istanbul, Tarkan's home city, while I was there for a photography assignment. Since then we've led international lives together, based in Istanbul, Singapore and now England, my original country. 

Along the way we've raised our son, Eren, across the cultures as we've steadily grown this holiday apartment project, our second baby. We see it as a way to find balance in our family life and to always have a home in our best-loved city.  

We understand from our own experiences, what makes a great city-break stay and we try our very hardest to deliver it to you in Istanbul. For this we've won i-escape's global Guest Award for 'Best City Apartment' two years running and Tripadvisor's Certificate of Excellence 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 and 2020 (2021 isn’t announced yet ;) 

We’re also listed in many guidebooks. 

Your questions and booking will be handled by us. On your arrival our manager Taskin and  friendly team with their natural Turkish hospitality, will welcome you to your apartment, pass over your keys and explain practicalities and the neighborhood. You'll have as much or as little help as you choose and we're sure you'll soon feel at home in the cosmopolitan and very welcoming local community.

"Life is a balance of holding on and letting go" said Rumi.
We agree, do you?!

name: Cozy Room OLIVE   @Kaboom Guest House
description:
This flat is located in a traditional neighborhood in Beyoglu.

It is in downtown & walking distance to major spots in İstanbul.

Includes internet broad band, water, gas, electricy.

The space
This flat is in a very traditional neighborhood in Aynalı Çeşme, Beyoglu. (Precisely on the opposite side of the Ritz-Carlton Hotel & British Consulate).
It is located within walking distance to major spots in Istanbul: It will take you no more than 5 minutes to reach the center of the city, about 4 minutes to the Tepebaşı Bus Station, and 10 minutes to the Şişhane Tube Station. Also you can reach the Karaköy Ferries by bus within 12 minutes.

The flat is perfect for a group of people travelling together to a great Metropole like Istanbul! I am very much looking forward to hosting you here soon!

Guest access
The nightly rent includes internet broad band, house phone line, water, gas, electricity, and the council tax
host_about:
Hi 

I am Safak, 
I work on Kaboom's textile designs more often; My profession is fashion design. I am interested in applying my creativity to include everyday life experiences by using a clothing consumption loop. This is why I chose textile design as my field of study for my undergraduate degree. & Kaboom Guest House  helps me empower unique home textile and fashion creations.

I've always been interested in not just how human beings express their feelings by productions of art, but also how these expressions influence others. I worked at a comprehensive level on these relationships by researching your observations that arose from your experiences and feelings on our boutique designed textiles, decorated our rooms, which made by getting inspiration from young people drawings on basic human needs. By applying art elements within my designs; I aim to encourage young people to create, and reach those who follow their dream for being a part of bringing more creative & sustainable solutions for our one and only world !

name: Cute Attic room Beyoğlu, Istanbul
description:
This is a room in an Ottoman liberty style townhouse in Beyoglu. The location is very central, walking distance to istiklal street, one of the main centers in Istanbul. There are many cafes, restaurants, bars, and shopping, night life.

The space
This sunny room for one person is on the same floor as the terrace, which is the third floor (three levels up from the entrance floor). It gets plenty of light.

After entering the building, we have wooden spiral stairs that lead all the way up to the terrace on the third floor.

The room is furnished and you have:

- single bed
- wardrobe
- divan (couch)
- desk
- chair
- shared bathroom (one floor below)

I provide traditional turkish breakfast with homemade marmelades. It is 5 euro per person if you want to try it. You can use the washing machine free. I give traditional turkish cooking courses in my apartment. You can also join us as my quest. If you want
neighborhood_overview:
Tarlabasi neighborhood was a middle class Greek neighbourhood when it was founded at the beginning of 19th century. The area is full of houses of eclectic Ottoman liberty style buildings and ours is one of them. By the 1950’s most of the greek population of the area had to immigrate to Greece because of political reasons.

The area was deserted and by the 1980’s got an internal immigration from the east part of Turkey mostly of Kurdish origin. In the neighbourhood very few Istanbulite Greeks remained, there is a big Kurdish community of rural origin, a gypsy community that settled down many years ago and work in the area as musicians, many transgender people, poor families from the East and the Balck Sea coast, expats who fell in love with decadent touch and reasonable prices of the area, young artists, old artists, students, and us.

We, in our extent, fell in love with the building and liked the spirit of the area that welcomes all the outsiders of the town. It
host_about:
I am from Adana, a town in old Cilicia, have been living in Istanbul for quite a while. I have worked in tourism sector for a long time now I am retired and want to know new people. I can speak english and I can join you through your visit to show Istanbul or giving you some local information. 

I love cooking and feel myself lucky to know both eastern and wester cooking traditions of Turkey and willing to give half day cooking classes to whom it may interest.

Countries I Travel: United States of America, Japan, Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, Greece, Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Cyprus, Dominican Republic

name: renovated 19th cent heritage flat
description:
The house has been renovated according to its original design. It bears the stylistic characteristics of a house built in the first half of the 19th century.

The space
Fully furnished, newly renovated 19th century heritage apartment near Taksim directly by owner.

I am a visual artist and researcher based in Istanbul. I’m renting out my newly renovated apartment in Taksim - Aynalıcesme. Would you like to be the first guest in this special historic flat?

The house has been renovated according to its original design. It bears the stylistic characteristics of a house built in the first half of the 19th century, but the infrastructure has been carefully renewed to allow you to enjoy both a classic and modern lifestyle. There is hot water, natural gas, an in-apartment heating system, and limitless ADSL Internet access. The kitchen and bathroom, too, are fully renovated and the flat offers you an ideal way of living in İstanbul’s historic center.

name: Cosy double  room in Beyoglu 3
description:
This is a room in an Ottoman liberty style townhouse in Beyoglu. The location is very central, walking distance to istiklal street, one of the main centers in Istanbul. There are many cafes, restaurants, bars, and shopping, night life.

The space
This double room is the biggest room in the house, on the 1st floor (one level from the entrance floor) on the street side of the house. It gets plenty of light.

It also has the only "bow window" (see photo) in the building, which is very characteristic of Istanbul.

After entering the building, we have wooden spiral stairs that lead all the way up to the terrace on the third floor.

The room is furnished and you have:

- double bed
- divan (couch)
- wardrobe
- armchair
- wooden desk
- chair
- a small table
- shared bathroom (on the same floor)

I provide traditional turkish breakfast with homemade marmelades. It is 5 euro per person if
neighborhood_overview:
Tarlabasi neighborhood was a middle class Greek neighbourhood when it was founded at the beginning of 19th century. The area is full of houses of eclectic Ottoman liberty style buildings and ours is one of them. By the 1950’s most of the greek population of the area had to immigrate to Greece because of political reasons.

The area was deserted and by the 1980’s got an internal immigration from the east part of Turkey mostly of Kurdish origin. In the neighbourhood very few Istanbulite Greeks remained, there is a big Kurdish community of rural origin, a gypsy community that settled down many years ago and work in the area as musicians, many transgender people, poor families from the East and the Balck Sea coast, expats who fell in love with decadent touch and reasonable prices of the area, young artists, old artists, students, and us.

We, in our extent, fell in love with the building and liked the spirit of the area that welcomes all the outsiders of the town. It
host_about:
I am from Adana, a town in old Cilicia, have been living in Istanbul for quite a while. I have worked in tourism sector for a long time now I am retired and want to know new people. I can speak english and I can join you through your visit to show Istanbul or giving you some local information. 

I love cooking and feel myself lucky to know both eastern and wester cooking traditions of Turkey and willing to give half day cooking classes to whom it may interest.

neighborhood_overview: Moda is a part of a greater area named Kadıköy (historically, Chalcedon), which is the most populated area on the Anatolian side of Istanbul. All of its main attractions are only 10 minutes away: the historic market offering an abundance of fresh, organic foods; various shops, music & art houses and bookstores; the famous "bar street"; the Opera House; historic buildings and churches; and some of the best restaurants in the city.

neighborhood_overview: Taksim is a main transportation hub and a popular destination for both tourists and the native population of Istanbul. Istiklal Caddesi (Istiklal Avenue), a long pedestrian shopping street, ends at this square, and a nostalgic tram runs from the square along the avenue, ending near the Tünel (1875) which is the world's second-oldest subway line after London's Underground (1863). Surrounding Taksim Square are numerous travel agencies, hotels, restaurants, pubs, and international fast food chains.
host_about:
Hey, I am Oytun and I'm 33.Normaly i am graphic designer painter, i am doing my profession but, it is very few time, generally i am staying in my building with my guest. Born and raised in Istanbul and I'm living at Taksim which is the city center of Istanbul. Lovely and lively area. You can feel the heartbeat of the city in here. 

I'm interested in arts mostly. I'm into architecture, literature and movies and (as a side art) Video Games! And I also love to meet new and foreign people and love to chat with them (as long as they want it too of course) I hate jibber-jabber. Don't worry. So that's why I have rented a building at Taksim and now I'm renting the rooms in it through airbnb. I have 4 different listings/rooms in AirBnb and they are all in this same building which I am the manager of. We have a lovely staff in the building which will help you with all the things you need during your stay.

We are like a family in here with my staff. So you would definitely feel like you're at home. I can guarantee that.
